title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The characters are wonderful and the acting superb.  My disappointment is with the author who chose to eliminate 2 main characters in one season, with viewers emotionally attached to them.  It leaves me not able to trust the author in the future to repeat the same bad decision.  Therefore, many of my friends and myself included do not wish to be drawn in again to a story line that can blow up on us again.  The death of one main character is more than enough.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is a great series! I love the character development and twists in plot line.  It is easy to get hooked on the show.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I simply loved season 1. And 2. I could hardly wait. For season 3 and boy have I been disappointed. This show was refreshing and interesting the writers seemed to keep the show moving yet stay within the historic accuracy of the times. Sybil's death in childbirth was totally believable for the time, and lavinia's death from spanish flu also believable but Mathew's death from a. Motor vehicle accident on the very day that his first child was born. Was simply over the top and not even believable, to the ridiculous. I do not want to watch the news being broke or the grief......I think I will rewatch seasons 1 and 2 and dream of another beter ending. Three stars because I did love. Season 1 and 2 but Sadly season 3 imploded

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Love the fact that I finally could watch the season without all the commercial. In todays busy world, it's nice to take a weekend or two to watch a program you didn't have time to watch during the season.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Even with the crushing ending of the season, this is the most beautifully shot and acted television I've ever watched.  Hugh Bonneville and Dame Maggie Smith are remarkable in their roles and the honest and loving way this period is portrayed is incredibly refreshing.  We're re-watching season 3 ahead of the start of season 4 and continue to be impressed with this production.  Highly recommend Downton Abbey Season 3!
summary: The most beautiful show on television - ever

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I’m a cable cutter, so I’ve been catching up on a lot of older shows I had just never got around to watching before. Downton Abbey was one of them. I had heard good things about it and I knew it was the sort of show I’d like, but what surprised me a little was HOW MUCH I liked it. Binge watching to me is watching two or three episodes in a row. Downton Abbey had me up until 4:30am. I just had to watch ‘the next one’. Furthermore, I’m cheap. Friends say frugal. Potay-to, potah-to. When it came to Season (Series) 4, there was absolutely NO question that I was going to pay for it. In fact, I cannot remember how much the season was or if I even looked. Didn’t care. I HAD to see it. Alas, I am now a broken shell of a woman. I will have to wait almost another year before I can catch up with Mary, Anna, and the crew. Please be warned. If you have loved ones, a job, or any sort of life at all, be very careful of taking the road to Downton Abbey. You may not want to leave. EVER!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I ordered my set the day it was released, (2 days after the broadcast of episode 5 of 9) so now I've been able to finish the season just before the broadcast of # 7 - I guess PBS thought people would buy/watch no matter what.I bought "Original UK", it's American DVD format so no worries there, very clear picture and excellent color too, the DVD is so clear that if you can't afford Blu ray you surely won't miss much. I think the set of "extras" for season 3 may be the best in the series, and worth watching even if you don't like Downton. You can even watch them first, as I did, and not really get an episode spoiled with advance details- good stuff.The stories are still at their high level of quality, the detail of the sets is amazing, great casting- better all around  than just about any "American" television.I'm waiting for season 4 now, already planning to buy it too.
summary: Great addition to your collection, worth the money

I can't wait to see what happens years into the future at Downton so I hope it stays on for a long, long time.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love period pieces, almost to a fault, so it's no surprise that I love this series. Many period pieces are enjoyable while being quite predictable, but that cannot be said about Downton Abbey. There are surprises around every turn and each new bend makes me even more emotionally attached to the characters. Very entertaining & can't wait to see what will happen in the upcoming season!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Amazing series!  Just love it!  Very sad season though; hope that isn't spoiling anything by saying that!  Looking forward to Season 4!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The writing on this show is so masterfully crafted that after 3 seasons, I still wonder how it is that I'm so engaged in a families/community's lives.  To be honest, the lives of the Crowley's should mean very little to people - - they throw dinner engagements and draw very stiff lines in their moral compasses, yet you find that there is a pacing to the show that just draws your attention.  Perhaps the tertiary character of time/history is what is so appealing.  It's almost like we are growing with the characters through a period of time that was so globally progressive, so forward moving in technology and liberty, that you feel akin to the ride.  Here here Downton!  Great Season!...and I look forward to many more

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Before watching, I couldn't figure out what "the big deal" was about this show.  Now I know.  This movie is so different from American movies today.  Although there are a few topics better left out, there is no violence, no nudity and very little sex.  This series proves that shows can be popular for good characters, great writing and interesting fashions\scenery.  You don't need those other tawdry things to boost ratings.  I only wish I could get MORE of this show!!!
summary: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this show!!!  Can't get enough of it!!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The quality of drama continues in both creative writing and portrayal of the saga surrounding the manor house at Downton Abbey. This series has become the benchmark for period portrayals of the very difficult survival and often tragic demise of landed gentry of Great Britain.  The third season of Downton Abbey did not fail to entertain, allure, and leave me hungry for the next episode. The plot continues to weave a tale worth waiting for as I look forward to season four.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Great show. Clean; conservative; family oriented; historically inspiring.  I just wish that things will always end as I expect, but they don't... just like real life.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The ending was so unexpected and yet, nothing runs smoothly for this family. I will not give away the ending, but highly recommend one watches this entire series from the beginning. Was so happy to see it available on Amazon Prime. Pays to have that membership. Has saved me a fortune as I just can't get enough of the dramas. This series is probably the best ever done on any network, but the BBC certainly knows how to do it right. The drama never stops with a few shocks along the way. See what it was like to live at the turn of the 19th-20th century. The story never grows old as seen through new eyes. Family togetherness is the answer and sometimes the problem. The staff of servants are the best. Think it was easy to be a maid or kitchen helper or footman? No, but somethings still haven't improved to this day. Does money guarantee a happy life....NO! This is a must see. Watch before January when the next season premiere.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love watching Downton Abbey on my kindle fire while I do my treadmill workout. The show is offered through kindle as a membership feature at no extra charge when you purchase an Amazon Prime membership. Most of the freebees don't appeal to me, but this one certainly does.I am a great fan of the show, but I must admit that I find Seasons I and II more captivating than Season III. I suppose my fascination is with the contrasts in culture/fashion/home life between the 1910s/20s era and ours.If you haven't seen the show, give it a try.  Prim, yet sassy, Cousin Violet is a treasure.
summary: Downton Abbey - be enchanted by another era

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I broke my arm and had to stay in bed for a few days so I bought Season 1-3 and loved it!The characters were lovable and hateable at the same time! However I am quite disappointed at how season 3 ended.... BoooooI enjoyed learning about the life of that era and from the view of the servants. Very interesting!! Makes me wish we taught all children these days about etiquette, manners and proper socialites. I appreciated the modest behaviors of the women as well.I would recommend this to all girls age 15+ and all women. I think men would like it too but not in my household! HahaThe only reason I say 15+ is because of occasional swearing and some episodes have inappropriate sexual relations.
summary: What kind of ending was that?!?! :(

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I will begin by saying that I wasn't too sure that I'd like the show before I started watching it and even a few episodes in. The reason is that there is so much going on, so many characters that are referenced that it can be difficult to keep up. However, this uncertainty didn't last long for me. I am now emotionally invested in the characters and the future of Downtown Abbey.This show is set in the pre and post Great War. There are little things that are weaved into the storyline that remind us of what we now take for granted: swivel chairs, toasters, and cars, for example.There are bigger issues that affect the characters of Downtown Abbey such as World War I, the women's rights movement, gay rights, and Modernism. There is definitely a tug of war between conservative English values and the direction the modern world is taking.On top of that, we have characters who are dealing with timeless issues such as love, heartbreak, economic downturns, etc. All of the characters add something special to the show. Even if something doesn't add up in the moment, it will eventually come back and make sense at some point near or far. The episodes resolve certain topics, which are settled by the end of an episode. But there are also other topics that continue on throughout the seasons.I can't get enough of Downton Abbey and look forward to watching future seasons.
summary: Wasn't sure if I'd like the show going into it, but ended up loving it!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Series 1 of Downton was so flawless. Series 2 was a bit more soapy and contrived, but good still. Season 3 has quite a bit of soapy drama, contrived drama, and some ridiculous circumstances to accommodate actors leaving the show (which was originally supposed to end after the first series, so I can't blame them, but it's tough to see them handled in such a way after building relationships with them for 15 years in show-time. Still loved it (marathoned it in two days) but it's hard not to compare to the incredible start of the series.

review_text: I had already seen Season 3 twice: once as it ran on PBS in Jan-Feb and again via the DVD from our local library.  During August our daughter was visiting us from Baltimore and, since her husband doesn't care to watch it with her, she had watched Season 3 on PBS alone.  So we did as we had done in 2012 when she was here: after everyone else had gone to bed, we settled down with some snacks and wine and watched Season 3 == several nights in a row.  It was just as good as when we'd seen it previously but more fun to laugh and cry our way through it together.  The BBC really know how to do TV right!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This show is wonderful. The outfits, hairstyles, the words they use is right on. You can see that a lot of painstaking research was done to get it right. The house is a dream. Would love to live there. It takes you back in time and you can see yourself in their shoes whether you are Lady Mary or Mrs. Patmore and you see their lives and dreams and what could be. Of course it is like a soap opera with the good and the bad. It is sad that we lost some great cast members like Lady Sybil, Matthew Crawley (cried) and O'Brien but she brought the evil side to the story. I look forward to every Sunday now that the show is back. I think people of all ages will love this show.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: "I'm not gonna like it!" I thought it was gonna be a boring English series, stuffy and lame. Dry acting and plots that just lay there.I was so glad I was wrong. Downton Abbey is addictive, interesting, intriguing, witty, wry, thought-provoking and so much more. I've always held that without great writing, a show is nothing. But, this series has more than just great writing. The direction, lighting, cinematography, in short, everything is top shelf. The attention to detail is awesome.It all of this comes together to create a whole that seems effortless and natural. It is art. The Brits have outdone themselves. You won't be disappointed, except that you waited this long to begin watching it.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: As with seasons 1 & 2 this is the best show...I have re-watched the first three seasons getting prepared for season 4...I have to say that I was sorry to see Matthew go...I loved Matthew and Mary as a couple. You really feel like you know the whole family. Highly recommend.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: At this point in the series it isn't hard to figure out who will stay or go, live or die, etc. Nevertheless, I really enjoy the setting and watching the changes in fashion and technology and how certain characters react to them, and especially the banter between the characters as they try to get along with each other. My only criticism is that the attempts to address some modern issues are too transparent and simplistic. I don't mind entrainment making a point as long as it's not at the expense of entertaining me. By remaining true to the period and issues of the time I think the audience will see and appreciate how society has evolved to what it is today. Otherwise I'm liking forward to more.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Basically a novel on screen.  It takes a little time to get to know all the characters, but once you do, it becomes your window to another time in the not so distant past. Great writing and acting!  You soon begin to empathize with the people and their lives.  Many story lines weave through each episode, but unlike allot of other recent series, it is solid and unified, telling its story completely.
summary: Great series, very entertaining without the typical Hollywood Fx and hype.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I had never watched Downton Abbey before but started a knitting club that was using season 4 as clues to a pattern.  I found seasons 1-3 of the show on Amazon Prime and watched it on my kindle or via my iPhone streamed via apple TV to my TV.  I loved it.  The thing I realized partway through was that this is the UK version which is basically the unedited version. On regular TV, we get the PBS version which is edited to fit a specific timeframe so there are pieces missing.  This was a great way to catch up on the series all at once. Very good show and the UK version was excellent.
summary: Watching Dowton Abbey seasons 1-2 on Amazon Prime was the best idea

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Matthew's death saved me from having to watch another episode.Mary and O'Brien are really the same person.  Too negative.Branson could be a much more interesting story.  A lot happened between Ireland and England in 1918-1920's.The negative barbs that fly during the show fits today's "I got one up on you" mindset.Robert has been placed into his position to be the decision maker throughout his entire life.  Now the characters around him belittle him for sometimes making the final hard decision.  The show has made him out to be the "out of touch" patriarch.  I feel this is a shame.  At the end of the day all he is trying to do is protect his family.I keep waiting for Anna Bates to start singing The hills are alive....I just can't keep watching.  I watched the first 3 seasons with my wife, but I've hit my max with Downton Abby.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I didn't expect to be hooked by this series ... but I am.This series is the best of the BBC.  The costumes, sets, locations and everything related to creating a quality period drama are mesmerizing.  The acting is superb and all the more convincing because it is understated (typical of the Brits).What I like best about DA is the realistic peek it gives us into the lives of a noble family AND the lives of their servants, too.  What one of us Americans hasn't seen the castles and huge halls in England and wondered what sort of people once lived there and what type of lives they might have led before the modern era?Now you can find out!  :)

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I watched Season 3 of Downton Abbey with many and varied emotions, as usual.  I still love the acting, the writing, and the progression of the characters as well as the story line!  I am now anxiously awaiting Season 4, along with the better part of almost 12,000 of my fellow reviewers, and have begun a campaign to get my husband to watch this series... preferably from Season 1 so that I can watch it all over again, myself!Of course, there were a few things that I didn't like.  I may be in the minority regarding this, but I did not like Shirley MacLaine as Cora's mother.  I thought that her performance was mostly forced and dry, although it was well-written in the fact that Martha Levinson was intended to be Violet's opposite yet equal force.  I felt that Ms MacLaine was only moderately successful in the role, but that's just my opinion.I also felt that the Bates story line was a bit overdone, and was glad when it came to a conclusion.  The season's ending, of course, was a stunner, but I'm not believing anything until I see it in a coffin.  (That's my ostrich impression for the day.)  Mrs. Hughes and her health condition was riveting; I felt for her every step of the way. I did not too much like the flighty-cousin (Rose) story line, but I did like her kindness to Anna, and the fact that she obviously has some kind of drama coming around the bend.I still recommend this series; I do love to watch it, and can't wait to see what happens!

review_text: My family and I love watching Downton Abbey. When it went off of On Demand, we bought it from Amazon as soon as we could. However, when we first started watching we noticed that the first disc had sound to video delay of about one second. The second disc was no better, but we weathered through it because we love Downton Abbey. When we put in the third disc, our DVD player ejected it and said "Disc not supported". We have a blu-ray player and we tried it at least 4 other times, to no avail.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: It reminds me of Pride and Prejudice - but more down to earth and more in depth.  The story starts in 1912 with the Titanic sinking, leaving no heir to the ancestral manor.  It centers on one aristocratic family with 3 grown daughters and grandmother.  It shows the same feelings of pride, betrayal, jealousy, loneliness, love, envy, prejudices etc. all mirrored in the servants and upper class.  It is a changing world with the coming and going of WWI - but not everyone can embrace the new world - destruction of manor life, woman's right to vote, work.  I absolutely love the story; it is so real and can  apply to any of us in any age.  Life is change and in this period of history, it comes swiftly after so many years of being stagnant.  There is sorrow and joy, overcoming obstacles with perseverance and love.  The characters are real (the countess is an American) and so very different.  It is like looking at a pocket of the world with all of its qualities and evils in this one small sample, Downton Abbey.  It is the BEST I have seen in a very long time.
summary: Powerful and very real life story

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love Downton Abbey, and was hooked from the outset. I feel quite invested in it, actually, so I was disappointed in some of the storylines in season three. There are three examples I specifically felt, well, unsatisfied with all three situations: first, Mr. Bates' prison woes, which dragged on and focused too much on the inner prison corruption, which was never fully explored, and conversely neglected Anna's detective work. Second, the whole relationship with Tom and the maid, whose name escapes me at the moment. I am completely unsure about Tom's part in it, and because of that, I am not sure why it was an issue at all. Social climbing that crosses class boundaries? Probably, but it was unsatisfying to me because it was so cursorily explored. I was glad to see it end, but learned nothing new from it. Finally, of course, there is the death of Matthew which was just too melodramatic for words. Awfully handled. Any soap opera fan could have come up with such a sob story, and I was so disappointed. There were so many other ways to handle it - why go with something so trite?Now that I've aired my grievances, however, I want to make sure I give credit for the dramas that reeled me in: Belowstairs storylines kept me enthralled: Thomas B/O'Brien schemes are wonderful, Mrs. Hughes and Carson, and the perils of Ethel - what a cautionary tale there! Upstairs, the Dowager Lady Grantham, of course, goes without saying - I can never watch an episode without thinking, "I should write that down so I can use it later!". All of the storylines (with the exception of Matthew's death and Tom's near-dalliance?? are lovely. Robert's brief affair - his struggle there was much more deftly handled than the former. But the shining spot in season three for the haves, in my opinion, is Lady Edith's storyline. What grit she has! If ever a woman would fly in the face of tradition - and we can see that she will - it is Edith. THAT makes sense.Too much? I must stop. This is getting ridiculous, and I have things to do! Thanks for giving me a forum!
summary: A little soapier than Seasons 1 and 2...

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downtown Abbey a hit for the 21st century! The challenges of an English Lord, his family and their servants unfold as they face constant changes brought about by the dawning of the 20th century! Automobiles replace horse drawn carriages, buffet stye cabaret nights replace formal dining, and class lines blur and reform as the inhabitants live their lives each day at the manor house. But human nature never changes, and the politics of  life 'below stairs' and sibling rivalries above continue apace. It is a story to make you appreciate the difficulty of trying to be a good man or woman in any situation. The actors are amazing, the writing on target for the period with a few nods to modern slang, and as always the locations and sets bring the place alive. Great work once again, Mr. Fellowes and crew!
summary: Downtown Abbey Draws a Full House!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Though I had some minor quibbles, I enjoyed Season 3 of "Downton Abbey" a lot.  It proved it's still an addictive, well-acted, stylish soap.  It was a lot of fun even though I didn't like all that went down at Downton this year....SPOILER WARNING!For instance, it made no sense that Martha Levinson would come to town for Mary's nuptials but not Edith's wedding, Sybil's funeral or the birth of Mary and Matthew's son.  (Perhaps she'll show up at the start of Season 4 to meet her new grandson and mourn Matthew.) It also made no sense (and infuriated me) that Mr. Bates felt bad enough for Thomas that he went to bat for him when he was going to be fired without a job reference.  Given how poorly Thomas had always treated Mr. Bates, it was hard to believe that anyone--even Bates--would be so pious, so forgiving.  And the reappearance of Ethel just so she could give up her baby didn't seem to serve much purpose except to give Matthew's mother a new project (and cause friction between her and the Crawleys after she put Ethel to work in her house).That's not to say there weren't great dramatic moments this year....Mary and Matthew's wedding kicked things off with lots of style; Edith getting jilted at the altar was unfortunate but very entertaining; Sybil's death was shocking but forced the Crawleys to accept and respect Tom as a member of the family, and it drove a wedge between Robert and Cora.  (Leave it to Violet to find a way to bring them back together!) I was sad to see Matthew die because the show's Juliet has now lost her Romeo.  I enjoyed watching their relationship blossom over the first two seasons, and I thought the show handled their short married life well by having them butt heads from time to time.  They were never boring, but now that part of the story has come to an abrupt (and unplanned) end.  I know this isn't what the creator had in mind for the couple, so I hope the show can survive the loss of Matthew.END SPOILERSI believe in rating not just the show itself but the Blu-ray too.  Like its predecessors, this season's Blu-ray release of "Downton Abbey" is presented in 1080i and 2.0 stereo (according to the back of the case).  Other websites have stated in their professional reviews that the video is actually 1080p.  Either way, it looks great.  However, the fact that the audio consists of 2 channels only is ridiculous.  In 2013, it's commonplace for shows to be released with 5.1 mixes, and this show would certainly benefit from the extra channels.  And like its predecessors, this season's release has neither a printed nor on-screen episode guide with descriptions of each episode, nor does it have a season play feature that remembers where you left off.  I find these omissions inexcusable given the fact that the episodes are simply numbered (not entitled) on screen (except for the special episode that aired on Christmas in England).  Not even the disc labels tell you which episodes are contained on which discs: you have to pop them into your player to find that out.  For these reasons, I'm taking a full star off this product's rating.Though I was a bit disappointed here and there, I still found myself riveted to the show.  I look forward to Season 4 with great enthusiasm! Highly recommended.
summary: Still A Jolly Good Time to Be Had

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: There is no other show on television that plays with our emotions and moods as successfully as Downton Abbey. The classy story of the Grantham family and the parallel world of their servants will involve you, thrill you, make you cry, laugh, cringe, and repeatedly draw you back for more! If you are the kind of person who has time on their hands, any Downton Abbey disc should come with a disclaimer: Do NOT watch unless you want to get hopelessly addicted!Sure it's a wee bit soapy, and some scenes border on the melodramatic and the sentimental, but heck, who cares? That's the entire reason it succeeds; it's pure unadultered escapism entertainment. Well that and Downton Abbey's superb cast, led by the impeccableHugh Bonnevilleand the greatElizabeth McGovern, with the incomparableMaggie Smithgiving a fiery supporting lead, with Dan Stevens, Brendan Coyle, and Michelle Dockery rounding out the talented main cast.Add to that excellent cinematography, rich costumes, beautiful sets and scenery, and authentic dialogue, and you have the makings of a fine show indeed. But when you add to THAT the brilliant human emotion, tangled relationships, colorful, sympathetic characters, wry humour, and a smart, fast-paced plot...you have the makings of near-perfection as only Masterpiece Theatre can make. This is Downton Abbey, and while it is not as epic as Game of Thrones, or as riveting as Breaking Bad or Person of Interest, Downton Abbey is like no other show on television. Your moods will rise and fall with the episodes and the fate of your favourite characters, be it Nurse O'Brien (who we all love to hate), or Edith Crawley (who we all hate to love) and every time you pop in the disc, you will be swept away for a wonderful evening of escapism to the lush mansion of Downton.Here's to much Downtonian delight in the future! 4.5 Stars!
summary: Soapy, but addictive, exciting, and classy!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm not sure why, but these Amazon episodes of Season 3 are missing about five minutes per episode.  When I compared episode 3 on Amazon to the PBS-broadcast version, I found most of the missing material to be important for viewers to understand what is happening in the series.  Amazon advertises this as "original UK version" but in seasons 1 and 2, the UK versions have more running time and the USA PBS version are the shortened edited versions.  Very confusing.  If you want the most for your money, wait a few weeks for the DVD's and make sure these episodes run the full 53 minutes instead of the edited 48 minute versions.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: .This review is of Seasons 1, 2, and the first episode of Season 3.  I'll be watching the rest of Season 3 as it becomes available.I want to avoid spoilers or plot giveaways, so I'll just describe overall characteristics of the show.This fascinating, serious drama evinces a subtle, generous love of humanity, and makes you love humanity, the wonderful qualities, the foibles, and the frailties, and how all that stands up to the darker side of human nature.  The writing is excellent; the show's plot always has me on edge.  Out of dozens of characters two or three are bad and rather wicked, but on the whole it seems every episode moves me at some point to shed a tear or two because of the kindness and goodness and generosity of various characters.  And it's not that the writers set out in a contrived way to do that.  It all unfolds very naturally out of the drama itself.The show is not a comedy, but there are touches of humor here and there that manage to be moving even as they amuse.  The show is about an extended family of the British aristocracy and their servants.  The daughters are looking to get married.  So are some of the servants.  There is even a murder.  Oh, yes, and World War I is going on during a number of episodes, involving all the characters in huge changes.  And it turns out there are some beautifully noble qualities in some of these titled nobles, as well as in a number of their servants.  The few characters with a more or less sinister side just add more drama, nuance, and depth to a show that on the whole reveals the best of human beings, without oversimplifying them.  Something about this show trusts human beings.  It makes me think that perhaps the best of Britain is something "very good indeed."
summary: Great story with a heart of gold: Seasons 1, 2, and first episode of Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is an absolutely wonderful series. So glad I got into it.  I've learned so much about the period and issues I didn't know about. It's well worth it.I've now seen the whole series 3 times, and I'm still watching.Yeah to the Brits for another quality series!  Thank you!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love Downton Abbey. I'm new to it. I streamed Season 1 through Season 3 over the last couple months. Halfway through the first episode I was totally hooked. I love the characters and the way they and the story lines develop from episode to episode. It's great to see the clothes and decor and manners from that era and part of the world. Season 3 was heartbreaking though. During the last episode I shouted out loud, "No!!" I think many watchers did the same. How could it be? I was so saddened by the events of the final episode in that season that I just sat there staring into space, and finally just went to bed! Kind of funny to be so into any show that it would have that effect on me, but it did. I'm really looking forward to Season 4.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I really don't watch TV.  I find most of it drivel, but I love love love Downton Abbey.  I love how it moves us through the passage of time, how the characters evolve with change, their struggles, and the many storylines that exist.  We get a fantastic view into the upstairs and the downstairs of the English past.  If you love costumes then you will be in love.  The costuming is absolutely exquisite.  The work on these is amazing.  Once again the show how styles changed through time is beautifully done.  They respect the various age groups and the research here is fantastic.  The acting is fabulous.  We are so lucky to have such great people working together.  I am not very eloquent and this show deserves eloquence.  If you do watch it try and see it from the beginning so you can love each time period all the trials and tribulations and also the joys.  I don't miss an episode.  When I am not home I catch up by buying the episode on Amazon and watching it instantly.  I've also pre-ordered the seasons over the past years.  Don't miss this series.  It is another one of the BBC genius pieces that will long remain as a world wide favorite.
summary: BBC Genius Series - History, Costumes, Actors, and Plot -- everything in one package!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I laugh out loud and will burst into tears, sometimes during one episode! The acting is superb and the writing just as good. I'm not normally a big fan of drama, but there is enough comedy relief to make it enjoyable. The character depth developed within each and every person you "meet" on this show will make you develop attachments much like you would with people in your real life. I find myself thinking about what they might be doing as I'm going about my own daily business, crazy as that sounds!  I also wish sometimes I could live that wealthy, aristocratic lifestyle, and the scenery... Don't get me started on how beautiful the environment is, and they provide plenty of visual shots to really enjoy!
summary: Best show I've watched in a long time!

review_text: I am hooked on this literate and sometimes campy soap. With good one liners and excellent actors delivering those lines, I just had to watch season three, even though I did know ahead how it would end, sadly. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I was hooked on Downton Abbey midway through episode 1 of Season 1...Season 2 only got better, and now with Season 3, I couldn't imagine it would be even better but it was! The end of the season was heartbreaking, but true to Downton form, it kept you wanting more and didn't sugar coat real life. These tragic things make the show stay real. The writers are phenomenal as the dialogue is superb. I cannot wait to get into Season 4...ending Season 3 was the kind of letdown that you feel like when you finish reading a terrific book. I highly recommend it!
summary: Exquisite! Like sipping a fine wine and savoring every taste!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I can not say enough about the DONTON ABBEY Season 3 THE UK VERSION. I did a marathon veiwing over a 3 weekend peroid to catch up on all the parts of the story I had missed. I am so very glad that I not only did Season I and 2, but finally did Season 3 as I got hooked on the US version at the beginning of Season 4. I am now able to see what happened and to follow how each person became such a reality to me, like getting to know and old friend all over again. I cried , laughed, but was in awe of the costuming that occurred over the course of time. I made new friends, and got to see why these people become who they were. I must say that Dame Maggie, has become my ideal perception of a Dowager who really has a way with words. They all, are amazing but the UK version, was better than the few older ones that I had viewed. Oh how I am so in awe of what is to come...

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: For those of us who remember Upstairs Downstairs, this will probably disappoint. There are some good performances, and some stinkers, and most fall in between the two. For me, the characters in most control of their roles through the twists turns and romp of it all seem to be Jim Carter (Carson), Phyllis Logan (Mrs. Hughes), Penelope Wilton (Isobel Crawley) Leslie Nichol (the cook) and the most satisfying of all, Maggie Smith (the Dowager Countess). The rest of the cast was very mediocre as I recall, but I feel the writing would have challenged any of them. Less than stellar writing aside, I felt that Elizabeth McGovern's acting was insipid as she seemed like a languid cat too tired to really bother with anything and seemed to be watching herself from offstage in a hurry to get it over with.  I am holding this up to an impossibly high standard by comparing it to Upstairs Downstairs, and I should close by saying that although it is not a masterpiece, it has some merit and certainly entertains more than the usual fare.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Be careful! Downton Abbey is addicting, and  I haven't yet heard of a DAA group to help us recover! My heart has stopped a number of times, and I've had to be resuscitated in order to continue watching. I love the opportunity to take a walk back in history, and insert myself into history of the English nobility. We've come a long way in manners and  attitudes, buta;;in a;;, we haven't changed all that much as as humans.
summary: I have become a part of the family or the staff!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I feel like this season of Downton Abbey was rushed through. Why so many 2 hours episodes? Why did they have to kill off the 2 best characters in the show. Sybil's death was bad enough; I know people who cried for days. The thing about Downton that kept it so special was how real the characters are & how attached people became to them. The ending was horrific! I still can't get poor Matthew's face with his eyes open & blood running down out of my head. Not very classy Downton, more like a horror movie. After 2 season's of watching Mary & Matthew squable & flirt, then finally fall in love, this was no way to end the show. I could think of many ways to have written him & Sybil out of the story without killing them. I knew before the season started that Matthew was leaving; which kind of ruined it for me, but i never, ever would have anticipated this. Mary was loveable with Matthew; he brought out the best in Mary. Now is she going to go back to the brazen, sharp tongued bully she was in season one?

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Oh, how I resisted watching this....my sister kept telling me how good it was, and usually, over decades of experience, I've learned to ignore her recommendations with good reason.  Downton Abbey has forced me to re-evaluate that knee-jerk response, at least this time.Nothing about this show does not please, satisfy and gratify the viewing experience.  I have to say I am glad I waited until 3 seasons were available, as I am a marathon viewer (LOST in 2 months, etc)....only downside is having to wait now for season 4, and decide if I can handle a once-a-week experience versus obsessive single-sitting through multiple episodes.  But, that's a decision for a few months down the road.Love me a good series, and now they all are compared thusly:  "Good, but no Downton Abbey".  Best. Thing. Ever.
summary: Sets the standard for all future television

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Wonderfully composed story series about an actual place and time amid the tremors of a changing and complex social structure.  I, living in the US am intrigued by the haves and haves not, put in place before one is born.  No middle class leaves an abruptness and starkly different expectations which result in resentment.  Season 3 still involves the affects of World War ! and the hopes for a looser social interpretation by those wishing to bend the rules.  I love the characters and how they have evolved.  There is a richness to which I have come to expect from this series and have not been disappointed.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Yes, I was late to jump on the bandwagon of DA love. After being hooked during several August 2013 Southwest Air flights where Season 1 was offered for free, I got on the public library waiting list for seasons 2 & 3. It only took a few weeks to get the Season 2 DVDs, but by January 2014, I still hadn't received the email that Season 3 was available. I had just signed up for Amazon Prime and was so pleased that I no longer had to wait to move to the top of the library waiting list! Everything worked well to view DA EXCEPT, apparently it's not available out of the country. I had a long two week wait between episodes 3 & 4 until I was back in the US. Other than that problem, I recommend both DA Season 3 and Amazon Prime. I'm not the type of person to want to own DVD's and watch again so this is a great option for me.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: It's this simple. Anyone who has loved the show Seasons 1 and 2 will love Season 3 as well. So, whether I say 4 or 5 stars is totally irrelevant. Same excellent performances, stories, art direction, cinematography.SPOILERS:For those who have already seen Season 3, there were a few really exasperating storylines, the first just doesn't make any dramatic logic:1) Thomas, who was known by both downstairs and upstairs to be a conniving schemer who'd done more than one bad turn toward Bates, trying to implicate him in made-up theft -- enough to earn the scorn of both Lord Grantham and Mr. Carson -- goes thru yet another story cycle where he is to be sent on his way, but no, yet again he is suddenly forgiven hocus pocus, he's a grand old chap, and it's back to same old Thomas in his dapper black tails. I found it disingenuous.2) Oh geez, then Saint Mr. Bates, such a good honorable, decent, kind man, finally is out of prison and united with his wife, and what does he do? Goes and interferes to help Thomas get a great reference, which then becomes cause for keeping him on staff. Such a stupid move. Which leads to 3)3) I loved the whole Anna & Mr. Bates story in Season 1... Then having the difficulties in Season 2, and seeing the honorable man Bates encouraging Anna to forget him and find a better man, well it was chivalrous at first, and my feelings were positive. But as this continued, after time & again Anna would express with no ambiguity that she accepted him the way he is no matter what, yet he'd mope about and send her away, it started to get tiresome to me --- not Anna, she's never had one false note in her character nor the actress in her completely well rounded performance. But Mr. Bates' over and over again putting her off, and the battle with the ex-wife, handled, then still there, started to grow tiresome. Only to lead to this whole murder thing with the wife, it seemed over the top to me... like this guy is a more elaborate Charlie Brown from the Charles Schulz comic strip, nothing ever goes his way. ... So then Season 3 and oh my God endless repetitious scenes of Bates in prison, with same expression on his face, it all could have been shot in one day and intercut into 6 or 8 scenes in 5 or 6 episodes, just boring. The only thing that made it interesting is just watching Anna's performance and the way she speaks. ... So all the more reason when Bates finally gets out of prison, due to this tireless work of Anna, he goes and plays the martyr yet again with his lend-a-brotherly-hand to Thomas -- the guy who caused him so much pain and grief.and 4) as for the finale of Season 3, I can only review it in relation to learning, after the fact, that the actor wanted out at the conclusion of his 3-year contractr, just as the actress playing Sybil wanted out after her 3-years was up... so they had to write them both out.  So the 2 deaths were a bit much story-wise. Sybil's was completely believable and well handled. Matthew's was, well what can you say.
summary: Impossible to explain this review/rating without SPOILERS --------------------

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have NEVER been someone who followed a show. I scoffed at those who did, until Downton!! I am addicted...and I mean addicted!! It is my break from reality! I am a Registered Nurse and when I get home and just want to relax and float away on a cloud....I turn on my Kindle and watch the Seasons 1, 2 and now 3!!! Well written so that all members of the cast are integral parts of the whole...I want to know about each one! The surroundings and the attire is magnificent! Maggie is utterly fantastic- her sarcasm is just too cute!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Great entertainment, but for the 1st time felt like the writers let the values of today color the story from the past.  I don't think a master of the house would have a allowed a suspected homosexual man to be his private valet.  Since that was a very intimate position.  If not for any other reason than they might be suspected of the same behavior or bringing shame on the house name.  I do think the compassion that was exercised could have happened though.  We've come a long way from those days!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The actors are so believable in their roles in this show. I like coming back to it and watching the plot unfold. I especially like the historical references to a time and place I will never be able to live in or otherwise understand. I wonder how much of Julian Fellowes' writing is research and how much is "wisdom of hindsight"- that is looking at where civilization is today and trying to build a historical context for it. Whatever the case, I thoroughly enjoy it.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I watched this in 2 sittings...saw first 4 episodes one night and did NOT want to stop and go to bed! Finished it the next day. Now...again, I can't wait until  Season 4....I love these people...this countryside...the music....Just absolutely love "Downton Abby."

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm addicted to Downton Abbey.  I'm addicted to the dialogue, to the fashion, to the twists and turns of life in the Grantham realm.  I love the show for the values that it promotes - values long forgotten and exchanged for the seemingly more exciting lives of housewives and misguided youth.  So bring back the times when people lived and died for honour.  When every person's ultimate battle, rich or poor, consisted of enlarging the good and bright, and diminishing the dark and evil in his being. Visually, there is little on international television that can compete with the magnificent production, editing and cinematography of Downton Abbey.  It is just visual excellence, from Day One.  I am soooo looking forward to Matthew and Mary's wedding....

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I think they have made a grave mistake in killing off Matthew. I think it is a cheap literary plot twister that is trite and overused:it just tells me that they are running out of ideas. I was quite fond of the actor and will miss him and his character. I have no desire to seek out the fourth season, if in deed, there will be one. Very poor choice on many levels. Now I understand why Connan Doyle had to resurrect Holmes. Will Matthew survive his injuries? Is he not dead just in a many episodes coma? Will any one care at this point? Very 'cheap shot" at creativity. Shame on you all. I don't want to go to Scotland again, either.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This overall fascinating drama has it's high and low points during the season 3. I was relieved to see the Bates prison story resolved.  Edith's life has had some interesting potential with different sub plots and I would like to see one of these evolve into more story.  Shirley Maclaine was an uninteresting addition and her character was somewhat disappointing. I was glad to see where Tom was placed in the series.  I hope we can look forward to seeing more of his role in managing the estate.  Anna is fantastic and Mary intriguing.  Would enjoy seeing more of Mary's savvy and a little less of the pettiness with her sister.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Love this series.  Accurate historically.  This part is set in the 1920's England and the aristocracy is having to adapt to changing times.  Servants are demanding more rights and the mores of certain things such as childbirth, homosexuality and prostitution are discussed in new lights.  Fashion is changing also with the dress length continuously rising.  The vast estate is undergoing an income slump and figuring out how to bring in more money to keep the lifestyle presents problems.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I began watching the series through Amazon downloads while recuperating from an illness.  I am hooked!  I had heard what a good show it was, but I didn't want to jump into the new season without viewing seasons 1 - 3 first.  I watched all three seasons in 5 days!  Engaging, well written story that is beautifully filmed and well acted.  It gives a great historical perspective of the times, members of the various classes and how they interacted between and among themselves as well as how they dealt with the changes to the social structures that were inevitable and obvious to some.  Anyone who is a history buff and intrigued with the maintenance and eventual fall of the great estates of England will be as smitten with the entire series as I have been.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Looking forward to next season.  I love the  characters and story line, but hated the ending of this season's story.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love historical fiction and "Downton Abbey" is fantastic. The viewer gets involved in the lives of the characters as the story illustrates the impact that WW1 had on society. The century-old aristocracy is unraveling and, just as one would expect, there are those who embrace the changes & those who are going down with a fight. Through it all, life still happens: people love, envy, fear, care and die. No matter the "rank," all people experience the stuff of being human.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I had seen season 3 on television but had missed all season 1 and most of season 2.  I decided to watch season 3 again just for fun. I spent several weeks -- each day watching a show -- until I had finished all 3 seasons.  Downton Abbey presents well the period and the changes going on during this period.  While this period of history is frequently ignored, there were many important changes that took place during this time.  If you enjoy Downton Abbey or are just beginning to watch Downton Abbey -- give yourself a treat and watch all 3 seasons one right after the other.
summary: Watched it again just for fun

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is one of the best shows I have ever seen. it has the largest cast of any show i have watched and each performance is extraordinary. the characters are moving and griping and i live & die with them in every episode. the show is a detailed study of the relationship between the aristocratic socialites and their lower class servants. studying the peculiar bond that these disparate social classes share as they live in close proximity day in and day out. the show starts in 1908 and as of season three has progressed up to the early 1920's. never have i witnessed a show with such scope and grandeur, and rarely have i seen a show with more heart and humanity.
summary: the greatest & most entertaining study on class relationships i have ever seen.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I've watched all three seasons during the past month and this third one is not as good as the other two. The plot manipulations are so obvious that they've become tedious. What once felt realistic (such as the plotting below stairs) is now absurd. The feel is now that of a lowly soap opera, only with a high-class setting and costumes.The other fault I find is the amount of makeup on the actors. I so enjoyed the un-made-up look of the first seasons. I'm sure they had makeup on then, but it didn't look as if they did. In season three, however, it's obvious and out of place.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Spoiler. Season 3 was tear jerking as well as with great humor (Maggie Smith).  This is difficult to start with because I find each character/actor/actress so impressive.  Who pops to mind first? Thinking about season 3 brings me to the terror of Sybil's death.  Of course everyone at this point has fallen in love with Lady Sybil (Jessica Brown Findlay).  The shear agony of everyone in the household which now includes the "Downton Abbey" audience, is shocked by her death.  I was impressed by the truth of the era where child birth was indeed common.  Regardless, I had trouble facing the fact of her death.  The argument between Sybil's parents was so honest and Tom's heartache with his daughter was real.  I believed.  Throughout Season 3 Tom Branson's (Allen Leech) strength of character developed and the entire family gathered support for him and Sibby.  The storyline of John Bates (Brendan Coyle) was remarkable.  The prison scenes were grueling but Anna (Joanne Froggatt) was always there for her man. It was remarkable that Bates got to come back home.  Mary (Michelle Dockery) always shows such stress that I can't find her character remarkable at all.  The cast of the the "house" are significantly more impressive and lots more fun! Thomas (Rob James-Collier) albeit arrogant has a deeper character in Season 3 and he bridges so well with the rest of the house staff.  I could go on about each character but the above are my best of the best.  Of course we must include the kind, gentle and most lovable of the cast, Matthew (Dan Stevens).  In Seasons 1 & 2 he quietly worked his magic charm into the entire family and this season he won Downton Abbey via monetarily as well as in marriage.  The terrible accident that befalls Matthew at the end of Season 3 has so traumatized fans that they tell me they will never watch another episode of Downton Abbey.  I myself have been in mourning since the end of last season, but I am waiting with baited breath for Season 4.  I would be devastated if any spoiler alert on Season 4 would be sent my way prior to watching it in January 2014 in the "States." - - - High Definition on Amazon Prime is TOP-NOTCH programming at its finest !
summary: Spectacular Cast ! Amazing Writing ! Each Episode is Astonishing !

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The much anticipated Downton Abbey Series 3 starts in Spring 1920, carrying on from the superb Christmas Special which was set over the 1919/20 holiday period. The first episode picks up with Lady Mary and Matthew Crawley at last about to get hitched, but as usual there is quite a lot going on at Downton both above and below stairs and you just know that nothing is going to go smoothly.Shirley Maclaine makes her appearance as Martha Levinson, Lady Grantham's American mother. As usual, Violet, played by Maggie Smith manages to set the scene with some rather pithy comments. Martha has no time for the stuffy English and their traditions and is not slow to voice her opinion. Clearly she was introduced as a foil to Maggie Smith and the interplay between the two does work very well as one suspected it would. Violet seems to manage to continue to dominate any scene she is in.There are plenty of dramatic moments in the new series, as life on the Downton estate returns to more as it was shown in the first series, before the First World War when it served as a convalescent home for injured servicemen. However, there are new challenges for Downton in the post war period and there has to be change for the estate to survive. The interaction between the family and those that serve them `below stairs' continues to be a rich source of story lines for the script writers and is a major contribution to the success of the show.Downton Abbey is the most successful costume drama from British TV since Brideshead Revisited some thirty years ago - and this is quite an accolade as they produce a lot of this sort of drama in the UK. Regular viewers of Downton will have been holding their breath wondering whether Series 3 could possibly keep up the very high standards of the previous episodes. However, we need not have worried and few will be disappointed with the latest series. You really wonder how far Downton can go - personally I would not be surprised if it runs up to the 1930s in due course so hopefully plenty to look forward to! The really good news is that we know there will be a two hour Christmas Special in 2012 and although a fourth series has not yet been announced it will be very surprising if it does not follow.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: NOTE: Though I am NOT happy, I will NOT include any SPOILERS!!I am notifying all who care that I am sincerely thinking of giving up this series.There are times that great fiction -- which should of course be prone to the "rules" of life on this planet -- must present the negative side of life: tragedy included.But there are times that works of fiction deliberately manipulate emotions in what I consider to be an ATTENTION-GETTING END-OF-SEASON RATINGS MANEUVER, and this thoroughly ticks me off.I will not discuss the events that characterized the last few episodes of this season, but I will say this: ENOUGH ALREADY, DOWNTON ABBEY!As the thousands of people who have supplied Amazon ratings have attested, this has been until recently a delightful series that immersed us not only in the aristocratic lifestyle of the privileged, but also explored the matters that concerned those that served them.In addition, DA also clothed itself in turn-of-the-century historical themes that characterized the era, letting us see the impact of major events like the Great War as well as the equally powerful influences as influenza, the proliferation of telephones and the rise of Women's Suffrage.In this manner the series remained topical and true to the era.But toward the end of this season I have begun to feel manipulated through contrived rating-grabbers, and it has really made me question whether I want to continue watching this series.I know that ratings matter, and it's important that a public TV station gain influence on those with deep pockets and pocketbooks, but I'm just about done with the sensationalized events of late.Why not an earthquake that swallows the town?  Why not have John Bates run away to become a barnstorming pilot?  Why not have Lady Grantham swept away by an alluring Sheik of Araby?Right!  These would be absurd attempts to control the emotions of your viewers.  Is this series becoming "DA-llas"?I'm glad we're on break...I need some time to consider if I'm coming back.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Such attention to detail is put into the making of this show, I feel almost a part of each of character's life and advocate for every one of them. The only critique I have is in the form of a question: Why was this season so short?! Season one had three discs, but two had six. I thought, if anything, three would be as long as two. But buy this show! If you like English drama that pays attention to historical detail in reference to time, technology, and social class where everything is on the verge of monumental change, then this show is for you! The writing is fantastic. Even when you are a part of the dramatic irony and are the witness to a trajedy at the hand of a villian, you find yourself in their corner as well (at least when they're a member of the house). I find it amazing the level of loyalty I feel for these characters. My feelings are so strong that I am truly disappointed when I find out anything about the actors in real life. That may seem silly, but Downton is such a world of its own, I hate to have any alternate "reality" spoil it. If you are able, I absolutely recommend watching Season 1-3 in quick succession (i.e. one per night) and avoid ALL sppoilers. I predict that you will find this show as riveting as I have, if you like anything of this genre. Enjoy!
summary: Downton Abbey is a fantastic show!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: As the war ends, and the new decade arrives, it is interesting to witness the effects of change on both the upstairs and downstairs environs.  Surprisingly, the ability to cope with the changes, and move forward came from some of those whom you would not have expected to accept change.  It was especially interesting to watch the house staff, and how they adapted to changing situations, some more than others.  Behind it all, Carson was the anchor who, as always, provided stability and order.  The events at the end of the season cast a pall over the family, as well as the future of Downton, itself.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The writing continues to be excellent (esp. the Dowager's lines - we are literally falling over with laughter at her snide remarks), as are all the performances. The stories touch upon numerous aspects of this historical period (Irish situation, women's burgeoning rights, class issues, etc.) to give the show breadth and interest. The humanity of all the characters is readily felt, so they are never simply good or evil (altho O'Brien may be the exception to that). I can't wait for Season 4!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I just received the blu ray I purchased on amazon in the US featuring the UK version of the show, which is the only version available. We watched episode 6 on the blu ray just as it was airing on tv here in the US. We happened to see the episode on TV after we saw it on blu ray and were shocked to discover that the blu ray did not include key moments compared to what was shown on television. For instance, there's a key scene in which Mrs O'Brian tells Thomas that the new valet has a crush on him, leading him on. This scene is not in the episode on the blu ray. In addition, there are several moments of dialogue missing from other scenes. Consequently, DO NOT WATCH THE BLU RAY BELIEVING YOU'RE SEEING THE FULL VERSION. I will not see the next episodes on blu ray because I'm certain I will be missing key moments. My guess is that in the UK they have commercials and they need shorter episodes than in the US, where the series airs with no commercial interruption. In summary, unless there's an American version of the show in blu ray coming up, which I doubt, I recommend that you watch the show live on television in the US and you don't buy this UK version now on sale in amazon.
summary: BEWARE - THIS BLU RAY IS AN EDITED, SHORTENED VERSION OF WHAT'S SHOWN ON U.S. TELEVISION

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have been watching the first 2 Seasons of Downton Abbey on Amazon Instant Videos.  With Amazon Prime, those were free.  I  loved every moment.  So much so, I watched each episode more than once.  When my husband heard from a friend how much they were enjoying it, he came home and suggested we start watching.  I didn't want to discourage him, so I just said yes and didn't tell him until almost the last episode of the 2nd season, once I knew he was hooked.Now, full disclosure, Amazon requests that you review items you have ordered even if a person would know that only one episode of Season 3 has aired and I cannot possibly review the entire season.  But the first episode did not disappoint.That is all I will say, because, if you haven't watched it, I don't want to spoil any of it for you. PBS did a special on Highclere Castle where the series is filmed and, so far, I cannot see that this is added to the Season 3 extras.Between the amazing sets, the costumes, the many characters and plots / subplots.  It is worth watching multiple times for enjoyment and to clarify details that may have been missed during the first viewing.The first episode was great and I am looking forward to subsequent episodes.  It looks like the entire Season is set for DVD release at the end of January, so I am hoping that the Instant Video (which we gladly pay for in the hope that we can watch the entire Season (probably more than once)on our own schedule once the entire season is released.Definitely worth watching, more than once.  Buy it, either through Amazon Instant Videos or DVD set, you won't be sorry.
summary: So Much Fun!  Beautiful, funny don't miss a moment of this series.

Though I won't give it away, the only disappointment I've had is the Season 3 ending, which was predictable given what I've read about a certain cast member's imminent departure, but is a shame both from the prospect of the loss of the character as well as the way it was handled.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The spoiler free part of this review is that this is the same fantastic series with a group of characters we still love. Every detail of their all-too-human lives had me riveted to the screen as usual. Also worth noting is that I enjoyed the fact that Thomas' sexuality is revisited in this season in a quite interesting way, adding even more depth to his character as well as to the characters of those who must react to his behavior. It's hard for me to give only three stars to a series I love, and I definitely will continue to watch the series, but...I am growing tired of the "We're rich!" "We've lost everything!" "We're rich!" "We've lost everything!" "We're rich again!" story line, always accomplished by Deus Ex Machina. Get a real plot, already. Great characters - you've already got. But that's not a reason to overlook good storytelling.Now for the real SPOILER so stop reading here if you don't want to know. ********************************************While I didn't like the choice made to have Sybil die in childbirth, that alone wouldn't have knocked this season down to three stars for me. But, I absolutely hated the choice that was made to have Matthew's character apparently die. I can only hope that the writer rethinks this choice before next season, as he did leave the possibility open that Matthew survives his accident. It's not because I love Matthew and don't want to see him go, although I do. It's because it is a disservice to the story. Matthew is as close to a "hero" as anyone is this series. Following his character and his fortunes is a significant reason people watch the show. The story should revolve around characters and plot, not actors. So if an actor decides to take a hike, the writer, in my opinion, should find a way to carry on with the story. There are many ways to handle an actor's exit, other than killing off his character in the story. If a character's death is integral to the plot and accomplishes something important, then I do not object. But when the death occurs randomly, in the service of an actor's career choice, I'm against it. The audience is interested in the character, not the actor. Sybil's death already seemed random and did not advance the plot. Now Matthew dies, also in a random act? The writer could have and should have done better. I'm tired of windfall inheritances and car accidents driving the series.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: After creating a beautiful world filled with so much life and authenticity, the writer opens his Downton Abbey season three with cheap contrivance and ends with a pathetic and desperate ploy to find some way to stretch this series to another season. I always say "if you have to stoop to cheap tricks to finish a script, it won't be worth much. That's how I feel about season 3. I adored this series. I have never been so utterly in love with a tv series before - even a Masterpiece Theater series.I don't know what the writer was thinking. After you load so much sickness, pain, morbid heartbreak and brutal, untimely death into a script, after awhile it gets laughable. I will not watch this program in the future. You know it's ok for people to be happy - even the aristocracy. I mean, they're people, too.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Overall I love Downton Abbey Series 3 but must death be so prevalent?  I loved the mix of the main characters upstairs and downstairs but now they are leaving one by one.  It was good to see that they dealt with "taboo" subjects realistically for today's times but with the rules of the day in the 1920s.  I love the costumes and scenery.  It will be interesting to see if Series 4 includes the Great Depression and the growing of the next generation of Sybil (granddaughter) and George, and that Edith finally find lasting love and if Mary shows more of her independent nature again.  I hope that there will be many more series with the Crawley family and the changing times of the aristocracy.

review_text: My teenage nieces ask me what 'my guilty pleasure' was, and I told them Downton Abbey! I showed them an episode from my computer and did they become fascinated! Beautiful settings, great acting, great directing! Love It! I am thrilled the new season is here.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This show is a huge family saga and historical romance.  I always think I will resist being pulled into this world. Every single time after the first episode, I am once again a DA addict. Just try pulling me away!Right off the top, let me get something off my chest.  I THINK BATES IS GUILTY. Am I the only one to think that way? I  just do not see his late wife, a character who lived for revenge, killing herself, which is the only alternative. I guess you could argue that this was a primo act of revenge but she was doing fabulously well against Bates and Anna revenge wise with limitless prospects for further success. Why end such a pleasurable experience which she could watch endlessly unfold?  She was already making them absolutely miserable! If it turns out she was a suicide, I think it is the only misstep the writers made. So this remains a big plot element in season three downstairs with Anna still trying to exonerate him.Upstairs we have the wedding for Matthew and Lady Mary with further quarrels leading them all the way to the altar.  These two will not have a staid marriage and that is all to the good. Sybil is present with Tom and will be shortly delivering her baby. Hugh Bonneville, the lord and master of the abbey, is again beset on all sides.  He makes many mistakes based on his aristocratic viewpoint of the world.  At heart this is the prime problem for all of these people, they grew up in an aristocracy and the aristocracy is precisely what is no longer needed in post world war one England.But the best characters are the three older women, the matriarchs of all other characters.  These are the dowager countess, played wonderfully by Maggie Smith, Matthew's mother, and Shirley MacLaine as the present countess's American mother. You would think the dowager countess would be a complete anachronism with the future being firmly represented by the other two matriarchs.  However, as the power behind the throne, Smith is incredible.  There is always power behind the throne and it is often a woman who has it.  Smith thus continues to be a major delight.As usual, I am anxiously awaiting the next episode.  sigh.....
summary: I always start off thinking i won't like it and then get hooked anew

Do you really think you can maintain your following with that kind of agenda?  Don't you think we have enough of that in the real world, we need to see it in entertainment, too?  I think you have lost me as a viewer!!!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is a series that will grab you and keep you wanting for more at the end of each episode.  Downton Abbey is so well produced and the acting is outstanding.  The story also gives one a look into the British class system and how it evolved after the First World War much to the chagrine of some of the priviledged class in the story.  Fascinating and so worthwhile.  I highly recommend the series.  Note: I watched the first two seasons on my Kindle for free as an Amazon Prime member as I just heard of the series over the holidays.  Another good reason to join Prime!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Instantly hooked at the first headline of the Titanic in the initial episode, I, in the company of many no doubt, inhaled every episode like it was the drug to solve all my personal problems. Addict I became, intensely interested in my favorite characters through three seasons of appalling events,servant gossip, that ever-nastalgic and alluring British aristocratic lifestyle, and of course the seductive tension between the characters Mary and Matthew. However, alarmingly and without warning, Season 3 left me alone in a hollow room of irritation, possibly akin to that of an addict's withdrawal. As the blood trickled down the cheek of the now-deceased Matthew, 90% of the reason I love Downton Abbey suddenly vanished. The vacuum left by Mary's counterpart demands more than the young (albeit strikingly handsome) Branson can deliver, because we simply have not connected with him at the level we did Matthew. (However, on second thought, a torn, rain-soaked white shirt, a day's growth and perhaps a broken leg might add a new level of connection, but I digress. Would still be a great scene, though.) What does Season Four promise? Sigh. The final episode of Three set the stage for the (yawn) predictable nod toward Thomas' sexual orientation as the object of his affection will most certainly realize that he is, after all, not straight. My favorite valet might actually admit to sweet Anna that he did, in fact, murder his late ex. Will Branson turn the Abbey around and implement his late brother-in-law's controversial ideas? My keenest longing is to return to the comfy easy chair with my kindle fire and glass of red in the blessed quiet hours of night, curling up for my fix, and immerse myself in the English lilt of yesteryear-as has been my cherished practice. I am reluctant to hope that the next season of Downton Abbey will deliver the goods. Though I will it to be so. After all, I AM a junkie.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I admit to reading the last pages first.  Okay, there is no book. And it is against my principles to peek at the end first. But I saw the last couple hours of the series on TV and needed to see the beginning, so I bought the series. (*See my review of Season 2 for why I missed the season)  I knew the ending.  Even so, I enjoyed every bit of the build up to the end of the series.  As each season continues, one thinks "What more can they explore in these characters?"  But they find so much more!  Hurrah for the writers and actors.  I can't wait for the next season.
summary: Even When You See It Coming

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I am a sucker for period pieces, and this one rates way up there with the English series of yesteryear like Upstairs, Downstairs. Julian Fellowes has a flair for life in the Great Houses at the turn of the 19th century, as he demonstrated with his amazing film Gosford Park. I would watch any of his work. I enjoy drinking my morning tea from my grandmother's china cups while viewing Downton. Characters and plots are smoothly developed and interwoven. Raves from me.

review_text: I have been following the ups and downs of the Crawleys and their servants since day 1. Before this series the return of Matthew in the middle of the concert in the second series had been the soapiest but the last moments of the new series are pure soap.  I'll watch and buy the fourth series but with a perhaps more critical eye on the exigencies of the script.Still a great effort by the team.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Pathetically ending what could have been a fabulous season, the last show disappointed in a wickedly "American way"...seriously, is our beloved "Downton Abbey" with all it's intertwined M'lords & Ladys doomed to the notoriety of "Who shot J.R.?"Before him lay a myriad of choices for a season finale that would have elicited everything from loathing,(maybe Bates getting a little "too" excited with Anna?)) or maybe our fine Mr. Branson holding baby Sybbie hostage to reap ransom for his radical Irish ways? Or, maybe Mr. Boyles, no, Moseley maybe? taking a better look at Thomas? And why are the Women always sick? Dearest Mr. Branson dropping a tray, clutching his heart?....I could go on &on;&on....but;, alas, I am not the writer. There were memorable episodes to be sure, unfortunately they were quickly forgotten when we were left to what I like to call pure "American Ratings Bullsugar"

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The setting, the depiction of the characters, the story-line and in my view, the costumes were superb.  Here Lady Mary and Mathew  reject and pursue each other. They marry and tragedy strikes.  Tom has his chance to"fight his corner" as Isobel claims and even though tragedy strikes here also, he emerges as a strong able-bodied member of the family.  The servants continue to have their ups and downs and one villainess gets her due, which was gratifying.
