title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey is in the long tradition of British family-servant sagas, in this case,the Crawley family: the earl of Grantham, his wife and three daughters,  who are the owners, custodians, and prisoners of an enormous "great house" in Yorkshire around the turn of the 20th century. Season 3 deals with the aftermath of World War I and the breakdown of the prewar social and economic order. The central characters  masters and servants, are welll-drawn, not always "nice" but usually very understandable. And anyone who can resist Maggie Smith as the Dowager Duchess or Shirley MacLaine as the visiting rich American mother-in-law is lacking either a heart or a sense of humor. As a history buff and fan of costume dramas, I find Downton Abbey to be as satisfying as good chocolate and equally impossible to resist.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I realize that my lower rating of Season 3 will not be popular. First, let me say that I thoroughly enjoyed the entire first two seasons of Downton Abbey. The story lines, scenery, and acting were all brilliant. Season 3 was wonderful as well until you hit the very end of the finale, the "A Journey to the Highlands" episode.** SPOILER ALERT ** When Matthew is killed in a car wreck on the way back from seeing his new born son the show just seemed to plunge too deep into darkness. Let's review: Cybil dies after childbirth; Lord and Lady Grantham's marriage is strained greatly as Lady Grantham blames Cybil's death in part on Lord Grantham's decision; much of the season has poor Bates in prison so Anna and Bates are apart; Tom struggles with Cybil's death; Lady Edith is interested in a married man, a man that is married to a women in an insane asylum so for some reason he is unable to get a divorce; when we meet Shrimpee (sp) we find that he is in a miserable marriage; then Lady Mary and Matthew happily great their new born son, only to have Matthew get killed in a car wreck shortly after his son's birth. My point is that Downton Abbey seemed to lose much of its joy during season 3.I hope season 4 will bring back some glimmer of joy to Downton Abbey.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: As always, Masterpiece Theater has come through with a compelling storyline, complex and well-drawn characters and wonderful location photography.  Julian Fellowes has captured both the excitement and confusion of the inter-war era when society and peoples' roles and lives were changing on nearly a daily basis.  Politics, a mud fight, possible murder, intrigue, sex, and electric mixers - nothing is a taboo storyline at Downton Abbey.  As an ensemble, the cast is stellar, but Dame Maggie Smith in the anchor role of sly, acerbic matriarch is far-and-away the standout.  No, it's not Austin's light England, or Michener's graphic world history but Downton Abbey is equally entertaining in it's chronicling of life between the Wars.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is one of the few series out there that when you watch it again you can say.."oh that is why they thought that ..."  I can be quite picky when it comes to historical movies and the only glaring flaw that I found in the 1st couple of series was they had black tires on the cars. Carbon black was not added to car tire rubber until 1915 and then did not become common until after WW1.... really is that all this picky guy can come up with as a flaw? ... that should tell you something... excellent series! Well done.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I need to get unhooked from this soap opera that perpetually generates one crisis after another.  Good acting and yes good dialogue but how can one family endure so many ongoing crises...boggles the mind.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm not a big TV fan, especially with the drivel they have on these days, but this is THEE BEST SHOW out there.  I can not say enough good things about it.  My wife and I have watched the first season 5 or 6 times.  I am constantly in awe at how well the story flows, how great the actors are, the advancement of the plot in each show.  The only complaint I have is that the season is only 9 episodes!  ONLY 9!!  There should be 90!!  But past that this show is so VERY much worth watching..  OK, I lied, I have other complaints about the show, Season 3 is HARD to deal with.  The changes to the family and the loss of members has weighed heavily on my wife and I.  We LOVE each and every character and to have some ripped away like that is horrid.  We've got an emotional investment in these people.  Perhaps I'm too invested in what is essentially a hyped up soap opera, but it's such a well made soap opera!!!!  GET THIS SERIES!!  You'll not regret it!!

review_text: Wasnt sure about this series but, it had really good reviews so we decided to try it out! Well, that's all it took as you started to get a sense for the family member/roles coupled with the Servants and their roles!  Now we've watched the first 3 seasons in the past 2 weeks and are on the 4th season while wishing there was more time in the day to view a couple more episodes! title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: First, let me start by saying I absolutely am in love with Downton Abbey and was so anticipating my copy of season 3.  It arrived promptly, on the release date, and my husband and I sat together to watch throughout the week.  I will not speak to the story because many others have done due diligence, I'm simply commenting on 3 issues:First, the English subtitles are tiny, really tiny!  My husband is deaf and typically utilizes closed captioning, but since this was available with SDH, we thought it would not be an issue.  The subtitles are very difficult to read, even on a larger TV.  If you are a person who utilizes this feature be forewarned that you'll be paying far more attention to the subtitles than normal and will probably have to watch an episode at least twice to catch all the dialogue.Second, after watching all the episodes on the disc, I thought I'd see how the they compared to the PBS version that is available online.  I started watching Episode 5 and within a few minutes realized that there are portions cut out from the Masterpiece version online (same as broadcast on TV).  One example is the scene with Robert & Cora in her bedroom after the funeral, he says good night, she says good night to him in the online version, that is missing from this disc.  At breakfast the next day there are multiple portions of scenes cut, including some with the servants downstairs and with Branson upstairs.Third, there is nothing in the case expect the outside graphics sheet.  No explanation of how long the episodes are, no episode guide, no description at all.  For such a popular series this is certainly a stripped down version of what is an excellent show.I'm sorely disappointed that I paid to get this disc and now I will be contacting Amazon with my displeasure over these issues. 2 stars because of the lack of acceptable subtitles and the cut version of the series that you'll be receiving if you purchase this.
summary: Not everything is terrific about this version!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I loved the whole 3 seasons of Downton Abbey.  It was especially interesting to me to see how the fabulously wealthy live.  It makes me glad that I am not nearly counted as one of them.  They would never sit down to eat pizza or spaghetti or any other down home meal.  Fried chicken would never be seen nor would cheese steak sandwiches ever be on their menu.  The working people living downstairs work their derriere's off to make upstairs people enjoy their lives.  Personally I enjoy a good pizza with a side of Bud and at times a cheese steak with fried onions is heavenly.  I am not rich by any means and after seeing how the ultra rich live I am glad I am not one.  The show is a study of human nature.  How the workers are charged with taking care of the ladies or the gentlemen.  They don't even have to dress themselves for their maids and butlers are in charge of making sure the Lords and Ladies are dress in clean good fitting clothes.  The show take place in the early 1900s in England.  All that said I have thoroughly enjoyed  every episode .  I am only sorry that Amazon does not have more seasons to offer to their prime members.  This show is great.  Give it a whirl.Knight68

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have read in the Georgian, Regency, Victorian and Edwardian periods, and found the extraordinary level of detail in this show to be compelling.  From Mr. Carson taking out his stick and leveling the silver and measuring the place settings, to the hierarchy below-stairs, to the customs of who will answer the door, to what silver to use for each course, it all rings true.  The clothes are exquisite - no simple rush here - these are pure vintage looks, down to the above elbow gloves.  And the grandeur of High Clere, the actual seat behind the show.  The magnificent grounds.  And the relationships, always the relationships.  Although I would if I could give James the bounce.  This is one to remember.  Having been a fan of Upstairs, Downstairs when it aired, I find this to be even better, although more in-depth into each character, and many more "behind the front lines" looks at each character.  Clean presentation from Amazon with nary a glitch.

It is really fun to watch the entire season all at once or in multi-episode blocks.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: We loved Seasons 1 and 2 of Downton Abbey and bought Season 3 to complete our set of current DVDs for this show.  The story lines are still compelling but I feel like it has become a bit like a soap opera in that just as one crisis is ending the next has already begun.  (And I'm still mad that 2 main characters were killed off!)Still, I highly recommend the series because the attention to historical detail, the acting, costuming and story line are all excellent.  Maggie Smith's performance is tremendous.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Julian Fellowes is either really brilliant or a big turkey heart breaker.  This was a major hankie experience and, beyond that, it would be hard to say anything without revealing a story well worth seeing.  Not quite Dickens, not quite Jane Austen but definitely holding the hardship and personal interludes included in these authors' works.  Up and down and all around the viewer is led:  Downton Abbey is saved!  Downton Abbey is doomed.The characters and their relationships are so well wrought, down to the extant cultural limitations of behavior and manner, with great compassion and surly back biting and everything ordinary in between.  The class differences are blurred with Maggie Smith's character, seemingly so intolerant, the most accepting (and not) with love, care and common sense.  Her life experience, shared by no one else, can dictate nothing else.Highly recommended for a good escape to another oddly compelling planet of life experience.  While Mr. Fellowes may pull some heart strings, sometimes the good cry is worth the tears.
summary: How Many Could Give This Series Anything Less?

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: To be waited upon hand and foot, and have such a sheltered view of how the other 99% live, what's not to like? Of course, we know that it won't last, but it's a great fantasy that captures one's wishful thinking. To me it's escapism at its upmost, much akin to all those dreams one has with a single lottery ticket on a billion dollar jackpot.The casting is superb, and the actors play their roles exceedingly well. Plot twists are expertly woven into the general story line with a democratic sharing of good folks and bad folks among the upstairs and the downstairs characters.All in all a wonderful tale of a magical world. I just hope that the last season doesn't include the scene where Lord and Lady Grantham are showing all the tourists, who have paid 10 pounds each, around the place.
summary: It's a tough life, but somebody's got to live it.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I just started watching Downton Abbey only about a week ago, and it has lived up to all of the raving reviews that I have heard about it. I don't know why I waited so long to watch it.I watched Season 1, 2 & 3 in a matter of days, because I couldn't wait to see what was going to happen from episode to episode.  It covers every aspect of the good and bad of humankind with a storyline that never ceases to surprise.  The intricacies of the lives of the characters are not lost amongst each other, but bring the commonality between the classes to the fore, while depicting the unfairness and cruelty of a society that leaves those without power behind.  Season Four is proving to be another winner.I would recommend this to anyone.  It has a wealth of history, mystery, drama, humor, sadness, love, cruelty, hate, etc., a variety of story lines, a wide spectrum of characters with whom to identify, as well as an opportunity to get, what is quite probably, a more authentic historical peek, into this particular time of the Victorian era in England.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have really enjoyed the series.  However, the story line does not hold true to how things REALLY were in the early 20th century concerning homosexual behavior. Thomas would have really been imprisoned and not promoted.  Though I understand wanting to relate to society today, the story line does not hold true to that time in history.  It wasn't really until the 1980s that the homosexual lifestyle was more accepted. And even, then, it's only been in the last 15 years that it's become less of an inigma in society.
summary: Holding true to history versus being relevant to today's society

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: My husband and I have been having such fun watching this....we had given up on TV and movies ....this has given us a window, a breath of fresh air for finding anything socially redeeming and entertaining to watch.  I marvel at all the "real" life ups and downs of a generous variety of personalities and status.....with that common life thread that "there are no guarantees in life" that we all have to deal with no matter where we come from or where we are going, we need to be reminded, OFTEN, that life, many times, is not fair, in addition to reaping the consequences of your choices and those personal choices are not isolated to you but affects those close to you and even beyond.... nonetheless we all need to deal with it, most preferably with integrity and compassion ......everyone seems perfectly casted and all do a superior job with their character....the only down side is...since I'm in the middle of season 3, that it must come to an end.....also another life lesson, but I wish it could last forever......just like falling in love!!!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This show has drama, mystery, suspense, human tragedy, and comedy.  We see people  struggling with raw emotions in  triumph and in failure.  I have stopped watching. I need a break from the roller coaster ride I just experienced from the height of happiness I felt for the birth of a child to the low of bitter grief from its father being suddenly killed and the pain I know it will cause the family.  I am not ready to face it yet.The story line and characters are true to the  lives that play out for everyday people and hold universal truths no matter ones socio-economic level. I also love its  historical value. I feel truly transported to a time and place in history from which I  have experienced it as it  really was and  from the point of view of the common man and woman to the manor born.  Just fascinating.  I will return to Downton Abbey shortly as life must carry on.  Fortunately I can step in and out as I please in Downton Abby- a pleasure I am sure many of us wish we could do in ours.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I and all those closest to me have been fairly addicted to Downton Abbey. I have watched and rewatched seasons one & two, but season three has been a real letdown.  The first few episodes were fairly compelling, but they became more disjointed.  It seems now that the series is ultra successful, primary characters want out, and the only way the writers seem able to accommodate their wishes is to kill them.  Two of the best characters are now gone and one can only imagine what will be coming next.  The 2 hour final episode was choppy at best, underdeveloped, at the very least.  The new romances/relationships were all over the page; Edna eyes Tom, creepy grocer eyes Mrs. Patmore, Dr. Clarkson (a favorite of mine) eyes Mrs. Crawley.  And Rose is a non starter as is her family.  It was almost as if the trip to Scotland was filler because they didn't have any substance. Perhaps my biggest gripe was that the finale left me depressed. I can certainly wait another year for more of this.  Needless to say, my disappointment is stupefying..

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Yes filmmaking (which is probably spelled wrong), is applicable, because this doesn't seem like television.  It is way too good for TV.  From the first season this has been a wonderful show and season three will make you laugh and smile and break your heart more than once.  The setting for the series, the beautiful Highclere Castle, renamed Downton Abbey in the series, is a treasure and we are now entering the roaring twenties, just after the end of The Great War a/k/a World War I.  Styles, manners and expectations of the servant classes have changed too.  Start at the beginning and enjoy the entire series.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I rated this 5 stars baised on the first two seasons. I am looking forward to season 3, and expect that it will not disapoint. I do not see any weaknesses in this production, writing, cast, everyone associated with it.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: My wife is English and her friends from home told her of Downton Abbey toward the end of  season one.  She wanted the DVD set and reviews suggested buying the UK version over the PBS stating that the PBS version is edited from the original.  We have since purchased the UK versions of Downton Abbey seasons 1, 2, and 3 and we both love the series.  Since season 3 was released a couple of weeks ago, we have only had an opportunity to view the first three episodes of season 3.  The acting and writing, so far, are on a pace to equal the two previous seasons.  If you haven't seen Downton Abbey you are missing out on quality TV at it's best.
summary: I loved season 1&2, and only 3 episodes into season 3, I still love Downton Abbey

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: BBC television... almost a guarantee of excellence. Wake up U.S.A.; we need some superior programs!!! Rich, well written, and excellent character development, however, very disappointed by episodes 8 and 9. The story line for Thomas Barrow and those characters surrounding him was disjointed, very contrived and not a historically believable response. Why have the writers given in to modern views on this topic? Have they lost their focus?  Hope to see the historical intergrity return to season 4 and a purer representation of the values of this time period.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I watched only the last three episodes of Season 3 on Amazon.  Wish I'd have watched all the other episodes that way! I just love this series and hope they can keep the quality up for several more seasons.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Not only is this a well written show with superb it is a penetrating insight into all the ssues the British people were dealing with; the crumbling of the Empire, the rebellion in Ireland, the disintegration of the quasi- feudal system of land ownership,the arrogant nature of the Upper Class, and their reluctance to arrive at the realization that their lavish lifestyle was coming to an end.
summary: A tale of the transformation of the British aristocracy from  historic presidence to a populous society.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: There is not a series out there that I love more.  It offers the gifts of sumptuous, flawless storytelling, characters who live and evolve, and both art direction and cinematography that I find to be unsurpassed in television today.  One is completely drawn in.  Completely transported.  Each episode is like a stand alone feature film, and achieves a rare pinnacle of drawing out genuine care.  That said, I can still only give it four stars because the writers' cheap low blow made for a lazy cliche.  Sadly, I'll have to sacrifice "was this helpful?" votes by not explaining what I mean.  But If you go on to watch the series, which I absolutely recommend, you'll thank me later for not spoiling.  I'm so angry at the writers...  I may be done watching this series.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Great series!  Can't wait for Season 4 to start. The opulence of those days plus the interactions of the characters provide several sub-stories of their own.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Draws you in emotionally.  Not sure of inconsistancy in butler's banning maid for having been a prostitute but allowing a gay.  Seems like neither would fit in conservative era of the 20's - but show  brings out personalities and opinions of society.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love, love, love "Downton Abbey".  Period pieces, when done well, and this one certainly is, are fantastic.  I've not been this excited about a series sine "North and South"1  I am completely immersed in the characters, the time and manner in which they lived.  So much so, that I find myself rooting for some of the characters and wishing others would get their comeuppance for their terrible behavior.  I do wish the character of Matthew had not been killed off as he was a great asset to the storyline.  i don't want the series to end, but keep on going for years to come!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This item arrived earlier than expected, was eight dollars cheaper than what I originally paid on pre-order (credited back to my account), and makes me feel special, because I was able to get ahead of others in the U.S. who are watching the show on PBS.  I sat up late last night, just savoring the atmosphere of this wonderful show.  Tonight I will watch it again with my husband, who is jealous that I got ahead of him!  Next year I will pre-order the new season again.  Best of all, you can't feel guilty when you buy an item that supports Public TV!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This was a history lesson that kept my interest, upstairs or downstairs.  Wonderful story, expert acting, and lovely scenery.The changes after the first World War were many, some difficult, some eagerly embraced. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This series is the best TV has to offer. The writing is excellent, the stories and relationships between all the people are portrayed realistically, as well as all the historic details like the costumes, decor, prevailing attitudes, etc. It is one of the few series where I am sometimes willing to rewatch an episode just to absorb more of the telling details.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have been hearing about this series since it began but never watched it.  When the 4th season was about to come on, I decided to catch up since many of my friends have raved about from the beginning.  Now, I see why!  Downton Abbey is a wonderful series for so many reasons.1. It is refreshing to watch a program with (mostly) wholesome values and emphasis on family.2. The scenery and costumes are beautiful and add so much to the depth of the show.3. The story is fast paced enough to keep things interesting and slow enough so I can keep up with the multiple characters and their personalities.I have enjoyed watching Downton Abbey very much!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: After the Great War the extended Crawley family, and the many servants who keep the estate running, must adjust to life and change as society changes.  This is a well-acted, well-crafted drama that illustrates the life stories that affect everyone--rich and poor, aristocrat and working class--without distinction. There are secrets, cunning, manipulations, success, loss, sex, love, politics, a murder conviction...  The weekly show is well paced with a well defined story arc that keeps the 48 minutes flowing. This is not a stuffy or boring period piece.  Make your guy comfortable with a pizza and beer...ok, you can step up the beer...maybe Stella Artois, but hide the sherry until your mom's visiting.  After 1 or 2 shows, he will just have to know what's gonna happen...
summary: This is not your grandmother's period piece...

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The story is intriguing.  The characters are well cast and develop over time.  There are actually two stories.  The one that evolves with the aristocracy upstairs and one that evolves downstairs with the staff.  The protaganists are oh so cunning.  I love the clothes, decor, and learning about the social mores of the times.  It is interesting to see them change with passing years.  i.e. before and after the war.  The dialog is simply wonderful.  Very clever. My husband and I can't wait for each episode to find out what happens next.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What a great series! I never tire of watching the English and their upper class lifestyles. Hugh Bonneville is the ultimate "Lord of the Manor", believeing that life will always be the same, and trying to rule his family like some medieval baron.  He has back up in Carson, his butler, but they are both outdone each time by the women of the family- both belowstairs and upstairs.I appreciate good drama mixed with a sense of humor (Maggie Smith as the matriarch), and this is it.
summary: Life as we don't know it

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I was reluctant to watch this series, but my daughter prodded me. By the end of the second episode, I was hooked. Now at the end of the third season, I'm addicted. So much so that one of the characters' personalities has wormed its way into being part of our family's coded lexicon. It's "O'Brien," as in: "So-and-so would never have noticed such-and-such on her own, except that she's being 'Obrien-ed'." Ha! Excellent TV for a change! (Watched Season 3 on amazon.com for less than the cost of DVD's and I can go back and re-watch as often as I want. Great concept. Thanks, Amazon!)
summary: Love it, love it, LOVE IT!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is one of the best done and most enjoyable series I have ever seen - we're behind the times and watched the whole thing this year, and I was talking about it to everyone - up until the last few minutes of season 3. I really feel like the writers were unnecessarily cruel to the viewer in that final scene, and I can't believe they would end the season on such a dreadful, depressing note. It's colored my whole feeling about the entire series - I no longer am a "fan", I don't like to talk about downton abbey, and I would really prefer not watch season 4.  We're watching Upstairs Downstairs instead, where if they kill off main characters (at least so far) it's decently offscreen.
summary: Great!  Until it was really terrible

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Everything was going really well in Series III, particularly the moving scene where Jimmy checks up on Mr. Barrow, who took a beating for him. Everyone was more kindly than usual, and then...BANG!... jubilant new dad Matthew geta run off the road by a delivery truck and lies, thrown from his open car, down a ravine, eyes wide open and blood coursing down his temple. Mr. Fellowes, you have created one of the greatest drama series in television history, why in hell would you kill off one of the most beloved characters just to introduce a 20-year-old  mindless flapper (Rose)? While your wife (Ms. McGovern) is a fine actress, your script fails to use her for anything other than bland reactions to family crises. You would have done well to kill her off and leave Matthew to captain the family. TOO LATE! I, for one, will not be seeing any subsequent episodes. You get a D- for bad judgment.
summary: Fellowes, Why Did You Kill Off Your Kindest Character!!?? Treason!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: If you are a fan of Jane Austen, the Brontes, and classic love stories, then Downton Abbey is the show for you. Based on a book about a maid in a large household in this time period, as well as Upstairs Downstairs, the classic BBC show, Downton Abbey takes you into the lives of the Earl of Grantham and his family, as well as the staff that work at the Abbey. My husband calls it a period soap opera, and while there is quite a bit of drama, it doesn't quite have the falseness that a soap opera would. You get attached to the characters though, and when something happens to them that you don't like, or don't foresee, you really feel for them. Downton Abbey is great overall.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I still love the cast of characters on Downton Abbey. The story lines continue to keep me interested - some are predictable, but enough twists are thrown in that it doesn't get boring. I will say, however, that the new lighting that is being used in filming is not good. It makes everything look cheap and poorly done. Return viewers will notice this most.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: adding new characters is always a way to keep things interesting and push the story along...I think they do a great job with all of the personalities of both the 'gentry' -the help in the kitchen has its ups and downs, too, and it spans a lot of years...nicely done!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I apologise that I am not reviewing the DVD itself; its quality, extras and price etc., but the content of the show.  I am sure that the quality of production for the series 3 DVD will be just as good as the previous ones, just make sure you purchase the unedited version.Downton series 3 kicks off in splendid style, though I am a bit confused about the time line.  Sybil is expecting and barely "showing" and we are told this is almost 6 months on from the Christmas special, in which we were told she was expecting. The early storyline with Edith is also a major inconsistency for me, but I cannot say why without giving things away.  Apart from these niggles, this series is going to be about change.  The world from top to bottom changed after WW1 and this series is dealing with those issues.  I will not tell what's going on, but there are many changes coming for both upstairs and downstairs at Downton. Shirley Maclaine is terrific with the whole cast, but provides a perfect foil for Maggie Smith and the whole show is worth watching just for those two, well they have the best lines anyway. I only wish she was in it for more than the first 2 episodes. The sets, the costumes, the cars, the house are all wonderful and show such attention to detail.  If you're a fan of Downton you will love series 3.  (and it has been announced there will be a series 4!)
summary: You'll love it, you know you will!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I originally started watching through a prompting of a friend. After the first 2 episodes of S1 I was hooked. Very compelling story of a time gone by, a family that although with position and money still has to deal with day to day, heartache, deceit, drama and just life in general which doesn't make them all that different in so many ways than the people who serve them.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Just when you get really attached to some characters. All of their lives are becoming so intertwined, and so believable. Crash watched Seasons 1-3 so I would be caught up before Season 4. Cannot wait. I came to find out that actors have personal decisions as to not renewing for another season. The writers really handled this loss of a main character quite well. I have no complaints at all about this series. I watched it on my iPad on the kitchen table during mealtimes. Plus no commercials, what a pleasure.Loved the costumes, location, scenery and everything. I was always rooting for the underdog. You also learn a lot about the social codes of the times, restrictions on women and about manners and protocol. A lot of that is missing today. A better way to understand the past, the difference in classes and the effects of war. So more alive that the dull history classroom books of the 50's to about the 80's.
summary: Could not believe the finale. It alarmed my senses. I kept saying "OH NO!"

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: It is hard to keep the momentum going in a series which is basically about relationships without a bit of either ho-hum settling in or it getting maudlin and soap opera-ish.  But DOWNTON ABBEY seems to avoid those traps and deliver freshness and surprise each episode.  There is enough continuity so you can enter the Downtown world each week and feel at home, and enough novelty in characters and situations to keep it from becoming stale.Season 3 brims with energy.  Shirley McLaine is believable as Lord Grantham's mother-in-law from America and plays her role with dash and panache.  It would be easy to be too campy in that role, but that is avoided.  The three daughters are getting married off which fast-forwards the story-line.  You can't help but wonder what else is going to happen to the family at the beginning of the 1920's.  The costumes continue to delight.I love having this series in our streaming library as my sons like to watch it when they come home.  They like the historical aspects of the show.  I hope this series continues for a long time.  Great job by Julian Fellowes on the screen-writing and production of this enthralling series.  It has the right balance of humor and drama.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What a fabulous period series. The characters, setting and clothes are well done. We can't wait for the new episodes.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: D Abbey was a little slow starting for, in fact we dropped it and only came back when friends kept insisting we try it again.  We became hooked and went through the first three seasons in about a month.  The acting is superb, the multiple story lines guarantee you will never get bored, and the whole sumptuous atmosphere of the Abbey is enthralling.  One of the best series ever produced!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: To be clear, that's one star for AMAZON, not Downton Abbey.  Viewing at 9 PM on Sundays doesn't mesh well with our Monday morning schedules so we were positively gleeful to get our Series 3 DVD, advertised as the "Original UK Version" on Amazon.  Last night, while surfing the internet on my laptop for Charlotte Russe recipes for next week's viewing party, I decided I needed another peek at Ethel's masterpiece, so I popped over to PBS.org for another look, rather than get up and fiddle with the TV and remote. Of course, you can't just re-watch one scene so...much to my surprise there were Thomas and O'Brien in the corridor discussing Jimmy/James!  I checked with my fellow Downtonians from last week's DVD-based viewing - this scene was not on our disc - what is going on here?!? I want every last frame of my DA!!!
summary: "British Version" is missing scenes aired on PBS!!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: ...drama, that is.  Downton Abbey just keeps piling it on; one scene of drama after another, on and on and on. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Update: I was considering buying this season a second time.  I originally bought it in November 2012 when it became available in the U.K. and then was very angry when I watched it on PBS in January 2013 to find that there were many additional scenes in Episodes 3, 4, 5 & 6 being shown on PBS.  I felt cheated. However, after reading several comments on one of the reviews here it appears that this DVD offering is no better than that I purchased from Amazon.com/uk.  Why there should be additional scenes shown on PBS and not included in the DVD versions is a mystery but many, many viewers are now aware of this discrepancy  and hopefully it will not happen again as the producers go forward with Season 4.This marvelous series gets better and better.  The guiding spirit that makes this production so much more wonderful than others is the fact that the creator, Julian Fellows, seems to have a benevolent view of life.  I haven't encountered this view since I last read the Brother Cadfael mysteries by Elllis Peters (Edith Pargeter).  Fellows has decided to show people at their very best - a most unusual approach to drama.  I think that this is the reason for Downton Abbey's world-wide success.  Dramatic contrast, which is necessary to keep our interest riveted on the characters, means that the Crawley family will continue to encounter adversity, but it is the way that they pull together that makes us care about them so deeply.  I received Season 3 about mid-November and have watched it every day since then.  It is glorious.I do have to complain that Fellows has gone off the rails once again (cf. the trial of John Bates) in the scene where Tom Branson is allegedly given a drink that makes him act oddly.  In fact: Branson, talking with Larry Gray, puts his cocktail glass down and walks away.  Larry puts something in Tom's glass.  Immediately thereafter dinner is announced and they all go in to dinner.  At that time, with before -dinner cocktails being a very new  phenomenon, people did not take their cocktails into dinner.  It's not like today when people are in a restaurant and take their cocktails from the bar to the dining room.  At that time wine was served with every course and everyone would have left their cocktails in the drawing room.  There was, therefore, no opportunity  for Tom to drink the doctored cocktail.  I think it is insulting that Fellows assumes that his viewers will not recognize the impossibility of these scenes.  The trial scenes were outrageous since there was no possible way for the prosecuting attorney to have knowledge of the events that Mrs. Hughes and Miss O'Brian were forced to testify to.  In Season 3 I was delighted to see that the resolution of Bates's situation was well thought out - logically and rationally and totally in character for everyone, so Julian Fellows can stay within the bounds of the possible when he wants to.  I wish he wanted to more often.  Why he allows his near-perfect series to be marred by these digressions into the impossible is a mystery to me.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: A feast for the eyes!  Great cast!  Great acting! The costumes are amazing but used realistically with restraint since those were difficult economic times. The women are informed and consulted, their opinions considered, by the men.  All those in the house work together for the common good with the exception of a couple of bad seeds (who could reform one day, who knows what the writers have in store?) I cry. I laugh. I am stimulated intellectually and visually. It is what I would expect from anything associated with Julian Fellowes.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Once you begin watching Downton Abbey, you will be hooked! The characters are so beautifully and completely drawn, their lives so nuanced and complex, that you will care deeply for each and every one, upstairs and down! The setting, the clothes, the mannerisms, all of the attention to period detail are another reason to watch.  I fought the trend towards watching the show on PBS, not getting how this could possibly be interesting.  Wow, was I wrong! Don't miss this show!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I am in love with Downton Abbey I think like anybody else that have seen this show.  I just received Season 3 and cannot wait to see it, so I spent two days just watching the series.  I am only giving 3 stars to this item simply because I am devastated with Mattew dead at the end and no returning to the show. I think it is unfair for us the fans that he is not returning.  I know this show will not be the same for me from now on.  Actors should think a little more of their fans and how much it will affect them before making the decision of not returning to the show just because they want to do something else.  We get used to them and see them as an important part of the show and then they leave.  Why not wait until the series are completely done!  Sorry for been so negative but I am very disapointed.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love the Butler Mr. Carson.  What else can I say?  The styles, fashion, are beautiful.  It's like the original Pride and Prejudice exponential.  The characters are interesting, fun, and, of course, British and there are no cell phones, lap-tops, internet.  There is this level of decorum and manners that I yearn for as a young "old soul" because our current society is so, well, ill-mannered.  This is great for all ages.  My girls 12, 14, 16 love it too.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: WWI is over and things are starting to get back to normal except.....everyone has changed.  Particularly the women.  Everything is there from the first two seasons, the drama, the heartache, the triumph  but the war has changed everyone and in a sense Downton  becomes less a guilty pleasure and more of a historical piece.  I love the series but could have done with one more year of dinners and frocks and filtered wine before the war took over.  As the Dowager Countess said "1920! Is it to be believed? I feel old as Methuselah.  When I think what the last 10 years has brought. God knows what we're in for now."

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Love the series.  The only thing about the season (spoiler alert) that gave me pause was it's pace and finale.  Some of the scenarios were rushed and I felt the viewers were cheated out of some key moments.  Perhaps it was the versions of the individual episodes that I saw that created the gaps, but then there was the finale which I thought was deplorable!  I could think of better ways to have written Matthew off that would have involved more of cousin Isobel (a somewhat underused source of great fun and interesting entertainment).  The writers took the easy way out.  That was wholly disappointing, I hope season 4 is better because I really like the stories and I am very attached to the characters.
summary: Historical and Soapy - What's not to love.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This program is just amazing. From the clothing , mannerisms, home furnishings, introduction of new electronics and vehicles of the age, to the whole ambiance ,this show has it covered !  We watch the characters develop through the changing times. Lovely! I have about 30 minutes left to watch, and am taking it slowly, for I don't want the Season to end !

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This series has all the things we used to look for in our entertainment. The good guys are really honorable. The love stories are from the heart and loyalty is considered a natural part of of everyday life. The villains are easy to recognize and there is no violence. In fact, there is no moment in the whole story that could not be watched by the whole family together.This is an epic tale about a family who stays together as the years pass, war comes and go, fortunes are lost and made again, hearts are wrenched by death and healed by a new generation. I would recommend it to everyone. The cast is superior and the use of an actual fantastic castle in England as the center of the story makes this the perfect series. I wish there were many more like this.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is one of the most correct programs I have watched.  The surroundings, the kitchen and most of all,  the costumes are all right on target.. I am 84 and a Scottish immigrant and my mother was "in service" as a young girl and she told me many stories that happened 'downstairs', and this series is true to what she told me.. My daughters are ardent fans and have turned many more friends to watch too, with having a rehash of the show on Monday mornings.  Thank you, cast, for making it so enjoyable and gripping to watch and look forward to each week.Mae Beaton,  Tampa, Florida.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Although Downton Abbey is fascinating and compelling, I take issue with the handling of several characters, and serious issue with the death of several major characters, especially Matthew in the end of the season episode. His death is abrupt, senseless, and gratuitous to the extent of being manipulative of the audience's emotions. This manipulation is clearly the writer's objective, but I found it to be obvious in a generally subtle show and annoying. In my view, manipulation of the audience's emotions to this extent reduces the show somewhat to an extremely classy soap opera.The first Mrs. Bates' character made no sense. Mr. Bates went to prison to cover for her. All right, why? What was her offense? Did he love her and then hate her? For no apparent reason? Her character was rotten to the extent of being primitive. No suicide for the purpose of blaming the spouse and causing the husband's execution makes sense whatsoever.Lady Edith's being jilted at the altar by Sir Anthony was ludicrous and totally non-credible, especially as we were led to believe he loved her.The soldier Patrick, whose face was mutilated and claimed to be the heir of the family's estate, was handled with crudity and disappeared just when he was becoming interesting and sympathetic in the extreme. This was not explained. It was therefore not remotely credible. A terrific story line was lost, actually thrown away when the young soldier was dismissed so cruelly, especially by the Earl, leading us to suspect him of selfish motives. This was confusing, as Patrick's assumed death on the Titanic was viewed as a tragedy by the family and led to the succession problem which occupied most of the miniseries.The interweaving of the many characters is admirably done in general, but should have been done so much more carefully in some cases.I couldn't believe for a moment the sudden death of the young Turkish diplomat in Mary's bed. Another gratuitous event that strained my credibility to the utmost.The writing is not weak. On the contrary. The writing is so strong and the story so compelling that I was severely disappointed by the above mentioned events. I don't like to be manipulated, especially when I'm otherwise enjoying the show immensely.
summary: I like it with serious reservations

review_text: I thoroughly enjoy watching this program.  Acting, directing, production are of high standards. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I gave Downton Abbey 5 stars because I  have been hooked since Season1.  My mom told me about it and at first I was hesitant, but decided to give it a try. Wow, am I glad I did.  I had just finished reading Canadce Camp romance novels which take place in Europe, very Jane Austin like, but with hot and heavy love scenes. Because I was reading of an era long ago with Earls,Lords,Butlers,Maids, and young women needing to find a husband while attending the Ton, I was in the mood for Downton Abbey.  The scenery is amazing, the music is fantastic, the acting superb, and the plot is so good, I can't wait to see the next episode.  My husband, who favors action thrillers, is even addicted to it. The only thing I don't understand is why the uncut U.K. version isn't aired on PBS. I don't know the difference, for I have only watched the uncut versions because I buy it on Amazon so I can watch them anytime on my Kindle. In a nutshell, I love it!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: So many had told me about Downton Abbey and I just kept putting it off, thinking it's just another show on TV, probably a story line I have seen over and over again, no need to rush and see it. Than one day I got on Prime and said let me see what all the fuss is about, Well say no more.. There is no other show like it on TV today, just absolutely love it and all its characters, amazing story lines, the scenery is spectacular, wardrobe makes me just wanna live in the Edwardian era. I am currently on S3 and trying to stretch them so that I DON'T catch up too quickly would hate a Saturday afternoon without my Downton. Kudos to Julian Fellowes for creating such a masterpiece, keep those seasons coming!! and Thank you for making my TV time more enjoyable.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Loved each season of Downton Abbey. I didn't watch the series when it first started so watching each episode of season 1-3 got me up to speed.I love the story line of the family during times of war, bad investments & into a more modern time. The clothing is exceptional as well as the picturesque scenery and castles. The automobiles are quite elegant & proper for the times.. I've grown to love the downstairs help as much as the kind & caring upstairs rich family. Love how the family has a English point of view that sometimes fights the American side that is shown in the Abbey's mother as well as her mother. Maggie Smith is quite a dame to watch. Her expressions & pauses just add to the very prim & proper English style. With the addition of Shirley Maclaine as the American material grandmother, I can laugh at "our" differences to that of the Abbey's inhabitants, whether downstairs help or upstairs upper class.I can't wait until season 4 commences in January! But I'm sad to see the two very painful deaths of the sister and husband of the eldest daughter. I'm still waiting for the 2nd daughter to finally find some degree of happiness in a marriage or maybe even a love affair!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have occasionally watched Masterpiece Theater thru the years but have not been "addicted" to any one show until now..................not only am I watching season 4............I plan on going back and watch it all from the beginning! title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Interesting drama that provides a glimpse of what life was like in the "class consciousness" Engllish society when  birthright and gender  mattered. But all in all...can't wait until next week!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I started watching this series about a week ago and was immediately hooked.  The storyline is awesome and the characters are also awesome.  You never know where the story is going to lead you.  It is brutally honest for time period it takes place in England.  The scenery is realistic without it being over dramatic.  The things that the household staff and the household themselves deal with on a daily basis is phenomenal.  This entire series is a must see for anyone and everyone!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I wish there were more than just 8 episodes per season; but I suppose that just keeps you coming back for more.  I wind up speaking with a British accent after watching these again and again.  The best part is the high-brow humor and the cattiness between the characters.  It's amazing that they can all stay in the same house and remain (somewhat) civil (relatively speaking).  Try it, you'll be hooked from the first episode.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The historical context for Downton Abbey is terrific.  The acting is well-done.  The clothes, the cars, the setting and the architecture are great.  But at the core of Downton Abbey, it's a soap opera.  It has more in common with JR Ewing than it does with JP Morgan. I wish them well, but be forewarned: the cliff-hangers and interpersonal drama drive their stories, not the historical drama.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Excellent characters that are played exceptionally well by all the actors.  The script is well written and transcends the viewer to the period in time and effortlessly takes you through the changes in time and tradition.  Well done.If anyone is just finding Downton Abbey you must see Season's 1 & 2 as you will better appreciate Season 3.  As Season 3 introduces Cora's mother (Shirly MacLaine) to the audience I was somewhat disappointed.  Ms MacLaine's dialog seemed "forced" not "natural" (in another sense it comes across as "acting").  I hope that this will change, as I am so looking forward to when the three (Matthew' mother, Grand Ma Ma, and Cora's mother) are in a scene together.  I can only imagine the jabs with such jest!!  Grand Ma Ma (Maggie Smith)is such a delight.  I find myself on many occasions laughing out loud at her retorts.Eagerly anticipating episode 2.
summary: Fabulous series.  Excellent characters that are played exceptionally well by all the actors.

review_text: This British series is about the family, friends and employees of an English earl. The series can be streamed to computer, Kindle or smart phone.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I can't resist the beautiful mansion and all its real and lavish decor. Neither can I resist judging the stiff upper class that has its problems simply by being upper class. The servants and their lives are suspenseful and far more interesting.  After the World War, however, life as the upper class knew it will never be the same again. The lower classes work for themselves and succeed in their own right, and the upper class has to scramble in order to survive.I love the character of Maggie Smith. She is hilarious.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I ended up buying this set about 2/3 of the way through the PBS run of Season 3. The fact that they are marked "Original UK Edition" led me to believe that these were more definitive editions than those being broadcast in the US right now, with additional footage. Nothing could be further from the truth! These have whole swaths of dialogue and even entire scenes missing as compared to the PBS episodes, often making the story less clear or reducing the impact of scenes that were set up earlier, in scenes that are now missing. These actually watch like a dumbed-down version of the Downton we know and love. I was extremely disappointed and I cannot recommend these discs to anyone unless they have no other option for watching the series. It also makes me very wary of purchasing anything from PBS's DVD label in the future, if I cannot trust them to present their shows in an unedited format.
summary: Don't waste your money.The episodes are edited, badly.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey is one of the best series I have watched.  The acting is first rate, the story line is engrossing. I love the way the story line changes from character to character and is sometimes unpredictable.  The series also does a nice job of educating you on the history of England and Scotland in the early 19 hundreds. I can't wait to see what will unfold in season four.
summary: Why I loved the first three seasons of downton Abbey

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love Downton Abbey, and all of its twisted little plots both Upstairs and Down. I had recorded each of the shows from season 3 and 4, and by mistake I deleted the finale of season 3 (showing the death of Matthew). So I recently ordered seasons 3&4 to go along with my earlier purchases of seasons 1 &2,  That's just how much I like the show.  And It would be nice to see the show evolve into earlier developing times in America when families of great wealth like the Astors, Vanderbilts, Morgans, and Rockefellers held great wealth, properties and businesses that made America grow into our present day great strength.And I never will forget in this past season 4's finale when Mr. Carson, (DA's Butler) dressed in a full set of tails, turned and started to conduct the orchestra at Lady Rose's Presentation ball as she was led into dance by none other than Prince Edward (the later on, advocated King).  That was an absolute BLAST that still gives me a chuckle when I think about it !
summary: I had to have Downton Abbey's, Seaon 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The character evolutions (or in some cases devolutions) are noticeable, especially when more characters are introduced. This, without doubt, is one of the finest productions to come down the pike. The music is memorable and immediately recognizable. It was a great thrill to hear Scott Joplin again, as brief as it was. The one character (no name needed) who seemed to cause an immediate uproar from reviewers in season 1 continues to gain attention until one realizes his homosexuality is his only redeeming value.It may be noted his perceived 'evil' is probably the result of his treatment by society in the early 1900's.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Through Amazon Prime I have been able to watch the entire Downton Abbey series from the first episode of Season 1 through the last cliffhanger of an episode of Season 3 in the span of 3 weeks.This is an amazing series! The portrayal of the Earl of Grantham (played masterfully by Hugh Bonneville) and his family in Yorkshire as they move from pre-WWI though the war and into post-WWI is indeed an historical masterpiece.I greatly enjoyed the elaborate  portrayal of Downton itself as a living entity, kept alive to maintain the rich tradition of the pre-war countryside estate.The mansion is glorious in its decor. The costumes are exquisite, changing with the times over the course of the series.The best part of the series, in my opinion, is the character development. From  the Crawley sisters down to the lowly kitchen maid, each character is given life and dimension, fleshed out by subtleties such as Lady Mary's Mona Lisa smile and beloved Butler Carson's barely audible groans of disapproval.The relationship between family  and house staff is fascinating. Two distinct classes, co-existing in the same house, totally inter-dependent yet seperate. The ladies' maids and the men's valets have rather charming personal relationships with the family member they serve. They assist in dressing, grooming, and keeping the schedule. Yet, unspoken is the role of confidant and companion to persons who lead a grand but often lonely life.Another dimension of the series I enjoy is the intrigue that goes on among the "downstairs" staff. Not as refined as their "upstairs" counterparts, many resort to sabotage and deceipt to get what they want....  a better position among the staff or the affections of another household member.I would be remiss if I did not mention the beautiful outdoor scenes in the series. The land surrounding Downton is lush and green. In Season 3, the family goes to the Highlands in Scotland to visit. The tour of the Scottish countryside is breathtaking.I am so glad to have the availability of this wonderful series at my fingertips through Prime. I cannot wait for Season 4!!
summary: This is Television at its finest!!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Great drama. Each actor from the lowest footman to the couple playing the King & Queen of England take their parts with the greatest seriousness. The result is a pitch perfect ensemble that tells story of the Human Condition regardless of one's tiltle, peerage, or economic status. It's simply good television in the same tradition of many other stories in this "genre."
summary: And We Will All Go On Together

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Season 3 of Downton Abbey, like all of the seasons, is top notch quality television viewing. You won't want to get up from your seat for a moment, there is always so much going on with all of the many characters. Of course, we all enjoy some of the situations more than others, but there is something in this show for all. There is so much that touches the heart, and so much that even angers you. Also, I think they mix in just the right amount of humor. Everyone has a favorite character, but the grandmother indeed keeps everyone on their toes!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: A friend of mine mentioned that she was disappointed that she wasn't able to view season three of the show since it left Hulu.  To console her, I sent her the CD's as a surprise.  While we were talking in the airport, I quickly ordered it online and had it shipped to her within minutes.  The video's were waiting for her when she returned from our trip, about a week later.  The process of ordering through delivery could not have been easier.  Her devotion to this show got me curious though, and I started watching it on Amazon Prime when I got back.  So happy all three seasons were available!  I watched from beginning to end in a very short time - great, great show!  Love Amazon prime...

review_text: I really love this show. However the ending was a little much. Spoiler alert! There is no reason to make another person die off. Yes, it helps the show to be more dramatic, but that doesn't mean that no one in the family can have a happy life. One pregnancy with a death was enough, speaking of Sybel. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: "Downton Abbey" is one of my favorite shows of all time, and I am giving this season four stars because I am super critical. I feel like this season, while I still enjoyed it enormously and it is far better than pretty much anything else on television, was super predictable and contrived. I am not going to post any spoilers, because the emotional impact of this season packs quite a punch and everyone deserves to enjoy that in full without being spoilers. My main issues are that, for example, the final event that happens at the very end of the bonus/Christmas episode is something that both my husband and I predicted right down to the letter...and we predicted it during the second episode. That's how much obvious foreshadowing I think there is in the various plots this year, which is a bummer. Sometimes the storylines are so obvious, the dialogue so contrived, that it just takes away from my enjoyment of the show as a whole.Another big disappointment--HUGE--is Shirley MacLaine's character. When I found out she would be joining the show, I was thrilled. ALl I pictures was Shirley and Maggie Smith trading zingers back and forth with a vengeance. Sadly, Shirley's role this season is pretty brief, and her character is much more watered-down than I ever imagined. I am stunned that her talents were not put to better use, and that more effort wasn't put into giving her a more dynamic character. It wasn't a bad character or a bad performance, but it wasn't at all up to par with what I was expecting. I think there was a huge missed opportunity here.That is NOT to say that this is a bad season at all. It's not. It's fabulous and I enjoyed every second of it (well, except the horribly depressing parts, and I am warning you all, there are plenty of those). There are some great storylines, many surprises, and so much emotion. In terms of each character's individual stories, I think Season 3 has been the best season by far, at least as far as individual character development goes. Viewers will be emotionally rocked to the core (and totally depressed) more than once this season, and I have absolutely no idea where next season is going. But, as always, I can't wait to find out.As for the boxed set itself, it's fabulous. Great design, helpful chapter titles, and great special features packed into three discs. You won't be disappointed.
summary: Four stars for this five-star show

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey is the name of the grand country home of the Crawley Family. Headed by Lord Robert Crawley, Earl of Grantham (Hugh Bonneville). Robert is worried about the heritage and his dwindling estate...he has no sons, but three daughters with his wife Cora (Elizabeth McGovern).When season one opens, his nearest male heir, the apparent beneficiary of the estate, who is the fiance of his eldest daughter Lady Mary (Michelle Dockery). The next closest male heir in line is a distant cousin, Matthew (Dan Stevens), a lawyer who doesn't really have any interest in the estate. Convinced by his widowed mother Isobel (Penelope WIlton) to move with her to the estate from Manchester, Matthew is supposed to marry Lord Mary. His rather modern-notioned mother clashes with Violet Crawley, the Dowager Countess of Grantham (Maggie Smith).As if the dwindling estate and his daughters marriage is not enough of a story line, the viewer is treated to the lives of the servants of the estate as well, almost reminiscent of the earlier, very successful BBC program, Upstairs Downstairs.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I am normally not the type of TV viewer who goes in for poofy British dramas about snobby, erudite men who can't dress themselves, but still wear tails every time they sit down to dinner. But for some reason this show has drawn me in. I have grown to know the characters and genuinely care about what happens to them from episode to episode. And there is no shortage of sub-plots and twists to keep me interested. For a guy whose favorite shows are Rescue Me, Breaking Bad, and Sons of Anarchy, I have been surprised at how much I have enjoyed all three seasons of Downton and I am looking forward to the fourth season with great anticipation.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: As a retired Hollywood gaffer with 40 years of film/tv lighting behind me, and a an eye trained to oberve every detail of what I see on the screen, I'll skip the more general reviews to say this: Downton Abbey is the absolute state of the art in every production aspect -- lighting and cinematography, art direction, wardrobe, sets, hair and makeup. Downton was shot with the greatest of care and must have had a huge budget. Even the hair styles, which I rarely judge, caught my eye. Each character has a style that reinforces who they are, an example being O'Brian's frumpy hair style which perfectly matches her conflicted character as an obsessive gossip and trouble-maker, and combined with her subtle make-up conceals the fact that she's actually an attractive woman. Assuming the interiors were shot on stage, the sets were flawless. The wardrobe, as it changes over time to keep up with fashions, is as good as it gets, and the wardrobe budget alone must easily have exceeded the cost of producing a low-budget feature. Of all the global centers of film/tv production, only Britain with their great cinematographers and seemingly inexhaustible supply of talented actors provided by their robust theater tradition, can match Hollywood or New York. When I watch Downton, I can look right through it and see the great craftsmanship and hard work behind it, so here's a tip of my hat and a raised glass to my fellow film/tv workers of Britain who labored so long and so hard to create this fabulous, perfect production.For those Downton fans like myself who want to dig deeper into the details of being "in service" take a look at "Manor House", another British series that some British friends recommended to me. "Manor House", a six episode sort of reality hybrid, available on Amazon Instant Video that takes a handful of non-actors, outfits them in period wardrobe and puts  them to work as servants in a Scottish manor for six weeks to explain the historical background and look deeper into the fascinating details of their jobs, their restrictions, and the elaborate protocol to be observed between upstairs and downstairs. "Manor House",

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Unless I can go back and take stars away from things I've already given 5 stars, this program breaks the 5 star system for me.  I did not think that any television production in the 21st century could portray such humanity.Unless you really hate costume period pieces; romances; great acting; incredible lighting, make-up, costumes, antiques, art,  classic British autos, and historical realism, you should find something to like about this show.  Even if you are something of a misanthrope, you'll find yourself empathizing with the characters as real people.If there was one possible negative criticism, it would have to be a politically oriented one, perhaps centering on the gentle, nostalgic portrayal of an aristocracy that had outlived its usefulness.  But then again, they were a historical fact, aptly portrayed here in their splendor and human frailty.  It would be a far reach to criticize this absolutely sweet and stirring drama for somehow glorifying or trying to bring back the problems of this era.  While possibly romanticizing the wealth and power of the few, it does remind us of the horrors of the era - the brutality of WWI, the mass death of the influenza epidemic, etc. and it often brings us hopefully back to the present with it's treatment of progress on social issues that persist to this day.My wife and I watched all 3 seasons of Downton Abbey over a period of two weeks.  It was one of the very rare times that we have ever sat spellbound in front of the boob tube for 8 hours straight over a weekend.  We did tune in for the last 4 minutes of the Superbowl afterward - but only because it was about time the Ravens won!  :)

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Like the scenery and the food.  Enjoy watching all the various outfits.  Otherwise this show is no that good.  When a baby is born a main character dies??  Even the smart arsed  "Grandmama" played by the wonderful Dame Maggie Smith (will she be 80 yrs old this year!) remarks are becoming predictable and boring.  Miss goodie two shoes from downstairs was so sweet and kind at the first has just gone over the edge for me.  She and her husband have become sickly-sweet to me, all though I do still like them (probably my favorites of the show).  He is a bit more street smarts, which I think will save their marriage in the end and they will go far, once they get that farm.  I absolutely hate Lady Mary and wish she would have died instead of Sybil...in fact, I think an interesting plot turn would have been for Sybil and husband to both survive their daughter's death, but for some reason stay on as regulars at the Abbey, then Lady Mary have her little boy (and still have that "perfect" look), but she and her husband get mauled by an escaped circus bear while walking the grounds of Downton!!  Ha!  that would be a twist!  Then Lady Sybil and her husband would raised Mary's child and their own as Roman Catholic cousins!!  LOL...then when they grew up, they would marry then the chauffer would become the true leader of Downton Abbey!!  What a show!  You may wonder why I even bother to watch this show...I figure if it's good enough for my president, his wife, all my friends and relatives, then it should be good enough for me.  Peace Out, people!!
summary: COME ON...IT IS SIMPLY NOT THAT GOOD

review_text: Downton Abbey ranks among one of the best series I've ever seen. It has everything you could ask for in a phenomenal show. Seasons 1 and 2 were magnificent and I couldn't wait to watch season 3. It too turned out to be another hit and didn't let up on the drama of Downton. But the ending was a sheer jolt. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: After hearing so much about how amazing 'Downton Abbey' is, I decided to see what all the fuss was about.  So, I watched the first episode.  Then, the next.  Until finally, I watched all of season one in just 3 days.  Yep, it's addicting and here's why:I consider Downton Abbey one of the best television series to date.  It's a refreshing storyline to watch as it explores an era that has barely been seen in an entire TV series. We are introduced to many fictional characters who take us through a nonfictional world. The historical timeline of events that are brought up in the series gives us a new look into what life was like back when the telephone became a greater deal, when women began discovering the right to have choices, and when World War I created a transition into a different and unsettling world.The writers also do a fantastic job in revealing the perfect amount of back story and depth to each character and I absolutely love that we have the chance to get attached to characters from various backgrounds.  I also think that this show could not have been casted any better.  There is an exceptional range of talented actors and actresses that do an incredible job developing their characters throughout the series.If you haven't watched 'Downton Abbey' yet, then I hope my review has convinced you to see what all of the necessary excitement over this show is all about.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Great show... just discovered it this year and we've already caught up through Season 3.  Each season just keeps getting better.  Better yet... no commercials!It's all about a great story line that keeps your interest... a great setting that is very authentic and very good acting.  It goes to show that they can make a compelling and popular program without a lot of graphic violence or in-your-face sex.  Not a prude here by any means but increasingly find that some of the over-the-top graphic blood and guts on show has gone beyond anything necessary and rather distracting from the story (or maybe it's to cover for the lack of a story).  In any event, it was rather refreshing to see a program like Downton Abbey that keeps your interest simply with a good story, authentic setting and strong acting.  Kudos to PBS and those brits.Can't wait to watch Season 4.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: After waiting for several months, Season 3 is finally getting underway with more intrigues, suspense, unexpected twists and turns, subplots............all the things that make Downton Abbey a program that keeps one anxiously awaiting the next episode.Although I've only been able to watch the first 3 episodes of Season 3, it hasn't failed tailed to keep me on the edge of my seat wondering what is going to happen among the inhabitants of the Abbey, both aristocrats and downstairs servants. There's plenty of exciting things going on among the Abbey's residents. The addition of Shirley Maclaine as Lady Grantham's American mother stirs up plenty of new excitement and contention among the family with her sarcasm and disdain for the stuffy ways of the English aristocracy although she proves to offer a novel solution to the Grantham's spur of the moment dinner party disaster. Lady Mary continues to be headstrong and even takes a stand against her mother when Downton's future seems doomed, offering a glimpse of just how deeply English tradition is ingrained in some of the Granthams despite a seemingly hopeless future for their privileged way of life. Lady Judith's husband finds an unexpected ally among the blue-bloods when he returns for Mary's wedding. Things take an ugly turn between former allied trouble makers downstairs and keeps the suspense up between O'Brien and the duplicitous footman.she once plotted with to wreak troubles amid those in service as well as the Grantham family. Edith's role as spinster is finally resolved............maybe. I'm not saying any more. Just watch and you will find the Season 3 to continue offering excitement that keeps you impatiently waiting for the next episode. All the things that made the first two seasons entertaining continues right on with new and unexpected story lines in Season 3.

review_text: I heard about the hype, but thought nothing of it.  Then one day I didn't feel like watching what my husband had playing on TV, so I thought I'd check out an episode and SNAP, I was hooked.  I ended up watching the first three seasons via Amazon Prime in one week.  Every free minute I had I was glued to the screen.  I don't know what it is about the characters, but they draw you in and you can't wait to see what happens.  There is no cursing, violence, sex, it's just a very well written drama that draws you in and makes you love the characters and itching to see what happens next.

review_text: Season 3 of Downton Abbey is full of surprises! TV Drama at its Finest! The first 2 seasons of Downton were great but Season 3 is outstanding. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The production value, acting, dialogue writing, etcetera is just great. Really. The sets, the locations, costuming, everything about this show is great.Except all the characters are petty jerks. The aristocracy are so concerned about their stupid money and social standing one just wants to smack every last one of them hard in the face. I know, "people of their times" blah blah. They're all jerks.The help are a bunch of hysterical, sycophantic, two-faced ass-kissers. I think its possible they are even more pompous and insufferable then their "betters". They're jerks too.Turn off the sound and listen to some Elgar and it MAY be possible to enjoy this ridiculous soap opera.The stars are for the production.
