title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This might be the original U.K. version but it is not the "uncut" version shown in the United States.  The DVDs do not include some scenes that were shown on air by PBS, including Daisy's first visit with Mr. Mason and the downstairs talk about baby formula.  Each of the three discs is bookended by that annoying Ralph Lauren commercial.  It pops up when you push "play" for the first episode and ends the last episode on each disc so it is almost impossible to avoid, but you can fast forward or skip over it.  Let me say that outright commercials embedded in a DVD set I bought and paid for is pretty unforgivable - especially in a set put together by an ostensibly commercial-free station.  The final Highlands episode is included.  This set is okay to scratch the Downton Abbey itch, but purists might want to wait for a deluxe version that comes from the producers.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm a little late to the Downton saga and saga it is!  Other than the fact I suspect most Americans cannot understand the incredible attachment to a house, the series is a marvelous look into one of my favorite periods of history - early 20th century in one of my favorite countries -England.  The interiors, the flowers, the style, grace, manners all so marvelous to watch.  Extremely well acted, I've now gone on to binge watch all three seasons and the first episodes of Season 4.  I'm making my personal predictions as to who ends up with whom - in the meantime, pure pleasure to watch.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I accomplished my goal of watching all three seasons by the beginning of the fourth season.  I had expected that by the third season my interest would wane but that was definitely not the case! I love the character development and the intertwining of the lives of the staff and the nobility.  It's also intriguing to see the societal changes from the end of WWI and the changing economic picture of the early 1920's and the effects on the grand estates of the gentry.  Those effects are felt by the staff and the family too.  What a marvelous show!  Can't wait to see Season 4 unfold.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Well done period piece incorporating real historical events (e.g. WWI, Spanish Flu, the Titanic) in the story lines. Full of hidden treasures that jump out at people who know, such as a clever French phrase used under one's breath at the proper moment during dinner or talk about investing with some American investor by the name of Ponzi. Every episode is a delight in spite of some very tragic moments. Nice introduction to what it must have been like living in a class society.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Every character, every word, every interaction transports me to Downton Abbey. The characters stay so true to their time and true to themselves. Their integrity to their time, their humanity, their changing world brings to each episode all the internal and external struggle we all deal with individually, in families, and in communities today. I so love and enjoy this story, and the relationships. As sad and painful as the losses of family members are they are real and honest in every aspect. A simple case of death being the great equalizer for all of us being handled with honesty and humanity.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: In this sad world today I am so thankful I have found this series. This series will not only keep you on the edge of your seat but will make your heart very glad with the ending of each episode for every season. You owe it to yourself to see all the glamor, and, heartheak and joy this family carries with grace and dignity. And please do begin with Season one. I am so happy I have found this wonderful story. It makes me feel so very happy. What a wonderful series.

Each season bought new depth to old characters, added some new ones and took some favorite ones, just like real life. I have enjoyed the series immensely and can't wait for season 4 to air in January!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Once again the British have captured the imaginations of a US audience with the superior acting and storyline in the presentation of Downton Abbey. Not only are we intrigued with the lives of the early 20th century wealthy, but involved with the everyday trauma and drama of the servant class. While many of us are not maids and butlers, we just love to identify with their struggles. Justifiable we are secretly pleased that even ghastly enormous wealth simply cannot buy happiness!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: To me, Downton Abbey is a "cool" version of Pride & Prejudice. Yes, it's a lot of relational drama, but it's done so incredibly well (and to me, more interesting) in comparison to Pride & Prejudice. As a guy, Pride & Prejudice seems to be a bunch of women walking around talking. That's it. Downton Abbey is different in that it shows what's going on in the servants' area as well as with the lords and ladies, and the plot and character development is even better.Season 3 continues this trend and doesn't let up. The issues that began in previous seasons are continued (some finalized), and new, interesting issues arise. The acting, character development, and plot development continue to be top-notch. I'm looking forward to finishing this season and waiting on the next.A note about the TV Pass: I think it's worth it if you're a huge fan of the series, and could be considered a discount from having to purchase an entire season later, but it's not an incredible deal. A little bit of a deal, but not spectacular.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Following what was an excellent season 1, which I am sure was a pleasant surprise for many, I was hooked and the series has become one of Public Television's biggest hits ever.  It has so many stars and each fits his or her role perfectly.  The story line is captivating and there are no dull moments as scene move quickly from place and character to others rapidly.  The music is such a great part of the supporting cast.  The series has performances that are at the top of the list and it is represented yearly at the Emmy's.  Millions around the world have been seduced by the straight-laced but stylish world of the British historical drama.  The main characters Hugh Bonneville, Maggie Smith, Michelle Dockery, and Elizabeth Montgomery could win Best in their categories each year.  I found the story line to be such as to force me to watch one episode after another and before I knew it I had watched the first three seasons completely.  It was as if I had been drawn into the surrounding, but in my case I was privy to everyone's secrets and behaviors.  I can hardly wait for Season 4 to arrive in January 2014.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: By far, this series, up until the near the end of Season Three, has been the most intelligent, engrossing, and well written I have taken the time to watch in years.  I found myself engrossed in the depth of the characters; enamored with acting, costumes, scenery, and brilliant twists in all subplots.  I would have been beyond impatient waiting for Season Four had the ending of Season Three not been so horrid.  The development of Matthew's character was one of the main reasons I so looked forward to future episodes; I couldn't wait to see how he would save Downton and even possibly bring to it an even more exciting future.  But now, I have no desire to watch next season.  The plans I had to purchase all three seasons on DVD for my parents as a Christmas gift are now by the wayside because it is just too dreadful to watch.  So sad to see a beautiful series disintegrate.  The only way I will reconsider is if by some remarkable twist, Matthew survived the crash.  I'll wait to hear from friends who choose to watch in January ... but as mentioned, they've lost my business for now.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I enjoy watching Downton Abbey on PBS each season, and am thrilled to be able to have the seasons available for viewing between seasons. It is nice to have something to watch that doesn't insult my intelligence or assault me with a reliance on crude, unimaginitive language or gratuitous sex scenes.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love this series. It has a great script, sets, actors, and photography. It's a great period piece that's fun to watch. I can't wait for the next season!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The excellence keeps right on coming!  Joy and grief, animosity and changed attitudes are only the beginning.  The chasm between the aristocracy and the downstairs servants is growing more and more narrow as the group continue to grow into what can only be viewed as family.  Although the "chain of command" remains intact, the emotional connections both "classes" have for each other is palpable.  I am in love with this series and wish we in the US could see it in September along with those in the UK instead if waiting till January!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Warning: A minefield of Spoilers!Downton Abbey is addictive, especially if you opt for the Britisn version, not the somewhat dumbed down version edited for American tastes. The saga of an aristocratic British family in the years just before and after the first World War, it's a gorgeous look at the fashions, morals, social distinctions and events of the era. Sometimes it's a little overwrought, but when you're watching, you get so caught up, it's all good.  Season one introduced us to The Earl of Grantham, his wife and mother, his three daughters, the various servants, and Matthew Crawley, the new heir to the estate. Season two revealed the on again off again love affair between Matthew and Daughter Mary. Season 3 was even better and kept us enthralled with what those Crawleys were up to now. We were happy in our little fool's paradise...until that last episode.Matthew Crawley is like one of those Good News/Bad News jokes.  Downton Abbey is entailed. That means it can only be inherited by the closest living male relative to the current owner.  That's good news for Matthew...turns out, he's the only living heir.  The bad news? The family thinks he's a dork.  The good news, they have a beautiful daughter named Mary. Matthew likes her. A lot. Bad news? She thinks he's a major dork.  Good News: She suddenly has a change of heart. Bad news? Because if she marries Matthew, the state passes to her son and stays in the family. Good News, she changes her mind Bad news: It's too late, Matthew has met someone else even though he still loves Mary.It goes on and on and on this way. WWI intervenes and poor Matthew is MIA and then found. Twice. He's killed in action at least once, but VOILA! it's a mistake. He's fine. Ooops, no, he's seriously wounded. But he recovers. One problem gets settled and another appears.  The estate is bankrupt and then a timely inheritance makes it solvent again. Finally, in Season 3, all the problems seem to be sorting themselves out and despite one heart-breaking family tragedy, we are smiling through our tears. Watching that final Season 3 episode, we are lulled into a false sense of security...and that's when the writers stick a shiv into our hearts.Not fair. Not nice and not fair. I would be devastated, but I have one desperate hope left.  Matthew has been put through the wringer for all 3 seasons and he just keeps coming back, so i have my fingers crossed that this is going to be fixed in Season 4.  Even if the writers have to come up with a "Dallas" like dream ending. I don't care I just want them to fix it.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What a load of pretentious crap, and utterly predictable at that. Nothing more than a tiresome collection of shopworn plot devices and cliches. I guess some hack figured that if they could package it as a stuffy period drama they could sell it even though it's just more of the same, but with lush locations and actors with proper British accents, all of a sudden it becomes highbrow. Sure. That and $5 will get you an overpriced cup of coffee that you can enjoy while you feel as though you are broadening your horizons. Why not just watch a proper soap opera and be done with it? At least those don't try to pretend to be something they aren't. Much of the cast is superb, though. It's a shame they chose to lower themselves to participate in something this embarrassingly bad.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: As much as I love "Downton Abbey," I was shocked when I discovered that the PBS broadcast version contains material that is not on the UK-edition DVD. PBS is doing their viewers a distinct disservice by only selling the UK version on disc and not warning purchasers that it does not contain all the scenes that it is showing on television. The differences appear to be brief and minor, but they are still important and they cast various characters and situations in a new light.It is unclear if PBS will ever release the US version of the show on disc but they should be providing accurate information to purchasers on just what it is we're paying for. I have read that there is allegedly a Christmas special in season 3, but if so it is not included in this set and PBS has not indicated whether it will be broadcast.As a devoted fan, I want to know that I can get ALL of "DA" on DVD. Come on, PBS--come clean! I would give the series itself 5 stars, of course, but the DVD release only gets three because of the misrepresentation and the missing scenes.
summary: Buyer beware: this is not the PBS version

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: We've watched all episodes available. Love this show. Such wonderful production and terrific actors. I did live in England as a child and this show brings back great memories of 'common' country folk, who haven't changed all that much.Sure, the show can get a little confusing, as it has a huge cast, so I find myself re-watching many episodes and get something a little new each time. But that's just me, I think. There is just plain nothing bad about it. Certainly is not a boring show. There are layers of subplots going on behind the episodes main story.My GF and I really hope this program has a long and healthy life. A truly wonderful show.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: After watching three seasons of the show a few weak point have come to my attention: 1) Character development: There is hardly any character development in anyone other than O' Brien who become a nicer character, and Daisy who has changed due to her relationship with William. The rest of the characters are essentially acting the same person in the same role as season 1, producing reactionary character where the only thing that changes are the challenges they faced with. I mean it. They utilize the same facial expressions, same body language, their clothes change though, but everything else is the same. It's been a decade already in the show for crying out loud! Not only that but the closed mindedness of the Grantham house hold is astonishing and I have started to foster a dislike of Lord Grantham and Mary in particular due to their inability to face their privilege of allow themselves to be challenged in order to grow.

review_text: I just recently finished watching seasons 1 & 2.  I had heard of so many people touting this series.  I watched both seasons in a couple of sittings.  I LOVED it. I have purchased season 3, can't wait to have the time to watch it in one setting.  Really looking forward to season 4 in January.  Highly recommend it to all.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This has to be the best series in a long time. The characters are so well acted and the episodes are so well written. It has everything including drama, romance, and humor. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This show has been my favorite of all British shows and the plots and subplots are intertwined and linked together with great finesse  and the only fault I find is the grammar and language so that some of it does not fit well.  Otherwise I have no complaints.  I think it is very well done and the central actors are professional and very likeable and work together very well.  I am very sorry Mathew dies at the end of season 3 but I await the next season with great anticipation. I just wish they would show season 3 again before season 4 commences to get back into the groove.
summary: I have watched from the first show and I love the show

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: It is refreshing to see a television program that is appropriate to recommend to teenagers up to the very older people. It does not contain the usual foul language, sexual scenes, and violence that are so prevalent today.  It is about a loving family who treats their "servants" as they were called at the time, with respect.  The personal lives of the staff is also an integral part of the story, making it much more interesting.  Loved it!
summary: Wonderful period drama.  Excellent writing and acting.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: If you need some relaxing time or need an escape all the downton abbey series is a mini world imitation of our society complete with kind people, strong people, easy people, difficult people, social climbers and people who know who they are regardless of what others think.  It is fun to get into their heads and world and lose your own world for a relaxing hour or two!  Highly recommend!

The story lines keep me interested, so that I find a way to watch the next episode.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I highly recommend this series to everyone!  Everything about it is extremely well done.  The actors and actresses give incredibly believable performances of those who would have lived during this period of time.  Especially enjoyable and informative has been the relationship between the aristocracy and their servants.  I am continually in awe of my new insights into this historical period and the fascination of how drastically society has changed.  The Abbey with its furnishings, the clothing and jewelry...are amazing and transport one into this fascinating period of history.  I'm so addicted to these characters and their story, I can't wait to purchase the 4th season (although I wish I had the self-restraint to watch it weekly.)

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This show was recommended by a friend who said that it was all the rage in Costa Rica and that everybody was watching it, so I just had to check it out.  I am here to say it is a great series!  I enjoy it because it is fast paced, interesting and the characters are real.  Didn't expect that it would be humorous but it is definitely that, albeit the dry humor of the English!  Love it and am looking forward to Season 4!
summary: Great Series!  Looking forward to Season 4

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Fabulous story. Didn't think I liked that period in film, but I love it. Anyone would. The story just has you glued to the screen. Went through all three seasons in less than a week and now I just feel empty. NEED season 4 as soon as possible. Done brilliantly! Bravo.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I loved this show so much that I watch it every night and can't wait for the 4th season to come out.  It was great to see how the relationships were between the service people and the royal family.  I liked how polite and considered they were of each other.  The end of the season was a surprise when Matthew was killed right after the baby was born.  I don't understand why they have so much death.  But I still loved the show.  It was very addicting, I couldn't wait to watch the next eposide.  Please bring out season 4 asap!

review_text: This series is probably my most favorite of all time.  It is true to the period, has an EXCELLENT cast with superbly drawn characters and is extremely well written. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Once again, the British have written and produced the best television drama series in its history.  Wonderful period piece filmed in an most amazing castle/mansion in England.  Lush scenery, gorgeous period decor, and authentic dress worn during the years right after the turn of the twentieth century (1916 and forward).  One of the first dramas to follow not only the lives and times of the ruling family, but also the little known lives of the servants.  Fascinating look at the leisurely lifestyle of the wealthy in stark contrast to the long and laborious hours spent by the servants to ensure the impeccable cleanliness and smooth running of the household.  A cultural look at the now almost gone royalty way of life in England.  Be sure to tune in as you won't regret following this interesting series.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I just received my brand new Kindle Fire HD a few days ago, and was fooling around with it in order to become familiar with what I could do with my new toy.  I randomly selected Downton Abbey to watch.  Once I'd watched only a few minutes, I was drawn into the story and have become addicted to it!  The characters slowly but beautifully unfold, the acting is superb, the film quality top of the line, the costumes and sounds and scenery amazingly authentic and lush.  I've finished the first season, and have begun the second.  I've laughed and cried right along with the characters and can say, without reservation, this is as close to reading a great novel as it can get and a very pleasurable and most welcome escape! The series' five star rating is well deserved!
summary: Oh my Gosh!  I totally LOVE this series!

review_text: The attention to detail is fantastic.  Weaving an entertaining fictional story about a family into historic events and times. I really enjoy Downton Abbey and the characters and highly recommend this searies.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Strong characters and compelling story-lines give an inside look into the early 20th century version of the 1% in the UK, the royals, and the complex group of supporting staff and surrounding villages directly impacted by them.  Acting is superb.  I find it interesting to get a sense of the problems and challenges that faced the upper-upper class during this time in history (as the world left behind WWI and entered the roaring twenties).  I recommend watching all episodes in order as the storylines and character development stretch over many episodes at a time.  Spoiler alert!  I was frustrated at how long Bates was incarcerated, and the final episode surprise is a gut-wrencher!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What's not to love about Downton Abbey?  Intelligent. Witty. Spectacular. Engaging. And more and more superlatives!  This series, from start to the end of season 3, has been an emotional roller-coaster ride with no foul language, excessive sex or violence.  The interplay of the characters is realistic historically while easily addressing modern family and culture-clash issues. It's a soap, all right.  It's just really, really smart soap.  The dialogue is always interesting, well written and never sappy.  The issues the characters face are issues we face today.  The juxtaposition of modern issues played out in an historical background make the show so interesting, engaging and addicting!  My advice: Do not start watching this series if you don't have a lot of time for television!  Once you start, you will not want to quit until you've seen every episode. Twice! The costumes, landscape, art and every other aspect of the production are to the highest standards.  Beautiful to watch. Elegant to hear. Irresistibly entertaining.  What's not to love?

review_text: Well written, well acted and very enjoyable.  Even the characters I hate show redeeming qualities.  The class warfare of the times is very interesting to me. But, maybe that is part of what makes it so enjoyable.Because of the show, I read the history of Highclere Castle and delved into 1920's history.  I love it when a quality show makes me interested in history enough to research and talk about how it was.  Thank you BBC for this excellent program.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: After becoming hooked with Seasons 1 and 2, Season 3 left me saturated and "over it." Particularly disturbing to me are the deaths of Sybil and Matthew, both seemingly gratuitous (although actors will leave the show, I presume, so must be written out), but more seriously these were horribly portrayed, particularly Sybil's. I felt nauseous in watching it. Then Matthew's demise at the end seemed another sensationalistic cheap shot to me, especially the way he was shown in the moment of death. These portrayals may indicate the writer is getting carried away, or maybe such a series is meant to end earlier. Season 3 started the show downhill for me and I won't be back for more.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Even though Downton has seen its heyday since season 1, we can't but help to follow our beloved characters through another season. Season 3 deals life after the war and how the story will accommodate the actors who want to leave one the hottest television shows across the world.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: How can you NOT like Downton Abbey!  It's really an amazing series.  It's literally the only series I watch these days that a lot of my friends are also into, and WITHOUT all the violence and nudity!  Seems like everything has it these days, but Downton Abbey doesn't and is still at the top of my list of series to watch. I highly recommend it if you love period pieces like I do.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love this series!!  Besides it being well done: writing, acting and staged, it is truly clean. Thank you do much!  MORE, MORE, MORE...

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm enjoying seeing the changes that took place after the turn of the century. I think the show does a great job of portraying those who embraced the changes and those who found them hard to accept. I love this series.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Splendid characters with gorgeous scenery, decor and costumes. Storyline covers a time period that is not often done. A treat!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'd given up on the show after the live broadcast  Season 2. I was wary of watching any more glorification of the English class system. I was persuaded to pick it up again with Season 3 and I have been transfixed by the quality of the writing and the exploration of many themes that came into play as the C20th century progressed. In short, the class system was presented with many of its various vicissitudes. That made it philosophically acceptable for me!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm not one to spend time with drama series, but I was hooked on episode 1 of season 1 and have watched every episode from season 1 to season 3. Can't wait to see what season 4 will bring. The interaction between all of the characters is superb, the story line is excellent. You will get hooked on this series for sure.
summary: One of the best drama's ever.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This show was beautifully made.  Greas developed characters, beautiful costumes from hair to shoes.  Engaging story. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Along with previous really good Masterpiece Theatre costume drama productions from the BBC and ITV in the UK, such as 'Upstairs, Downstairs" (the original version), "The Pallisers", "Brideshead Revisited", and a few other 5-star series, "Downton Abbey" hits the mark with great casting as usual, and excellent acting with wonderful character portrayals.In this series, Dame Maggie Smith, Hugh Bonneville, and Michelle Dockery are stand out characters, but that statement seems unfair to the rest of the cast who all do a marvelous job in their respective roles.Overall this is a truly wonderful series, although Season 4 was personally a little disappointing due to the choice of characters that Julian Fellowes chose for a rather nasty turn of events in episode 2.  This tarnished the series a little for me.  We shall see what awaits us in Season 5.  But nevertheless, a jolly good show!
summary: Wonderful Series - Great Casting and Actors!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I take it season 4 has begun.  I really like this series and just love the period costumes.  The story lines and characters are fantastic.  I hope there are many more seasons to come.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Season one was the perfect blend of drama and humor.  By the time you watch season 3, there seems to be only struggle and sorrow.  I miss that balance of humor.  Even Granny isn't humorous anymore.  It's still one of the best TV series I've seen in years though.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: If you like any programs about the Brittish and 1920's nobility, plus plots,  mystery and romance - you will like Downtown Abbey. You will get involved in the lives of the Crawley Family and their wait staff through their day to day living. I'm hooked! Watch all 4 seasons!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is a period soap opera type series but with good actors.  There are so many different stories going on, I couldn't stop watching once I started.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I really enjoy it and I'm not much of a tv person but I don't want it to end... I wish I lived in that era.. :o)

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: It seems that the writing for this season has been driven more by expiring contracts than by creativity and plot development. Edith came into her own this season. Maggie Smith is always worth the price of admission. But the number of characters killed off has left a rather tawdry and implausibly Gothic palette with which to carry the series forward. Too bad the producers could not have locked in option extensions for actors to allow for reasonable and coherent exits and entrances. Will look for next season, but with far less anticipation than before.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I loved this show.  Friends told me to watch and I was not disappointed. I really enjoy period drama and I learned a lot from this.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

It was it's usual excellent self, the series, and hope that there will be a season four.... given the ending, there are a zillion ways it could go on in its next season.enjoyed the excellence of the acting, the sets, the history, and how the shifting of our ways affects us all...

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have been enjoying this series and Season 3 is no exception.  The stories have such twists and turns you never know what is going to happen which is great.  I can not believe people actually lived that way, such a class system.  Now if they would just get rid of Thomas I would be  happy.  Maybe in Season 4.I do recommend this series to others.  Julian Fellows who writes the series has an amazing mind.  I hope it keep on going.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Step back in time to a gentler, refined period of history.  I enjoyed this show so much more than say, The Tudors, where there was too much violence and mean intrigue for me.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I cannot tell you how much I have enjoyed watching this program. We need more thinking shows with great acting and actors who do not have a three day growth of stubble on their faces.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey provides a great escape to experience life in Anotjer time and place.  This series is entertaining, full of surprises and emotionally touching.  Beginning with life in rural England in 1912 on a large estate with a staff that plays an integral part in family life, it is easy to imagine that this is a reality show of long ago. The luxury and lifestyle offer an escape from the world of today and yet provides a glimpse of where some of our traditions originated. Five stars all the way!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I am one of many Downton fans. The series has captured me and keeps me stunned at the occurances. Season 3 was a real heart stopper and at times a heart breaker.  I will not say more. I don't want to ruin it if you haven't seen it.  If you have not watched it then you have missed some real talent in acting and writing. Watch season one and two first to get to understand the dynamics of the house. My only regret is that I don't have cable so I have to wait until soneone puts it on streaming to watch. This could take up to a year. Bummer!. It's absolutely worth the watch!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I was hooked to Downton Abbey from the very first season, and the third season is starting off great too. Never a disappointment.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This series gets the highest rating due to the fact that, like a great book, I couldn't wait to find out what happened next!  Great character development has you rooting for your favorites while despising the antagonists.  Just watch it and see what I mean!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I truly love Downton Abbey - each season so far is facinating, smart and I imagine very close to how events would unfold  in a large manor house with all of the characters, both upstairs and down.  I believe part of the appeal of this series is the humaness of the Crawleys - yes, they are 'the elite' yet, they are caring people of those they love and those that serve them.  Mistakes are made; forgiveness, given.  No matter if it's your worst enemy or your own sister.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: My wife and I became ‘hooked’ on the series immediately after watching the first show on PBS.  The show is well written and full of surprises as one could expect in any life.  What makes this series special is the attention to detail in the day to day life of the English aristocracy and the real life prejudices against Catholics (some of which still exist in England today with their anti-Catholic laws), the poor and the Irish.  I look forward in seeing more of the series and hope it will be around for several more seasons.
summary: Fascinating Lesson in English Privileged Class History

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: My wife asked me to watch this show with her.  I agreed to spend some quality time on the couch watching an English Soap Opera.  I am glad that I did.The cinematography is amazing.  If you aren't able to get into the story, you can sit back and enjoy the beautiful setting of the piece. The beautiful filming is quite enjoyable. Downton Abbey is a beautiful setting for any story.  It is a glorious story all in itself.  The countryside is amazing.The story lines are quite interesting studies of human nature.  The tales include lust, greed, control, and other basic human transactions.  The characters have a great amount of depth.  You get to see the good and bad in all of the characters in the story.Lastly, it is an amazing fictional tale with great historical references.  I have modify some of my views of this time period.  The placement of characters with in the caste system that was in place during the 1900's is eye opening.This series is one that I enjoy binging. I sneak in a couple of shows, until I was caught up last night.  Give it a try.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: It pains me to say this, but Amazon/PBS/CarnivalFilms are playing us for fools. Back in November, I purchased the UK version through Amazon UK to watch on my region free DVD player. I was very happy with it, but I was still looking forward to receiving my blu-ray version and watching it in high def.When I watched it on PBS, I was stunned to see (edited: a good 8-10 additional scenes that were not shown in the UK version), and the whole series hasn't even been shown yet. I never dreamed that the Blu-Ray released would not be the full version but I went to watch it tonight and lo and behold, it's the version with the missing scenes. I am returning my disks ASAP and hoping they release the full version soon.
summary: Not the version seen on PBS. Shorts a number  of scenes

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: After the first two seasons my expectations were at the highest level. With the events unfolding as they did in this set I have had to re think my evaluation of the series as a whole. After doing just that I still come to realize that this third DVD is still perfect.  As with life there is always unexpected  occurrences that don't seem to fit into your own scheme of things yet we will always, hopefully, go on with acceptances and proceed along the journey. Downton Abbey Season 3 has enough continuance of what you come to expect from this production that it brings you enjoyment and anticipation every single episode. My total satisfaction with each character has me euphoric: the perfect timing of Maggie Smith as the Dowager Countess, the complicated but deeply understandable rogue image of Thomas, the loveable Anna one of my favorites, and the many other perfectly human characters give me much to enjoy. I could enumerate the complete cast and each actor as absolutely wonderful. Not one was a poor performer; not one was unbelievable. The complete ensemble provided perfect movement to the storyline with no dull moments nor lulls. I must tell you I have watched the full three series more than once and am already set to enjoy them again now while waiting for the fourth much anticipated installment.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I purchased this series on a whim as I enjoy period movies and such. What I got was such a surprise. This series, from the very first episode, grabbed me and held me captive. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey Season 3 is absolutely wonderful so far: I had the priviledge of traveling in the UK recently, and was able to watch the original aired episodes on ITV-1.  This DVD releasing in January here in the U.S., is the original un-edited UK edition, but being released by PBS (and not Universal Pictures UK), this IS the U.S. Region 1 version, playable in all U.S. players.  It is being released in January in the U.S., the same month that it will be airing on PBS here in the States. It is currently airing in the UK on ITV-1, the first 3 episodes so far, and will be releasing on DVD in the UK (by Universal Pictures UK) on Nov 5th, so those of you with UK/Region 2 players may want to consider that.  For all you U.S. DVD players, this Region 1 DVD is coming Jan 29th!! The excellent cast returns for another round of drama at Downton: you'll love the new twists and turns in Season 3: You won't want to miss your chance to pick up this fanstastic Season 3, returning to Downton Abbey!!
summary: Ah, Season 3's awesomeness will soon be here in the U.S.!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I find it very unlikely in a Grand House like Downton Abbey to find so much drama regarding the aspects of some scenes involving homosexuality. Almost all of the servant class were vowed into celibacy and also would rarely include a husband and wife team. Kind of felt where this was going in season two. I'm done. Will be interesting to see if season three draws as many viewers as one and early two did. Then again I could be wrong, just my opinion as to what I wish to view.......... is that still allowed??????????? This was not meant to offend anyone, as I judge no one to their choice of life, nor discriminate against anyone. I wouldn't have liked torrid love scenes with the Crowley's either.  Just felt it took away the grandeur of looking into a era almost all but gone.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: When reading the "English" reviews I realized 95% of the Brits are VERY disappointed in Season 3.  We Americans are little more forgiving...thankfully!  I'm certainly not happy with the deaths of two of my favorite characters, but not enough to stop watching all together.  I'm looking forward to Season 4.  Downton Abbey is still the "Best Dressed"..."Best Acted" series I've ever had the fun of watching.The only flaw, as far as I'm concerned, is Thomas!  I have never cared for the character's choice of lifestyle, and could have done nicely without ever having to watch him "in action".  I do get very tired of him always being so mean and then ending up with a "promotion" to a higher rank in service.  Guess "PC" was alive and well back in the early 1900's too.I was thrilled to be able to purchase Season 3 before it actually played out on TV.  So now there will be a long dry spell before the "fun" begins again!  But owning all 3 seasons on DVD, I can always have a "Downton Abbey Marathon" whenever I feel the need!
summary: Still my favorite show on TV!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: We have enjoyed this Masterpiece Production from the beginning...and some of the endings of the previous Series have been less than satisfactory but this one is ridiculous....!!!! Now, how many months/years before it continues? Whatever...!!!Just want the script writers to know that  we watch the 'romance and elegance' of a by-gone era to feel good...to have happy endings but, thus far Downton Abbey has been a lot of misery..Sybil with her marriage..Enid ...another ...and the ONLY romance and feel good relationship that there was...has been killed off! oh please! If we wanted to watch misery...watch the news and most of the movies in the cinemas.I do believe that most folks who watch Downton...want to watch something beautiful and uplifting....of course with the usua limpediments..but do not kill off the main characters!! At present there is NO ONE who we are rooting for! SAD!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Sometimes I can't believe how much I enjoy this series! I could write an entire essay on how well produced I think it is but in short I'll just say:Classy characters, with phenomenal dialogue, costumes, cinematography, and writing that compels the viewer to live and breathe every human emotion, from abject pain to pure joy, with humor, INTELLIGENCE, integrity and a little romance!Some further thoughts:For some reason I can't get enough of this program and have never enjoyed a television show so much! I guess in some way it "feeds my head" in the sense that for the first time in a long time I have found a fictional serial television show that actually nourishes my mind as opposed to being just "mindless". Honestly I haven't watched a lot of commercial TV recent years for the simple fact that for at least two decades in the US serial television has really just been in a "race to the bottom" in terms of content. If it isn't just plain dumb, crass, or voyeuristic (and certainly devoid of anything remotely intellectual) it doesn't get airtime at all or for very long. All we seem to get is "trash for the masses" in the form of dumbed down filler that somehow sells advertising space. In the case of Downton Abbey there are characters that simply tell us their story in an authentic, believable, poignant and intelligent way that is so refreshing it makes me ecstatic to watch their stories unfold with every episode. I feel as if I actually want to know them and care about them. Yes, they have flaws and problems but they also have ideals, values, integrity and last but not least... self-respect! In a way I feel like this show actually reminds me that real people can be better than they are and strive to be good and not just settle for life as the "lowest common denominator". Every time I watch it I feel like I've actually learned something valuable about human behavior and what it is to be truly noble regardless of your station in life. All in all it is simply a spectacular entertainment achievement! Congratulations to the cast & crew and of course Julian Fellowes for giving us this truly marvelous and meaningful diversion!

It's worth it, why the mini series has so many different figures from the rich to the lowly kitchen maid that works there. Each person employed in the Abbey has a story,each member of the family has a story,So with so many different people there is so much going on.Maggie Smith as the family leader always has something smart to remark to in her conversations with others. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: There are spoilers to follow, but the plot is so absurd and chaotic it hardly matters. The writers just do what they feel like at the moment.OK, here goes.  I've watched every single episode of the first three seasons of Downton Abbey (some of them twice), and I'm here to tell you it's basically pure junk. The plot(s) are hokey beyond imagining: one daughter runs off with the chauffer (a radical Irish socialist to boot), another loses her virginity to a Turk who dies during the encounter, a third is jilted at the alter by an old one-armed man, a lame valet goes to prison for murdering his wife, etc.  During the second season Matthew's fiancee conveniently dies and he is miraculously cured of his inability to walk so he can marry his true love.  These are just a few examples of the silliness of the show. The portrait of the British aristocracy (particularly the Duke or whatever he is) is unbelievable (only the incomparable Maggie Smith makes them endurable). After the penultimate episode of Season 3 I thought (hoped) it was over. Everything seemed resolved. Bates was back, married, in a new home; the gay valet was going to stay, the Irish chauffer and his baby were moving into the house, etc. But wait . . . there's more. Matthew is dead and a whole new set of questions (and facile ansers) remains.As I say, all this gives a rich new meaning to "hokey." This series isn't remotely comparable to "Upstairs/Downstairs," let alone the original "Forsyte Saga."Still, I watched every episode and I'm sure I'll watch Season 4. So I guess one star and five stars would be equally appropriate.  I split the difference and gave it three.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Quite intriguing, many threads to follow with a large cast of characters, a very good web of mystery.  The English people speak very proper, and clearly and I find this a nice change for me to listen to them speak.  I watch one or two episodes each evening for pure enjoyment. The wardrobe of clothes, set locations, scenery, etc with the trains and old autos and carriages, etc...bring back a forgotten history of memorability including a life style of royalty and wealth one is not privileged to live.  The life style is detailed to allows us to see the inner workings of the servants and royalty which produce more mystery and intrigue  -----it is just a real masterpiece theater ---and one many will find enjoyable to watch ---this is what we find when talking with other people about it. We started from the first season so we could follow each character thread --I believe was a good idea----because the characters have twists and turns not expected based upon previous history and explain connections in the story.  Take a look and enjoy!
summary: a very good web of mystery

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Reviewer's Note: Though I cannot promise I won't "slip up," this will be a SPOILER-FREE review.Anyone who has watched this series - which I believe is basically... everyone, knows its sorrows, joys and triumphs. It's an award-winning ITV series penned by Julian Fellowes that has evolved a great deal in the last three years. Praised for its first season but earning lackluster reviews in its second (which I attribute to the time frame), the series returns for a stronger, but emotionally driven third season. One that wouldn't be the 'Downton Abbey' we know and love without some fun and soapy drama - and there's plenty of it!It has been many months since the house of Downton Abbey has seen such life and happiness as that of the impending wedding of Mary (Michelle Dockery) and Matthew (Dan Stevens). Butler and stickler of the rules, Carson (Jim Carter) couldn't be more proud if Mary were his own daughter - always his favorite, Carson would do anything to see to it that Mary and his employer Lord Grantham (Hugh Bonnville) receive only the best care and are never subject to scandal. Cora (Elizabeth McGovern) and the family couldn't be more delighted that Mary and Matthew are finally marrying after a tumultuous relationship and for once, Cora and her mother-in-law, Countess Grantham (Maggie Smith) agree on something. The big day isn't complete without the arrival of Cora's opinionated - and bossy -American mother (Shirley McClain)... and Cora's youngest daughter, Sybil (Jessica Brown-Findlay) who created waves of conflict in the family when she married the chauffer, Tom (Allen Leech). Accepting a tradesman for a son-in-law soon becomes second to the dreams of Edith (Laura Carmichael) becoming a journalist, the arrival of new downstairs staff, Thomas' shenanigans, scary possibilities for Mrs. Hughes (Phyillis Logan)... and financial woes for Downton Abbey.What makes this series such a success is its characters. It's been said time and again by reviewer after reviewer. And it's true; the foundation would simply crumble without them. It's the things that we laugh, cry and bite our nails over that makes Downton so distinctively what it is. Three years in, that is still the key to why this is so darn successful and I am pleased to say that even entering an age of renowned promiscuity - the "roaring 20's," Fellowes still retains the charm and (mostly) wholesome ideal. Marvels galore - from new characters and old favorites... to inventive new costuming! -will delight devoted fans of this popular British-originated and now "imported" American series.Leaving off from the second season, certain character's fates were left in tatters and in jeopardy, and others lives were finally getting on the track of happily-ever-after after much angst. I'll confess to reading spoilers and gossiping about this in anticipation with a couple of friends so I wasn't unprepared for anything that was happening in the stately halls of my favorite British mansion. There is plenty of soapy drama mixing in with tears... and lest you despair, never fear, there are events that make us smile and our hearts inexplicably happy. Edith's happiness takes a turn, ripping a page straight from a Bronte novel. Thomas and O'Brien continue to scheme directing hate towards each other. Lest you think some fan favorites are absent, you'd be mistaken; Daisy, Anna and Bates are still a familiar presence, as is Isobel and even the re-appearance of the fallen maid, Ethel. New faces also become a fixture at Downton between a besotted new kitchen maid and a vain footman. That alone creates loads of tension.Some of the highlights consist of meeting Cora's mother (she and Violet are a riot together - like she and Isobel, they are constantly at odds) as well as the characters who have evolved into something more mature and if possible, more wonderful. Being something of a romantic, I wish Matthew and Mary had shared more intimate moments of flirting and stolen kisses but being the proper British couple they are, that is kept to a minimum but seriously, as my mother said, "even when they're fighting, they are cute!" She is so right! Their interaction is darling and all too rare. Everything from the motor cars to the scenery, the grandeur of a London club to the costuming is gorgeous and beautifully puts us in mind of this era. I love the production for that reason alone if nothing else though there are many other reasons. With rumors that some of the main cast (nooo! Please say it isn't so!) is leaving and no report that there will be a fourth series (yet!), I can accept this ending but am wishing that we will be granted another series beyond just the upcoming Christmas special. So many moments were precious (including the acceptance of Tom - loved Robert's shifting attitude) and memories were made that we will no doubt cherish all of which is carried by the phenomenal cast and the emotional, witty script. Perhaps it's not as "brilliant" as when it first debuted though far be it from me to judge, but Fellowes is on the right track and for me, Downton Abbey won my heart over anew.'Downton Abbey' premieres in the U.S. January 2013 on Masterpiece Theatre. Copyright 2011-2013 Dreaming Under the Same Moon / Scribbles, Scripts and Such

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: When you're reviewing a book, you don't give away the ending. The same courtesy should obviously be given to other kinds of "stories." I can't believe how many reviewers on here have thought it appropriate to share major plot developments of Season 3, including what happens in the very last scene of the season. Luckily I just watched the season finale and came here to see if the DVD set includes the Christmas episode. But many won't have seen any of the episodes. Please show some common sense and courtesy. Think of this when doing future reviews. If you've included spoilers here, you might consider removing your review.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Compared to the previous two seasons, I found Season 3 of Downton Abbey a slight disappointment.  The outstanding production values and excellent performances continue, but the storyline has declined.  If we fans are honest with ourselves, we acknowledge that this series is at its core a soap opera, superbly executed, but a soap opera nonetheless.  During this season, however, the soap suds seemed to billow as the plot careened from crisis to crisis and heartbreak to heartbreak.  Still, I enjoyed this series and would recommend it to fans of well-crafted period drama.  And I'm already looking forward to Season 4.

review_text: How refreshing to watch a movie series that is wholesome as well as entertaining. This series gives a candid look at the culture and subculture of a particular era in time. Very enjoyable and I am looking forward to what the next season holds for all involved.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm so happy that I watched the first season when they had it on netflix or I might have never seen it. I don't have cable and I saw it there and thought I'll give it a go for curiosities sake. So glad I did, it's one of the best shows out there currently. I'm so tired of seeing all these awful, demeaning and down right dumb reality shows. I love the era they chose, so much happens and is not a time discussed enough. And the fact they have so many characters and they are able to make them interesting and real, and keep up with it all is impressive. And such wonderful characters, that I never cried so hard in my life for a show or film as I did when Sybil died. And it takes a lot for me to do so. I had to watch the whole thing with a box of tissues. In fact I was so distressed that they killed one of my favorite characters that I wasn't sure if I could continue watching. But couldn't stay away, I had to continue it's that good. And unfortunately it looks like I'm in for a lot more tears but I'm hooked. I'm ready for the 4th season and was aggravated that I have to wait til January for the DVD. Oh well, I've got my husband intrigued now I think so we may watch the first season together. I warned him to be patient because the first few episodes are slow to start but it's building the world, and the many characters and introducing you to the life they are coming from. Then....wham...it gets awesome.
summary: Wonderful Show with Excellent story and Characthers

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

summary: The best series on TV that I have seen in a long time.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have so enjoyed the first 3 seasons of Downton Abbey.  I look forward to season 4.  The entire series is beautifully done.  The visuals are spectacular from the small details of the kitchen to the expanses of life in the Abbey and down.  The characters are real and honest.  Season 3 brings joy and sadness in equal measure.  I have watched all of these seasons on my Kindle Fire HDX.  The quality of sound and picture are as amazing as if viewed on my big screen television.  Highly recommended.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: With the loss of two major stars, I wonder why t happens. Are the actors wanting to leave such a series after three series when it is so popular, or are they just being written out? I'd like to know, for they WILL be sorely missed!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What a wonderful show - very well made and all the actors play so well. I really love watching every episode!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This series is 1. entertaining and 2. provides an interesting look at an historical period with apparent accuracy.  As an American, though, what do I know about the accuracy?  In any case, it is interesting.  I rate it slightly below 5 stars only because you get the feeling that you are being more than slightly manipulated as new dramas (problems) are inevitably created with each episode.  Of course that is the necessary ingredient to keep interest levels high, but perhaps the dramatic turns are just a little too obvious at times.  The 3rd season ends dramatically of course, to make sure that you'll be there for Season 4.
summary: A Nice Look at a Bygone Era

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I am such a Downton Abbey fan - the dialogue is witty and quick.  Can't wait to see what Season 4 holds!  Even if you don't like "period dramas," you'll love this one.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Fantastic representation of the time and effects of WWI on England.  The wealthy and their views of the life before and after the war are very interesting indeed. The family dependence on the head of the family to make the rights decisions to maintain the wealth and family status is well represented in this series.  The characters seem real and you relate to each one in the story line.  I am looking forward to the new series being televised each week.
summary: I now know why Downton Abbey has my friends and family members hooked as dedicated viewers

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The art of the scenes and clothes are top-notch quality and I love watching the show every week.  The episode that included the birth of a baby and subsequent death of Sybil was emotional, and I found myself crying over the bittersweet moment of a beginning of a life and also the end of another.  My one little dislike of the show is the focus on Mr. Bates.  It is just a tad unbelieveable (in writing terms) that one person could be accused of so many false charges and go through as much as he does.  Also, he never gets upset???  I would be one raging howling lunatic to be the so-called innocent in a series of accusations.  Maybe the writers have him calm and passive because he really is guilty and is fooling everyone.

review_text: Usual excellent BBC production values, stunning scene quality and settings.  Acting is fairly good, too. That is, compared to the first two seasons, for which the story lines seemed richer.  All in all, however, this show is better to watch than about 95% of all broadcast, satellite, or streamed media.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is THE BEST series on television! I find so little to watch on the major networks, I was delighted when I discovered this fabulous show on Amazon Prime. Over the course of a week a watched the first two seasons, and the first 4  episodes of Season 3. Like a good book, I don't ever want the episode to end. I truly have become addicted and many of my friends have as well.  During these cold, dark days of winter, it was a great respite and I felt transported right into Downton Abbey. How great to leave my cares and worries behind!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I just finished the season. I have loved this series up until the last couple of episodes. **Warning - Spoilers ahead** To begin with, I do NOT like the character of Rose. She has no depth and is very stereotypical of teenagers today! And she's coming to Downton to replace Sybil I guess. Just dumb. And then there's poor Lady Edith or should we now call her Jane Eyre? Her man is horribly chained to a lunatic wife he cannot divorce; why steal a plot line that was already done and done better to boot? And now we are manipulated into feeling sorry for Thomas when most of the series, he was always plotting and evil, not being heroic and humble.To top it all off, one of my 'favorite to look at' characters gets killed off. I find, after reading a few of these reviews, that he wanted to leave the show. Too bad, but geez, aren't actors signed onto long term series with long term contracts? I also hated when Sybil died, but this was just too much. I guess when there is happiness, it's just gotta be ripped away. And really, enough of Anna and Mr. Bates. They just bug me SO much. If you ask me, he's pretty creepy, especially when he was in prison. I think we saw the real side of him in there.So, I'm done with this show. Thanks for the rather short ride down memory lane.
summary: Last season I will watch...I'm done

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: ROYLCO R2131 Bright Buttons, Assorted Sizes, Shapes and Color, 1/2-PoundI'm not a great fan of British film but I've been converted by Downton Abbey.  It begins with news of the Titanic and the beginning of the 1900's.  I was spellbound; completely taken in with the time period, awed by the fashions, the details of the mansion, the language, the way the servants lived in conjunction with the wealthy upstairs family.  Downton Abbey, the mansion, is itself a character.  I want to look in its many rooms, and am often given the chance to do just that.  Any questions you have about the mores of the time are answered throughout this series by the innumerable problems that the characters encounter.  The pacing is swift and, like a great classic book that is hard to put down, I dreaded reaching the end of this Episode, feeling as if I'd be leaving new but dear friends behind.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Episode 1 begins the season up to the minute of Mary's wedding to Matthew.  I was enthralled with the way they presented her coming to the church in a horse drawn carriage and the Valets, and all the excitement of the community people gathering around although it was an actual royal wedding taking place.  Mary's dress is quite "matronly" but very lovely, and she looked beautiful.  Matthew saves the day when he asks Branson to be his Best Man at the last minute, ignoring any repercussions there may be with the Grantham family.  Branson in the end turned out to be a faithful friend when Matthew was at a crossroads in a major life decision that would affect his and Mary's future together and the future of Downton Abbey itself.  He finally was able to show himself worthy to the Grantham family and especially to Lord Grantham himself.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Not worth the time and effort to find anything truly critical of it.  Sometimes I don't think I am in the mood for it but al ways always happy to have seen it. Witty, dramatic, snappy dialogue and even some villains who have few redeeming qualities. I admire the women for being able to be discreet rather than critical of their men, probably a much more effective  method of getting ones way. I  wish I had a helper like the sweet little girl in the kitchen. I have had very nice maids but none so truly involved.  I suppose that could become rather burdensome and if they actually paid as much attention to their household staff as portrayed, I would be quite surprise. I want to see Cold Comfort Farm for some contrast now.
summary: I think I could enjoy it indefinately

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Not as compelling as the first two seasons, perhaps because the romance between more than two major characters has already climaxed. Still, well-written, well-acted, and an interesting look into the times.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton abbey provides a fascinating look into the world - both upstairs and downstairs - of an aristocratic family living primarily in their country house.  Many stories are intertwined in a captivating look at a world that began to unwind after the first World War.  It appeals to everyone.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey, and its inhabitants, both noble and servile, is back to normal life after World War I. However, this does not mean their lives are without trials and tribulations, joys and devastation. Personal problems overwhelm the characters. Triumphs bring them joy and satisfaction. However, the post-war world is starting to change, and the aristocratic lifestyle of Downton Abbey is starting to show signs of crumbling.As in the other seasons of this epic drama, the characters are well defined and realistic, the photography exquisite and full of expression, and the costuming breath taking. Gifted actors speaking well-written, sometimes ironic dialogue make this another season to watch ravenously.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The drama/saga carries on. Characters come and go. There's always room for another twist or turn in the story. Pure soap opera but the Brits do know how to put on a good show! Well, I wonder whether sap raised to the highest pitch can sometimes partake of the same. Hmm.

I can't say I want to watch Season 4.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm not much of a TV person. I don't like sitting still, but oh my GOSH my friends wouldn't shut up about Downton Abbey. These weren't the same set of friends who watch things like the Bachelor or Honey whoever the hell that is, so I was curious. I rented one show, then another and the next thing you know, I've watched a whole season! The series is more literary than most things on television today. I won't go so far as to say it's intellectually stimulating because after all, we're talking about the lives of the English nobility and their servants. It's more of a historical fiction though and I find the costumes and the characters to be delightful and sometimes downright nasty. No doubt some might say that it's just a snobby soap opera, but we prefer to call it drama, dear.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I live with the Crawleys and their staff at Downton in the same way I do the with the characters in a book I don't want to finish. Let Downton Abbey continue for many seasons!  Some thoughts on the characters from the vantage point of the beginning of season 3...I liked Mary and Matthew far more before they got married.  Now they seem shallower--she harder, he less intelligent.  That is disappointing; I hope their characters will become more mature and refined as their story unfolds.  For me now, the central love story belongs to stalwart  Anna and noble John Bates.  But how did such a man ever get entangled with a woman like Vera?! Shirley MacLaine is simply not believable as Cora's mother.  She great fun to watch, though!  Cora doesn't seem to retain a shred of the Jewishness of her mother.  She also does not seem believable as the wife of Lord Robert Grantham.  She seems too smarmy to be loved by him.  He is a solid, good man whose depth and dignity emerges again and again, even when he learns he has lost all Cora's money.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I thoroughly enjoyed this series. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Excellent historical fiction. I watch this with my 13 y/o daughter and my husband. We are Downton addicts! The historical context (sinking of the Titanic, WWI,  and now the run up to WWII) is deftly woven into the storyline., as are the changing roles of women in society. It is fascinating to see the class system within the class sytem, as downstairs at Downton,  some of the staff believe they're beneath certain duties.Beyond the interesting historical value, the characters are captivating, charming,  and the show is a delight to watch!
summary: Delightful & Engaging Drama from Across the Pond!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is a spoiler alert. If you have not watched the 3rd season yet then don't read this review. I really liked the first 2 seasons but the 3rd season abruptly ended my enjoyment of this series. In all fairness there was quite a bit of drama in all 3 but this last one was just too much for me to enjoy and it came right at the end. I loved most of the characters but I was just enthralled with Mary and Mathew. Their relationship finally took off and was settling in with the baby and then he was abruptly killed off. I don't think I will be compelled to watch the 4th season anytime soon to see how that played out.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This superb ensemble cast continues to stun and thrill with their highs, their lows, and the days when their veneer of British reserve slips just that much.  The writing continues to delight, and the clashes between Shirley MacLaine and Dame Maggie Smith had most of the people I know riveted to their seats expecting blood.  The exposure of attitudes and mores of the period, while we virtuously exclaim of it as shocking, occasionally points a somber light on some of our dilemmas a century later.  A must-see.

reviewer_name: S d cc Dr rd as f2f discredited4
review_text: I was a "New" watcher to BBC this year. My son encouraged me to watch Downton Abby, and about 3 weeks ago I started watching season 1 through my Amazon Prime membership. I was hooked after one show and proceeded to watch all 4 seasons, watching a show every chance I had in place of regular TV and reading. What to say, the costumes, the vintage cars, and then the people. The acting is wonderful, some characters are quirky, some are mean and cruel and vile and Maggie Smith often steals the scenes she is in with her dry wit and elegant sarcasm.I just purchased season 1 for my mom, and can hardly wait to start talking to her about it. Sit back, enjoy and prepare to be transported to a time when words, spoken and written were the tour de force.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: My criticisms are only about the story line & Shirley MacLaine's character.  Regarding the story line:  There were many other characters that could have "passed on" without doing away with a favorite.  It seems that bringing in new characters is what the writer seems to focus on.  Personally, I could care less about most of the new characters & miss my favorite.As an American, I do take offense with the rude, common, flashy nouveau riche, vulgarity person that the writer seems to want classified as how those fortunate in times of need behaved in the USA.  All of the wealthy non-American characters have an elegance about them.  Even Tom after he has become used to being included.  Shirley MacLaine is a fantastic actor.  To have her "over act" and portray Cara's mother as the writer/director has done is an insult.
summary: There were many other characters that could have "passed on" without doing away with a favorite. It seems that bringing in new c

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I didn't think the creators could sustain this level of writing for three seasons.  Happily, I was wrong.  The writing is exceptional.  The acting is flawless.  This season is every bit as good as the first two.  If you love period pieces as much as I do, this is a "must see."  Though I loved all of the performances, I must give special kudos to Maggie Smith, whose snobbishness, laced with a bit of humor, is so entertaining.  Still, her portrayal does not rise to the level of caricature, but is a fully developed, well-rounded and believable character.. But in all fairness, all of the performances are marvelous. The one thing I did not like was the traumatic ending in the season finale.  What happened at the end was very disappointing.  Still, it did not in anyway detract from the quality of the show.  It was just a bit more realism than I wanted.  I highly recommend Downton Abbey. ,

It was refreshing to watch a series with good character development without the unwanted social commentary.

review_text: The writer of this story has gone too far with death and hardship.  I may not watch anymore of this saga because the last episode was uncalled for and not right.  Real life has its crises but there comes a time when life grows and becomes better unless there is something terribly wrong and evil with the people involved.  This is not so with this family.I have enjoyed very much the whole panorama of Downton Abbey and the lives of the people.  The last episode has put the story into a Soap Opera. Have it your way but you have lost this person's support for your work.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love the Downton Abbey series, which I try to catch when it is on TV.  But since I miss some episodes, I usually purchase the DVD's from Amazon.  So far they have been very satisfactory.  I give the series five stars because it is entertaining to me in all regards - I love seeing the customs, fashions, home furnishings, history, etc. of that era.  The actors are excellent and stories they tell are fascinating - always some drama going on with the house staff and family.  I know that this will categorize me as "old-fashioned," but I also like that there is good acting and wonderful dialogue that doesn't involve so much vulgarity but yet has all the elements of human nature.  I would recommend the series, starting at the beginning.

review_text: What is it with the upper class in early 1900s England?  Why do I feel so compelled to keep watching this show?  Even during so much pain and sorrow and joy.  Yet I feel a part of them. And what may be.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have watched Downton Abbey from the very beginning.The work is so good and the actors and actress' are so very outstanding that one feels likethey are right there with everyone. However I am upset about the amount of people that are being killed off. William,Lavinia,Syble and now Mathew to say nothingof poor Pamouk and Vera as well as Cora losing her baby..So I am wondering how many and who will be next in season 4 if there is one.I had wondered how they were going to get Bates outof prison.Never thought it would be as simple as a pie.A pie would never get one off in this country but it is fantasy to begin with.However a lot ofresearch must have gone on about that time of life. Being of Irish decent myself I could sympathise with Tom especialy my ancesters are from northernIreland which is still under British rule.However it was done it is an excellant piece of work and the person that said the U.S. should take a lesson fromthe Brits in making movies that needs no sex or violence was so right.Amazon has done an excellant job in getting Downton Abbey to the public in a timely manner.I have no complaints about their product.I love my Kindle Fire.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What a wonderful way to see how the uppercrust live(d), and become so involved in each character's daily life - the upstairs unbelievably wealthy family, contrasted with the poor and overworked downstairs workers who kept the mansion running in perfect order each day.  I grew to feel like I knew each character, as each individual was brought to life in every episode, and I found it hard to wait to see what was going to happen next.  Very well done, and reminescent of one of my favorites, "Upstairs, Downstairs".

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Season three was very well done until the end. The Season Finale (Journey to the Highlands) was sloppily put together, and apart from its "shocking" ending, quite boring. I understand that Rose and her family are introduced as characters that mainly serve a "social issues" function and as a comparison to Downton. That being said, they are very abruptly introduced, and I was left feeling a little confused.  By the end of this season it really felt like the writers were out to sea; struggling to figure out where their characters are going.
summary: Love Downton, but Season Finale to Season 3 is a big (boring) mess

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Remember "Upstairs,Downstairs"? The first glimpse into the life of an English Estate? Well, Downton Abbeyis even better! Covering the tumultuous years between 1906 and 1920,the 3 seasons introduce you to the wonderful country estate and the lives of Lord Grantham, his wife Cora, and his 3 daughters as well as a lively  and conniving bunch of domestics.  World War 1 serves as a distinct character, and Maggie Smith, as the Lord's Mum (Dowager Dutchess) adds the right touch of elegant irony, sarcasm, and love.  Dring the last season, Shirley MacLaine makes our cup  runneth over with her incisive portrayal of Cora's rich American Mom, with homes in NewYork and Newport.  The dialogue is earnest and never boring, and the situations often riveting. Binge watch away!
summary: The best program for Anglophiles and binge watching!
