title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey is no different than any series from the Sopranos, to Mad Men, etc, that while set in a certain time period, or (as with the Sopranos) contains very non-politically correct group of characters; might as well be set in such politically correct, "accepting", "tolerance" times.In keeping with such PC times, we have homosexual relationships included that seem to be a norm in always including them nowadays, and characters doing some Obama type speech of inclusion, acceptance etc.In the 20's, Homosexuality would have been treated the same way Pedophila is treated in an unaccepting, non-tolerant way today.While plenty of comedy films in the 1920s showed buffon type White Husbands or Lord and masters so to speak, dramas did not, yet the character played by Hugh Bonneville is portrayed in such a weak manner, much like White Male husbands in dramas today are portrayed.To me, the costumes, the cars and other scenery of the period is correct, the people/characters are not

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

Thank you Amazon Prime for bringing this television experience in to my living room...and the free shipping isn't bad either!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The beginning  of married lives, the rather amazingly fast potentials for the (new) acquisitions and loss of fortunes. Love this series- characters, costumes - excellent!  Two slight disappointments: I feel that Violet meeting her match in Martha Levinson (Mary's American mother), casts her a bit out of character- it's not like her to not have the last word! I'm guessing her philosophy has transitioned to"  better to hold the tongue (depriving others of some wonderfully sarcastic wit) than erring on the side of American vulgarity. Mary's sweet countenance is beginning to wear a little thin- hope to see a little more develop from her.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: With nothing really good on TV currently to watch, I was looking for a new series to start watching. I had heard good things about Downtown Abbey, so decided to go with that. The very first episode of season 1 started off a bit slow..but I stuck with it, remembering how Breaking Bad also started slow and turned out to be a phenomenal series. I have found that to be true for Downton Abbey as well. I got so drawn in by the characters and story lines...I would literally come home from work and watch another episode(sometimes2) most every night! I'm now on season 4 (the current season on TV) season 4 is not free with your Amazon Prime membership, you have to pay per episode, so fortunately I'm able to watch it On Demand through my cable service at no cost. This show just gets better and I don't want to see it end! It's definitely in my list of top fave shows!

I cannot believe that they killed him off, he is a very important character and I just could not believe that the writers did that.  I will still watch the next season because I love the storyline.  The writer is excellent and the series is excellent, I am just upset that this happened.

review_text: The deaths of Sibyl and Matthew made this season's story a big of a downer.  I really wondered how the loss of Matthew would affect my feelings about the drama when season 4 began. Mary needed his love to soften her and make her more likable.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is one series that I do enjoy watching. I am so caught up in the lives of these characters that sometimes I feel as if I know them personally. I feel their joys and pains. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I really love Downton Abbey!  Although the story does hold my interest the costumes leave a lot to be desired as they caused a distraction, so I subtracted a star for that alone.  Mismatched clothing, cheap looking dresses and jewelry on crooked or lopsided  necklaces indicate cheap imitations.  I think they could pay a few dollars more to get appropriate materials or rent them!I really do enjoy the entire collection, don't get me wrong.  I watch on my laptop and it's like reading a historical romance novel.  I tried watching on tv and it somehow lost it's appeal and I haven't figured out the reason.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: So much happens this season that I was happy to lose sleep this weekend in order to get through it.  Ups, downs, losses, gains, the shapes of the family and what happens upstairs versus downstairs.I was sad to finish it because there is only one more season for me to catch up on.
summary: Each season gets better and better!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The characters of Downton Abbey are like my family. This season is full of all the emotions. Those who are wondering if they should watch, get ready for a roller coaster.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: No doubt on my mind on being the best show on TV and one of the best all of time!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey is the greatest television series that I have watched in a very long time.  It has drawn me in from the very first episode.  I hope the 5th season is as well acted as the other four have been.  I am very interested in who Mary will choose and who Edith is going to end up with and also if the family finds out about her child.  Then there is Tom Bransen, I so want him to find another love. Then there is Bates and Anna, what will happen with their relationship?  Will Mr. Barrow finally meet his demise?  The Costumes, Actors and Locations are all fantastic.  I would highly recommend this television drama.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Having heard such rave reviews from friends and being a sucker for a period drama, I endeavored to check out Downton Abbey about a year ago.  I watched the pilot episode from Season 1 on Netflix and found it was "just alright" for me.Then, a few months ago, I was cruising Prime Instant offerings and decided to give it another go - episode 2 really started drawing me in and by episode 3 I was scheduling a Downton Abbey fest to get caught up to current.This show has great acting, interesting storylines (especially the back of the house intrigue) and fantastic production values.  I highly recommend you go back and start with season 1 and work your way through or you'll lose too much of the plot.
summary: Great Quality Television - Give it 3 episodes and you'll be hooked

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The commercial reviews say it's about rivalries and jealosies and such and nothing could be further from the truth.  It's a character study of many different people all at the same time---like life is.  The characters are multi-dimensional unlike most of the silly predictable rot that is mass manufactured for today's audiences.  There have been a couple silly things--like "Patrick" coming back from the dead then disappearing again,  and  the convenient death of Matthew's intended, but for the most part the story is gripping.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: OK, so the actor playing Matthew wanted out so they had to find a way to dispose of him by the end of the season. Well, they did, and it kind of worked. The series continues to tug at heartstrings, with the death of the renegade daughter in childbirth leaving the renegade revolutionary Irish guy to fend for the newborn; the expected return of the jailed wronged faithful valet; the expected muted outrage of the ruling masters & mistresses of the realm as the world keeps changing around them... These are all the makings of a well-executed soap opera that makes us love the ruling class of 1920s Britain while wondering what might be wrong with our own ruling masters.
summary: Yeah... predictable even if you didn't know

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I can often see things coming ahead of time in a TV show because of the foreshadowing that is there if you look for it. The thing about Downton Abbey is that so many blockbuster things happen that you just don't see coming. And sometimes they set you up with foreshadowing that doesn't play out, as it is a false trail.Every episode is so well done that my wife and I don't want the episode to end.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Of all the BBC drama and period films and movies, Downton is by far the Best in every catagory. I only wish they'd continue producing more of it, and I wish the old man writer who dreams these things up from his bathtub would ask me for advice on another story line episode......nevertheless....Continue Downton at all costs.....the American people will surely keep supporting it with their DVD Sales. And lastly, try to merge the series now into the WWII time frame.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I was thoroughly addicted from Season 1, Episode 1.  Even the music, with it's haunting theme and unorthodox chord progressions, stays in my head and makes me long for my next Downton fix.  The characters grow with each show, taking you on a ride through the ups and downs of early 20th century English society from both the upstairs and downstairs perspective.  Takes me about two hours after every show to lose my British accent.  Do NOT start watching this series unless you are prepared to watch it all the way through-- because you will.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Good story.  Great acting.  Nicely filmed.  Downton Abbey is a pearl.  We look forward to the next season!  Two words.

review_text: Such a great and addicting show! I cannot get enough of Downton Abbey. The Brits know how to write an excellent drama series.

review_text: Downton Abby is worth watching more than once.  If you have made it through seasons 1 and 2 you already know this.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: We've been captivated by the cast of characters and the curious life-styles of the Lords and Ladies, as well as their servants. It's interesting to watch how the two classes interact with one another. As far as I understand, from my British and Australian friends, the portrayal of this sort of historical life-style is fairly accurate. Although, one must keep in mind that the show is much like a modern day soap opera, so there are the typical plot twists and turns, as well as leaps in time. Season 3 seems to be moving right along that soap opera pathway, complete with lots of evil plotting, back-stabbing relationships, exhilarating love stories, and (of course) a cliff-hanger ending to the season finale. We love the historical setting - perfect for a romantic flight of fancy. Well worth watching!
summary: One of the best dramatic series!

review_text: An 'all star' British cast plus 'Ragtime's Elizabeth McGovern and great cameos by Shirley MacLaine as an outspoken American aristocrat who summarizes the whole clan as "narrow and pompous".  It's a rare, candid picture allowing the viewer to participate in British aristocracy's lives, and how WWI and other events of 'modern times' slowly erased that portion of Britain's lifestyle.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Having never seen or even heard of the show until this year, I was curious to see what all the hype was about.  My last five weeks was spent recuperating from surgery and I thought it the perfect opportunity to download Season 1 of the show.  Immediately, I was hooked and just finished Season 3 last night! I loved everything about it...the time period, the interplay between the servants and the family, the characters, story line,  the attention to detail in the house,  and the clothing of the time period.  I am, admittedly now, a Downton Abb-ict!  Cant wait for Season 4!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I really want to give you  5 star but left room for improvement. I am not criticizing anything, but know anything can be better somewhere. I enjoy the series as have been drawn to the UK for many of my 75 years. Was not a traveler until I reached the 40's. That was my first time seeing the Pacific ocean. Only country I have ever been to was over the border into Mexico.What I love about the series is that time in our history, that the classes were so separated. I find it so funny what snobs they are yet they don't recognize or declare themselves as snobs.I am addicted to the story and hope it goes on for many years. Love all the actors.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Like this series for the look at the time period and I don't mind drama, but in a "Masterpiece Classic" I want only realistic drama- the break down of social classes (Sybil marrying Tom, Rose out clubbing), WWI, the Titanic, the influenza pandemic, etc. I'm sick of the additional scheming by Thomas and O'Brien and how many soap opera scenes their schemes add because once one person finds out, you have to watch that person tell everyone else about it a few people at a time. Or worse, you have to watch them act awkward as they try to hide it.Even assuming real people could get away with as much as Thomas and O'Brien do, there are enough REAL drama plots in this show without creating a duo of heinous characters. I can't watch one show without feeling annoyed by petty soap opera drama. I gave up on Glee after the 3rd or 4th season because the great singing and dancing can be watched on You Tube while avoiding the stupid teenie bopper drama and the unrealistic Sue Sylvester character. Thomas and O'Brien are almost as unbelievable as her. Writers for these shows seem to think you can create interesting villains by making them soap-opera-evil and then tempering them over time to seem more human. If you're going to try for that kind of realism, you need to BEGIN with a character that is believable. Enough of the soap opera already.
summary: Sick of all the soap opera drama in a so-called "Masterpiece Classic"

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Start by watching season 1 and progressing to season 3.  It is elegant, dignified, respectful AND realistic.  A period piece both historically accurate and beautifully presented.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Great show!  Compelling characters and story despite having no sex and little violence.  The set design and costumes are gorgeous.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm totally hooked!  Can't say enough about the nuanced glimpse into the lives of titled gentry and the not-so-subtle changes they encountered from the turn of the century onward.  The attention to detail as it relates to history, culture, societal structure is thoroughly captivating and appreciated.  What many have considered a kinder, gentler time was not always so...depended a great deal upon where one fits into the picture...

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love this show so much. It's so well written and acted. It is truly a must watch for anyone!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: It is multiple stories in one. Stories of the lord and his family interacting with the story of servants working at the place. It is a mixture of aritocracy, against lower class dictums. All actors are starts especially Robert ( the lord), Lady Mary, Mathew,  Mr Bates and  Mr Carson.In a nutshell worths spending that whole lot of time.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is the best show ever and Season 3 was really good.  I can't wait to start Season 4. I hope there will be a Season 5.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I loved the whole series and can't wait to order Season 4 as soon as it comes out.  I have recommended this wonderful series to my family and all my friends.  They, too, are completely hooked on Downton Abbey.  At first my husband didn't want to watch it as he thought it would be a "chick flick" but half way through the first episode he, too, was hooked.  We loved the way the stories about the various characters evolved.  We discussed the characters as though they were friends.  That was fun as my husband only likes action and science fiction.  Unfortunately I saw on the PBS site about a major character dying and told him I was unhappy that I knew a character would be gone.  He guessed wrong.  When the scene occurred where it night happen I burst into tears and boy, was my husband shocked.  So everyone, if you don't want to know the end, don't let any spoilers spoil the show for you.  I've told all my friends to please watch the show in sequence and don't let anyone tell you anything.The acting is superb.  If you have a chance, read up on the family who lives in the castle.  Pretty interesting stuff.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I understand that this is over, but really? How can they after that series finale? This show has been the best entertainment in television that I have seen in so long. It breaks my heart to think they are all gone now. I have so looked forward to each episode; more than any other show on television.I am in mourning.....
summary: They have to come back after that final episode

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: All the series of Downton Abbey follows the lives of the upstairs and downstairs families. Each, face life in their own way. I don't know how the upstairs families usually treated the downstairs people, in real life, but feel the Crowlrys are a good family. Happiness and sadness follow equally. Death comes to Downton in series three, but new life also comes. I've adored the whole series and, for me, might be one of the best to ever have been shown on television. Should I ever meet Julian Fellows, author of Downton, I would consider myself blessed.

I guess I just hope they only produce one more season and bring it to a close.

review_text: Been a fan from the very first episode. Series is so wonderfully written you love the heroes and hate the villains. Now by this 3rd season I love all of them, even  the ones I love to hate! I am not a crier usually when I watch films but this one made me cry. I was upset for days. It is written like true life. The good guys don't always win and the bad guys don't always get caught and punished. My heart is still broken but I am still a fan and cant wait for the next season.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I have never liked "continuing TV sagas" - but this one is so compelling that I can't wait for an opportunity to watch another episode.  The acting is so good that you don't feel the characters are acting - I can think of no higher compliment. The sets and costumes are also well done - having studied history of fashion and been in that industry for most of my life, I feel I am somewhat discerning - I would continue to watch the show just for those two things.  The "love/hate" characters develop so nicely in the episodes from season 1 to season three - well written screenplay.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This show is very well done. After watching the 1st episode of the 1st season I was won over-a devoted fan had emerged.  The costumes are magnificent with great attention given to every detail. The casting is superb  although,I was sorry to see Matthew 's  demise. Many times, you could feel the happiness ,joy, pain and grief  of the characters. Every word of the script was well written and worthwhile.  So nice to be attracted to a storyline with a an intriguing plot .I am so sorry the 4th season will be ending the end of February.

review_text: This is one of the best shows I've discovered in recent years. I like that the episodes don't leave you with a feeling of anxiety or anger by the time they reach the end. Yes, there is suspense. Yes, there is drama. And, Yes, there are tears of joy.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: There is a tendency for sequels and follow ups to lose punch as time goes on. Stories get worn out and stale, but that is not the case here. The writers take tips from history and real life to keep things interesting. They do a great job of showing life from such widely different points of view that are somehow connected. If you get tired of the splendor of Downton, you are wisked away to Scotland and that completely different culture and landscape. You really get a sense of time flying by (modernity) and also standing still (tradition). It is such an interesting contrast. If you liked the first two, you will probably like this one. It has enough of the original elements and cast to feel connected, but enough variety and change to let you know that this is its own story.The only negative I see with this is the stereotyping of Americans. Shirley MacLaine's role as the loud, vulgar American is over the top. Her maid as the forward, sex hungry, inappropriate, "progressive" American is also irritating. The rest of the cast is much more multi-faceted than that. Why not give the Americans their due as well?Anyway, I can't wait for the next one.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: So, this is an awesome series, and I have really enjoyed watching it, but if I had known in advance where the story ended in the finale, I definitely wouldn't have bought it early.  I know that the writers cannot control their actors choices, but I was absolutely blown away by the two successive deaths of two major characters.  As much as I love the series and ALL of the actors, I have to say that the loss of these two characters materially changes the integrity of the story.  Shame, shame, shame on both actors for their hasty grab at fame brought by the exposure from the show!
summary: Purchased it to get the entire season in advance.  I love the series, but I was devestated by the storyline.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I can only speak for the first two episodes of Season 3, but Downton never fails to disappoint.  If you enjoy period dramas (with a bit of soapy undercurrents), you will love this series!  I think the acting is superb, unlike your typical overdramatization of a typical evening soap. Keep 'em coming....

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Of course, I love it like everyone else does.  If you like quality, historical literary period pieces, with a great story, you will love this series. title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is a wonderful adaptation of the Book.  The writers are in full swing using a script that is fast paced, filmed in beautiful scenery, clothing and the AIR of the time period.  This is a drama, soap opera that continues to keep me interested, but I can see that in the future that the drama could get tiresome.  For now it is intriguing allowing me to care about the characters...ONLY in fantasy.  When I shut my television screen the reality that this is only a program is CLEAR so there is no lingering need for me to have to...have to see the next episode.
summary: Beautifully Executed in cinematography and Richness Utilizing Cast, Crew, Fashion and Scenery.

review_text: We were huge Abbey fans after watching seasons 1 and 2.  Season 3 had some real shockers in it.  I will not be a spoiler!  This is a "must see" if you are an Abbey fan.  Only negative is that Season 4 does not release until January.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Nobody does royalty or drama like the British.  That tradition of letters, I suppose.  I've been trying to assess why this show is so compelling and special.  In a world that often feels like organized anarchy, this show idealizes and celebrates the values of community and the striving of flawed human beings for a kind of grace that's the result of people--whether upstairs or downstairs--trying to live up to their best selves, no matter how that is defined.
summary: Love, community, honor, and decency; beautiful clothes and sets; and, geat writing--what more could you want in a show!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: My love affair with Downton has ended as abruptly as it started. The whole season lives up to expectations and then the season finale bombed. summary: No spoilers, season finale was a huge disappointment

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What a magnificent series Downton Abbey has been.  For this anglophile, traveling to Britain's historical past and witnessing the cultural and political changes, the beautiful countryside that is England still, the enviable elegance of the English language when spoken by the British actors, the charm of romantic story lines, the horror of war from the perspective of a country so close to the front, the characters themselves with whom viewers connected on a human and personal level, all of it--so rich in detail, completely and utterly irresistible from its beautifully crafted writing,to its cinematography, staging, costuming, and of course acting (bringing the story to life).Like so many fans worldwide, i was impatient for the third series and pre-ordered it as soon as  it was available on Amazon. Episode after episode of Season 3 kept me up late into the night, even with work bright and early the next day.  I cannot imagine how the people in England must have felt when their Christmas Special ended with such tragedy.  It felt so contrived, so completely predictable, even as the scene unfolded and Matthew, joyful, drove his gorgeous (British) car down the lovely lane.  Oh no....i thought.  You can't be serious....yet...there has been too much happiness...oh...the truck crested the hill...I was so angry at the writers.  Surely Dan Steven's leaving could have been handled better.  Killing him off seems vindictive, vengeful.  And this wonderful series is now nothing more than a soap opera.  I am so disappointed.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: 'Downton Abbey' (2010-present) is the outstanding period drama and British-American production created by Julian Fellowes.Unlike AMC's 'Mad Men,' which also took America by storm a little at a time, and also largely by word of mouth, 'Downton Abbey,' which considers Edwardian England, the Great War, and its aftermath, was predominantly created by native British citizens, and carefully analyzes the period it covers without wholly trashing it, as 'Mad Men' subtly and unsubtly does 1960s America on an episode-by-episode basis.In an era of exploitive programs like 'American Horror Story,' which is as extreme as anything ever produced for television, and which regularly traffics in horrific amputations, sadomasochism, genetic deformity, and torture, it is wonderful to discover a series like 'Downton Abbey,' which proves, among other points, that adults everywhere are absolutely starved for intelligent, ethical, and mature dramatic fare, such as was regularly produced in decades past on both sides of the Atlantic, especially in film.Opening in 1912, 'Downton Abbey' is the story of the aristocratic and genuinely noble Crawley family, who live in contented luxury at Downton Abbey, their immense Yorkshire estate, and of the lives of their multitude of servants, who the Crawleys treat with humanity, decency, and respect.Their fairly idyllic lifestyle is rattled by the loss of the family heirs on the Titanic, and then the coming of the Great War, which turns Britain and its social traditions upside down in a thousand painful ways.What makes 'Downton Abbey' almost radical in this age is that it refuses to denigrate the Edwardian aristocracy it examines. While both Violet, the Dowager Countess of Grantham (Maggie Smith) and American-born Lady Grantham (Elizabeth McGovern) are initially shown to be somewhat priggish and short-sighted, one of the themes of the program is the dual nature of most men.Thus, homosexual footman Thomas (Rob James-Collier) is, along with lady's maid Miss O'Brien (Siobhan Finneran), initially something of a villain, but as the series progresses, even sociopathic Thomas is shown to have, or to develop, a good side.Likewise, overlooked middle sister Lady Edith (Laura Carmichael) foolishly betrays her elder sister, Mary (Michelle Dockery), but this action is shown to be a lapse, if still a serious one, in an otherwise good personal character.As a whole, 'Downton Abbey' believes in the predominantly ethical and decent nature of man. As such, it depicts both the aristocrat and the 'common' working man, such as Christ figure and valet John Bates (Brendon Coyle, whose performance dominates the first season), as capable of integrity, empathy, courage, nobility of purpose, and basic human goodness in all its forms.It is this vision of mankind that gives 'Downton Abbey' its power.Though the series has the occasional weak treatment of a plot thread--such as dignified butler Carson (Jim Carter) being revealed to have once been a vaudeville performer or the rather unconvincing return of an heir thought dead, 'Downton Abbey' usually steers clear, not of soap opera cliches unfortunately, but of the standard melodramatic treatment of them when they do appear.For 'Downton Abbey' to continue to thrive creatively, however, the writing has to remain focused primarily on the historical period, and continue to provide viewers with 'a window into the past' instead of becoming bogged down too heavily in the lives of the characters themselves. By Season Three, for example, the lame and long-suffering Bates has been put through so many sensational reversals of fortune that such events no longer seem very credible, and audience sympathy for the character wanes considerably.In Season One, the various characters appeared largely to represent objective principles as much as they were presented as three-dimensional human beings; in the opening episodes of Season Three, however, the same characters are instead depicted strictly in human terms, and the writing is far more self-conscious in every respect. Thankfully, by the fifth episode and following, the writing is the best it has been since the first season.'Downton Abbey,' in its worldwide success, should not be playing to its audience, but going its own way and forcing the viewer to make all the effort necessary to follow it.Still, 'Downton Abbey' remains outstanding on almost every level, from the writing, cinematography, set design, costuming, and score to the brilliant acting by Hugh Bonneville as the Crawley family patriarch, Dan Stevens as heir presumptive Matthew Crawley and Smith, McGovern, Dockery, Coyle, and well over a dozen others, 'Downton Abbey' sets a new standard for 21st century television, and, by extension, asks us to reconsider the lives we lead and the society we support today.All students of Edwardian England, of Rupert Brooke, Vita Sackville-West, Kenneth Grahame, J. M. Barrie, the Sitwells and others will admire and deeply appreciate this intelligent, thoughtful, and moving series.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abby is one of the best series ever shown on TV, certainly the very best that is being offered today. It is so refreshing to see that someone is still producing  quality programming today.I have now caught up through last night's 3rd season episode. This week's episode was one of the best and certainly the most heart wrenching episode so far.  The series profiles the best and the worst of our human experience--our actions and the changes life brings us.If you have not seen any of the series, PLEASE view them from the first episode of the first season. If you are an Amazon Prime member, the streaming is free through Season 2. If not, i recommend you purchase the first couple of episodes to see if you like the series. If so, you can decide if you like the series. You can purchase each season to download to your PC or iPad, etc. you can purchase the entire season at a better price than choosing each episode separately. All 3 seasons can now be purchased on DVD. Season 3 is over 1/2 over, and you can only purchase only the episodes shown thus far of Season 3. At the end of the season all episodes will be available for free streaming with Prime membership, but if you love it, you will want to purchase the entire series for future viewing. I am now watching every episode thus far in order. You will see many things that you missed the first time, or you will understand what is important, knowing the results.All in all, this is the best series being offered today! I would give it 12 stars if more than 5 were offered!
summary: The best series on TV now!!!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Normally, I am not interested in soaps, but this story is so well conceived that I have found myself truly enjoying watching this show on TV.  I missed Season 3 so I had to catch up before the start of the Fourth Season.  It amuses me that a show  depicting developed characters who are faced with realistic difficulties for their times should be such a smashing success in a medium which otherwise showcases base and vulgar garbage. Cheers for PBS and the BBC, and may the producers of other American TV stations enjoy the program as well, and learn from it.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I ignored this series for a long time because I wasn't very much interested in the genre.  Now, having finished the third season I am convinced that it will be the last of the genre for a very long time because it is so uniformly excellent that no one will try to do it again because the bar has been set so high.  Like all good stories this one makes you care about the characters, makes you hope with them, scheme with them, wish you could give the boot to some of them, and, yes, even shed a tear of joy or sorrow with them.  The actors and writers have brought to life in this drama a cast of characters as compelling, interesting and unforgettable as any of the characters you meet in a Dickens novel.  The actors are truly some of the best in the world -- the epitome of their art.  As I watch them I sometimes think "I have never seen anyone this talented before".  The cinematography and camera work is so imaginative that it makes even mundane scenes sparkling and theatrically rich.  I think the best writing, acting, directing, and cinemagraphic talent in the world is at work in this perfect storm of a story.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: What an amazing series!  I love the characters...upstairs and downstairs!  The storyline draws you in and is ever changing and ever charming.  They do a great job of balancing the story lines of such an ensemble cast.  Every character gets their turn in the spotlight. Each character is treated with dignity.  I can never decide who is my favorite....whoever is on screen at the moment!  Maggie Smith's character makes me laugh out loud in nearly every episode.  Shirley McClain is a fun addition for season 3.  I can't wait for season 4!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I normally do not like period dramas, but Downton Abbey is a very entertaining, well made, and well acted show. I like that.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I was wondering what had happened to the ever-lovable Elizabeth McGovern one evening, just after watching her in a re-run of "She's Having a Baby".  I searched her name on my Amazon Prime and "Downton Abbey" popped up and curiosity compelled me to  give it a look.  I decided to begin at the beginning with episode 1, season 1.  Now, I'm into season 3, having in the process become a loyal and avid fan, captivated by a wonderful cast and skilled story-telling.  The attention to detail is magnificent, not only as regards the abbey and its scenic environs, but also in the period costumes, particularly in the case of the sisters and their mother, as they capably model the l fashions of the day.  There's a lot to enjoy here.  Next time you're searching the channels, wondering what happened to quality programming and real entertainment, stop in at Downton Abbey.  All the family and servants will greet you warmly at the door and welcome you in for a wonderful viewing experience.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Anyone who thinks this show is teaching us yanks anything realistic about British culture is fooling themselves, this is pure fiction but it's very entertaining.  A high-brow soap is how I think of it, characters are not always consistent and no one can be happy for more than 15 minutes in an episode before some new tragedy happens unexpectedly or a sudden catastrophe rains down on their heads (often predicated by one of the actors wanting out - these Brits are much quicker to bail on a TV series that is in the height of its popularity, maybe the cautionary tale of David Caruso didn't make as much of an impact overseas as it did here).  But I really enjoyed it nonetheless.  It's no Austen or Dickens ("Bleak House" is maybe my favorite British period piece ever made, and I've seen a lot of them), but it'll get your blood pumping and make you laugh and cry, shake your head and chuckle or shake your fist and mutter "what a rotter" under your breath in a fake British accent).

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love Masterpiece Theater, always have.  This series is amazing, with a richness of character development not seen in years.  It's wonderfully written, the actors are amazing, with the sets and characters giving us a glimpse into a bygone era.  When I was a little girl, we used to 'dress' for dinner and I never really understood why...now I do. My parents were just trying to uphold a 'standard'  one they were not able to uphold for long.  I've now lived long enough to see so many 'standards' and traditions leave for a more casual lifestyle befitting the trends of the day.  How interesting it is to watch a way of life ease away. Cannot wait for the next season...why do we have to wait a full year?  Really this is just too long.  What a story!
summary: Best British Series since Upstairs Downstairs

review_text: Like most of the free world, I love Downton Abbey.  I love PBS, always have.  This program just leaves me begging for more.I went through all of the eipsodes of season 3 for most of a full day, and now can't wait for the next season, and there had better be one!!!!  Maggie Smith, as well as all the major players, are superb.  I firmly believe this program is so popular, due to the fact, there is so little quality programs being produced these days, one's that don't involve sorid explicit depraved acts, violence, language, etc.  I and apparantely many more, crave a show with class, about class and what it means to have class.Manners and class in my humble opinion, went out the window decades ago.I'm just saying, but long live Downton Abbey and Maggie Smith.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Love the development of the characters.  The shallowness of the upper crust is amazing to watch, but it is nicely balanced with the myriad of 'real world' problems that they confront. The servants' attempts at being mirror images of their masters (what a stupid word!) demonstrates the universal difficulties that humans must resolve - wealthy or not.I like the character of Cora (Countess Crawley / mirror is Mrs. Hughes) - she is a voice of reason and common sense. The episode where Sybil goes into labor was particularly difficult to watch, where Robert Crawley's reliance and habit of deferring to status actually  results in his daughter's death.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Much drama going on, not just in the aristocratic humans upstairs, but just as dramatic and complicated drama downstairs in the buzzing lower 'working' quarters. They both had luckily become kind and considerate to each other. They had grown genuinely caring of each other, without the differences in their 'places' in the household, although still maintaining and honoring the fundamental codes as servants. But the deep humanity felt as people have sustained, regardless of their stature, and that shows a lot of humiliation as a beacon of hope.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love the setting and characters and Seasons 1 and 2 - so my holdover affection for the show made season 3 episodes 1-3 watchable. However, they were repetitive, implausible, and most of all, horribly predictable.The first 2 episodes were made nearly unbearable by the gruesome appearance and over-acting of..... (no, didnt see it coming...)Shirley McClaine! She was awful - and like Lord Grantham, I was very pleased to see here depart back to America. Perhaps this is why PBS and/or the producers literally snuck the first two episodes in without fanfare or notice, never to be seen again. I started with Episode 3, but quickly realized something was amiss. I went onto Amazon to watch the missing episodes - don't bother! As for episode 3. I can at least say that the show quickly (mercifully) wrapped up the opening story lines, so perhaps the rest of the season will bounce back to its former quality and style.SEASON END UPDATE - Several of the story lines were back to top form but overall still a substantial drop off. Why they rushed to the finale by doubling the episodes was a mystery and the content of 2 hours was the same as 1 normal show - so again a disappointment. Sample nitpick - Did they somehow forget to explain why Bates was such a big shot in the prison? And without adding a spoiler I can say the finale was a big disappointment. Seems like the whole production became business and market ($$$) driven - like an American soap opera. That said I plan to watch Season 4 as this show - even with its drop - is still in the top tier of TV and movie productions.
summary: Big Drop off from Seasons 1 and 2 (so far)

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love Downton Abbey but the Season 3 was not as good as the previous two seasons.  I was also very disappointed in the loss of a major character in the last episode who supposedly was killed in a motoring accident but in reality the actor wanted out of the series.  My favorite among the cast is the wonderful Maggie Smith who elevates the quality of any production.  This is a high-class British soap opera with millions of fans.  IMO, the writers need to introduce some new characters and rethink the story line for Season 4 bringing it back up to the standards of the first two seasons.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The only annoyance we ever had while watching this series on PBS was that we never knew when each series started, since we did not watch PBS regularly, and we never saw any announcements.  Since each episode in the series builds in dramatic power, we have relished seeing Downton Abbey in its entirety, while we await the start of season 4.My wife and i began watching DA during its first season on PBS, and were immediately hooked.  Excellent, witty dialogue; great direction and pacing; gorgeous settings in the house and grounds - I could go on and on.  Season three continues the outstanding performance.  If you liked the first two series, you'll be equally enthralled by the third.If you're new to the series, then, by all means, start at the beginning - the first season sets the stage where you get to know the characters, and watch as they develop through the years.  This is not a series carried by one or two stars, such as Maggie Smith or Hugh Bonneville, but devotes sufficient time to a wealth of characters, developing their story lines, drawing the viewer into almost a family relationship.After watching most of the third season last year on PBS, we were so affected, we bought the entire 1970s series of "Upstairs Downstairs" from Amazon and watched it.  While it is also very well done and holds up well over all these years, it simply doesn't approach the dramatic power of DA.
summary: The Best TV series We've Ever Seen

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Not usually a bandwagon jumper, but these episodes encapsulate all that make Downton more of an event than just a TV show. The range of each character is so thorough, and each storyline so intricately carved; reality itself couldn't be more perfect.The overlapping story arcs of pain, joy, birth, death, anticipation and regret are all so very real - and despite the period setting,  they are all quite timeless.Bravo. Bra-freakin-vo!!
summary: Downton Abbey S3 E4-5 Two of TV's greatest episodes ever!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: The relationships established in seasons 1 and 2 continue to grow and at times amaze me in surprising ways.  I didn't notice a single change of actors in any major role.  This continuity makes the story that much more enjoyable.  My only regret is that, unlike the first two seasons, I'm now having to watch it piecemeal as are most fans who tune in each week for the initial episode broadcasts.  The dvd season era has spoiled me.  However, this is one show that I didn't want to wait for, and I've not been disappointed at all!  Waiting a week for each episode only increases the anticipation!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is BBC at its very best.  I used to watch Upstairs Downstairs decades ago.  This is similar, the lives of the aristocrats upstairs vs the lives of the servants downstairs.  Exceedingly well acted.  I am a little hearing impaired and find it hard to make out all the words because of the British accents, but the DVD has English subtitles.  Rush out and buy it.  I have already pre-ordered the next season  which will ship in Feb, 2013 (Amazon, of course.)  This is the best of the best of the best.  Need I say more?

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: This is a great series that's taken the world by storm. Excellent acting, superior dress and sets.It was hard losing Sybil, but this year the show loses one of it's main characters. As popular and excellent as this show is, I'm not sure if the series is still following the book. The second major kill-off was because the actor wanted to leave the series.  I went around two days moping because of that lol.I would like to mention that I hope someone else speaks up if they're having problems with the Blu-Ray UK version.The first two shipments from Amazon, disk 1 didn't work but disk 2 and 3 did.The last shipment, all three disks didn't work in our player. We have a large Blu Ray collection and they all play fine. I might also mention I tried a second machine and it didn't work in that one too.On the second set, I called in and had the misfortune of having to talk to someone from India who spoke pigeon English. When I explained to her what happened, she asked me to describe my DVD player and give her the model number! Then she said there would be an "investigation" into the claims I made of the faulty disks. My God! I am not trying to steal anything I want working disks! Then she read that the DVDs are for region 1/A for North America, and asked me if United States was in North America.Luckily, I used the automated online return/replace form and Amazon graciously sent out the third set. Sadly, also defective. We are now going to buy from Walmart or PBS because we know it will be a different batch of prints. We have been loyal Amazon buyers since 2000 but three times is enough.The show still has all the charm, class, and tear jerking moments of the first, I heartily recommend everyone to watch the series. It will teach us Americans a bit about how to conduct oneself in a civilized and courteous fashion. Excellent series.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

May not be for the younger generation. I say 12 and under probably won't like it too much but it should entertain those 13+!!!  I hope you will enjoy it as much as my family and I have.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I would recommend this to everyone.  It takes you through an amazing time period; the late 1800's through the 1920's. You see the struggles, hardships, compassion, and love from the perceptions of the most elite, to the poorest of poor, and how they live.  It's not only educational, it's very entertaining!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Downton Abbey was a great surprise.  I did not expect to like it. The show is not predictable, and neither is the writing, which is flawless and poignant.  And who can not love the Dowager?

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I love this series! The acting is top notch, the costumes are lovely and look authentic to the period, and the Abbey & grounds are beautiful. I highly recommend it. Thank you Amazon for making seasons 1-3 available on Prime and in HD quality.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Those who are already addicted to this delightful saga of British aristocracy, their servant class downstairs denizens and the social upheavals which eventually topple their cherished hierarchy will need no encouragement from me.  Those who have yet to savor the delights of Downton should start with season one and see what they're missing.This DVD set is a bargain- the cinematography is crisp, production values well preserved.  But I want to mention the service Amazon provided when my first order of Season 3 was discovered to have a factory defect making several episodes unplayable.I had purchased this DVD months earlier but had not gotten around to playing it until this summer.  When I discovered the defect in disc 2 I sent Amazon customer service one email.  Within a few hours they emailed me back to tell me not to send the defective DVD package back- they would simply overnight ship a replacement.  The very next day Fedex dropped off a new Season 3, which was defect-free.  The very next day!  One email.That's what I call good service!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Very good, great how the family & staff interact with eachother. Can't wait until season 4. It's fun to see how things were 100 years ago.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Season 2 had some great moments.  It did manage to exploit WWI to good effect, but it also had moments that simply were not completely thought through and a few convenient moments to get around tricky plot points.  Season 3 is definitely a step up for the writing, though the stakes are lowered now that the war is over.  That being said, it is season 3 and in British shows, that means some actors will choose to leave, which means some characters get written out with rather sudden ends.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I'm not a TV wacher, definitely not a soap opera fan. As my wife watched Sea1 Ep1, I was exposed to "second hand television" while looking over the top of a magazine. I was hooked in 15 minutes. I bought the first 2 seasons and a TV Pass for the 3rd. One or two episodes daily have got me up to date.Production values all off the chart good. Writing is excellent. There are no flat characters; are all dynamic, growing every episode. And every so often you get a glimpse into someone's soul. I know these people as well as my own family.On the downside, the British accent can be hard to understand. I sometimes have to back up a few seconds and listen again. Closed Caption doesn't work on these Amazon digital downloads with my DVR.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Do the tragedies that befall the household have to be this many this close together and so extreme?  I would prefer not.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: English Drama at its best! Great Cast Beautiful Scenery and a glance into a life that no longer exists. What more can you ask for!

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Good quality TV. Worth watching for the sets, the costumes and the literary quality. There are a few slips into anachronism, but they are outweighed by the insight into the culture and people in general.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Beyond the excellent writing and impeccable acting of the stories within the story, the main story told, is the beginning of the end of a rigid class structure that had existed for centuries in Great Britain. It perfectly defines the meaning of the "freedom" our founding fathers addressed in the creation of this country (USA). The freedom to rise as high in society as our talent and ambition will allow, no longer restricted, by our societal class of our birth parents. Yes ... Loved it!
summary: This series could be the basis for a course in social history.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3

But I'm so hoping the show can hang on to the essence of Downton that made us all fall in love with it from the beginning.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I bought DA season 3 during pre-release just like I had season 1 & 2. The set arrived before the season had finished airing on PBS here in the U.S. so rather than spoil the anticipation, I continued to watch the remaining episodes week by week on TV. I still have not unwrapped these DVDs. First of all there is the shallow treatment of the characters we care about the most, especially the lack of the development of the relationship between Matthew and Mary. Then the plotline gone a-kilter what with poor Sybil, not to mention poor Edith, the introduction of troubled little Rose, the Jimmy and Thomas theme ad infinitum, and finally the coup de grace, the season ending, which takes all the enjoyment out of watching again. How uncreative of them not to figure a better way out of the predicament thrust upon them. I was shocked and felt betrayed as a loyal fan. Except for the continued beauty of the people, settings and costumes, season 3 would hardly be worthy of the Downton Abbey legacy.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: I am an ardent fan of Downton Abbey and have watched all the episodes from Seasons 1-3. Season 3 in my opinion is not as great as the previous two seasons, primarily because I felt a lot of the subplots got resolved in a pat manner and some characters, significant ones at that, are killed off. I won't mention which ones so as not to spoil the experience for those who are yet to watch the series but some of the actors playing these roles wished to move on to other projects and so there was no choice but to get rid of their characters.I thought Season 2 was a sad season because of the war and the losses resulting from it, including the death of a well-liked character and some dramatic turn of events. However, after watching Season 3, I have to say that the current season wins hands down in being a downer. Bates (Brendan Coyle), who is valet to the Earl of Grantham (Hugh Bonneville) and is married to head housemaid, Anna Bates (Joanne Froggatt) gets sent to prison for the murder of his first wife though he claims he is innocent. For much of this season, Anna spends what little free time she has chasing leads to clear Bates' name and set him free.Downton is also in serious financial trouble thanks to the Earl making some questionable investment choices. All this and there's a wedding to prepare for, the much anticipated wedding between heir Matthew Crawley (Dan Stevens) and Lady Mary (Michelle Dockery). Will Downton survive? Lady Sybil is pregnant with her first child with husband, ex-chauffeur Branson (Allan Leech) and comes to stay at Downton for the wedding, though later events may cause the couple to remain indefinitely at Downton. Lady Edith who is always unfortunate in matters of love, thinks she may have finally found happiness, but as is often the case with Edith, things don't always go according to plan.I admit that this season does have a lot of depressing events in it but despite it all, it remains a riveting and engaging watch. I love how Julian Fellowes balances the drama of both upstairs in the Earl's family as well as the politics of downstairs. Mrs. Hughes (Phyllis Logan)suffers a medical scare, Mrs. Patmore finds romance, and footman turned valet Thomas Barrow (Rob James-Collier) displays his sensitive side. There are some interesting developments among the staff but one can always rely on butler Mr. Carson (Jim Carter) to remain steadfast and stodgy!Dame Maggie Smith who plays the formidable Dowager Countess Grantham is amazing as usual and has some of the best lines in the show. She delivers them with such panache and is definitely one of the stars of the show. I think she is indispensable to the show's continued success and is certainly one of the main reasons why I adore the series so much.The sets, costumes, and cinematography remain as exquisite as ever, and though I could have done with a little less soap opera and bad news this season, I still would not trade Downton Abbey with anything else on TV at the moment.
summary: The Dowager Countess alone makes it all worthwhile

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: Classical with interesting stories. The actors and actresses are the best. Don't know how long it can go with the current story lines.

title: Masterpiece Classic: Downton Abbey Season 3
review_text: There is so much to love about Downton Abbey--great production values, great acting--just as thousands of others have noted. The one real irritant to me is the constant victimization story line of Bates and now, his new wife. This guy has been under the gun since he first appeared on the show and it never seems to stop, with one false allegation after another. It's a tired sub plot  and since he seems to be an interesting character, I hope the writers do something more creative with him in the future.
